parable to them,

Rejoice not that the spirits are subject to you: but rather, rejoice because
your names are written in the book of life, Luke 10. 20.

The hairs of your head are numbered, etc. Fear not, little flock; it is your
Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom, Luke 12. 7, 32.

Joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, more than over ninety nine just
persons, etc. There is joy in the presence of the Angels of God over him, etc.
Luke 15. 7, 10.

To as many as received him, to them he gave power ( or the right or privilege)
to become the sons of God; even to them who believe on his name; who are born,
not of blood, etc. but of God, John 1. 12, 13.

Whosoever drinks of the water that I shall give him, shall never thirst,
etc. John 4. 14.

Jesus said, I am the light of the world: he who follows me, shall not walk
in darkness, but shall have the light of life, etc. If the Son therefore shall
make you free, ye shall be free indeed, etc. He who keeps my sayings, shall
never see death, etc. John 8. 12. 36. 51.

My sheep, etc. I know them, etc. and I give unto them eternal life, and they
shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand, John 10.
27, 28. 1 John 5. 12, 13.

If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there also shall my
servant be. If any man serve me, him will my Father honor, John 12. 26.

I will not leave you comfortless; I will come to you, etc. Ye see me, etc.
Because I live, ye shall live also, etc. He who loves me, shall be loved of my
Father, and I will love him, and will manifest my self unto him, etc. And my
father will love him; and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him,
etc. Peace I leave with you; my peace I give unto you, etc. John 14. 18, 19,
21, 23, 27. chapter 16. 27. chapter 17. 23. Rev. 3. 20.

Ye shall ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you, etc. Ye are my
friends, etc. henceforth I call you not servants, etc. but I have called you
friends: for all things which I have heard of my Father, I have made known unto
you, John 15. 7, 14, 15. 1 John 3. 22. John 9. 31. Romans 10. 12, 13.

The Father himself loves you, because ye have loved me, etc. John 16. 27.

Christ prays for them only, not for the World, John 17. 9, 10.

Go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your
Father; and to my God, and your God, John 20. 17.

God is no respecter of persons: but in every nation, he who fears him, and
works righteousness, is accepted with him, Acts 10. 34, 35.

Being justified by faith, we have peace with God, through our Lord Jesus
Christ, etc. The love of God is shed abroad into our hearts, by the Holy Ghost,
which is given unto us, Romans 5. 1, 5.

Sin shall not have dominion over you, because ye are not under the law, but
under grace, etc. Now being made free from sin, and become servants to God, ye
have your fruit unto holiness; and the end, everlasting life, Romans 6. 14, 22.

There is no condemnation to them who are in Christ Jesus, etc. For the law of
the spirit of life in Christ Jesus, has made me free from the law of sin and
death, etc. As many as are led by the spirit of God, are the sons of God: for
ye have not received the spirit of bondage, etc. but the spirit of adoption,
etc. And if children, then heirs, heirs of God, and joint-heirs with Christ,
etc. We know that all things work together for good, to them who love God, etc.
If God be for us, who can be against us? He who spared not his own Son, etc.
how shall he not, with him also, freely give us all things? Who shall lay any
thing to the charge of God's elect? is it not God that justifies? Who is he
that condemns? etc. Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? etc. We are
more than conquerors, etc. Romans 8. 1, 2, 14, 15, 16, 17, 28, 31, 32, 33, 34,
35, 37. Gal. 4. 5, 6, 7. Psalm. 25. 10.

Whosoever believes, etc. shall not be ashamed* etc. They that call upon the
name of the Lord, shall be saved, Romans 10. 11, 12, 13.

The God of peace shall tread Satan under your feet shortly, Romans 16. 20.

Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, etc. Whether Paul, or Apollo, or
Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come;
all are yours, and ye are Christ's, and Christ is God's, 1 Cor. 3. 16, 22, 23.
chap. 6. 19.

Do ye not know that the saints shall judge the world? etc. We shall judge
Angels: how much more things which pertain unto this life? 1 Cor. 6. 2, 3.

The unbelieving husband is sanctified by the wife, and the unbelieving wife is
sanctified by the husband; else were your children unclean, but now are they
holy, etc. He who is called in the Lord, being a servant, he is the Lord's
freeman, 1 Cor. 7. 14, 22.

If any man love God, the same is known of him, 1 Cor. 8. 3.

To the glory of God, by us, 2 Cor. 1. 20.

Ye are the temple of the living God; as God has said, I will dwell in them,
and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they shall be my people, etc. I
will be a Father unto you, and ye shall be my sons and daughters, says the
Lord Almighty, 2 Cor. 6. 16, 18. 1 Cor. 6. 19.

Christ gave himself, etc. that he might deliver us from this present evil
world, Gal. 1. 4.

Ye are all the children of God, etc. And if Christ's, then Abram's seed, and
heirs according to the promise, Gal. 3. 26, 29. chapter 4. 28.

And because ye are sons, God has sent forth the spirit of his Son into your
hearts, crying Abba Father, etc. And if a son, then an heir of God, through
Christ, Gal. 4. 6, 7.

Brethren, ye have been called unto liberty; only use not liberty for an
occasion unto the flesh, etc. If ye are led by the spirit, ye are not under the
law, Gal. 5. 13, 18.

Blessed be God, who has blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly
things, etc. Having predestined us unto the adoption of children, etc. What
is the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints? etc. The church,
which is his body; the fullness of him who fills all in all, Ephesians. 1. 3, 5,
18, 23.

God, who is rich in mercy, and has made us to sit together in heavenly places
in Christ Jesus, etc. We are no more strangers, etc. but fellow-citizens with
the saints, and of the household of God, etc. Ye are built together for an
habitation for God, through the spirit, Ephesians. 2. 4, 6, 13, 19, 22.

For me to live, is Christ; and to die, is gain, Philip. 1. 21.

The peace of God, which passes all understanding, shall keep your hearts and
minds, through Jesus Christ, etc. The God of peace shall be with you, Philip.
4. 7, 9.

Giving thanks to the Father, who has made us meet to be partakers of the
inheritance of the saints in light: who has delivered us from the power of
darkness, and has translated us into the kingdom of his dear Son, etc. The
mystery which has been hid from ages, etc. but now is made manifest unto his
saints; to whom God would make known what is the riches of the glory of this
mystery, etc. Col. 1. 12, 13, 26, 27.

Your life is hid with Christ, in God, etc. The elect of God, holy and beloved,
Col. 3. 3, 12.

That ye would walk worthy of God, who has called you into his kingdom and
glory, 1 These. 2. 12.

God has not appointed us unto wrath, but to obtain salvation by our Lord
Jesus Christ; who died for us; that whether we wake or skep, we should live
together with him, 1 These. 5. 9, 10.

Brethren, beloved of the Lord, etc. He called you by our gospel, to the
obtaining of the glory of the Lord Jesus Christ, etc. Now our Lord Jesus Christ
himself, and God, even our Father, who has loved us, and given us everlasting
consolation, and good hope, through grace, 2 These. 2. 13, 14, 16.

Godliness is profitable unto all things; having the promise of the life that
now is, and of that which is to come, etc. We trust in the living God, who is
the Savior of all men, especially of those who believe, 1 Timothy 4. 8, 10.

Godliness, with contentment, is great gain, 1 Timothy 6. 6.

Unto the pure all things are pure, Tit. 1. 15.

Being justified, etc. we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal
life, Tit. 3. 7.

The angels, etc. are they not all ministering spirits, sent forth to minister
for them who shall be heirs of salvation, Heb. 1. 13, 14. Matthew. 18. 10.

There remains therefore a rest ( or keeping of a Sabbath) unto the people of
God, etc. Heb. 4. 9. chapter 6. 19.

God is not unrighteous, to forget your work and labor of love which ye have
showed toward his name, etc. wherein God, willing more abundantly to show unto
the heirs of promise the immutability of his counsel, confirmed it by an oath,
hat by two immutable things wherein it was impossible for God to lie, we might
have strong consolation, who have fled for refuge, to lay hold upon the hope
set before us, Heb. 6. 10, 17, 18.

The Excellency of the New Covenant, and the Saints Privileges under it, Heb.
8. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11. chapter 10. 16, 17, 18, 19.

Others had trials of cruel mockings and scourgings, etc. of whom the world was
not worthy, Heb. 11. 36, 37, 38.

Ye are come unto mount Sion, and unto the city of the living God, the heavenly
Jerusalem; and to an innumerable company of angels, to the general assembly and
church of the firstborn, who are written ( or enrolled) in heaven; and to God,
the Judge of all; and to the spirits of just men, made perfect; and to Jesus,
etc. and to the blood of sprinkling, which speaks, etc. Heb. 12. 22, 23, 24.

Be content, etc. for he has said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
So that, etc. Heb. 13. 5, 6.

A crown of life, which the Lord has promised to them who love him, James 1.
12.

Has not God chosen the poor of this world, rich in faith, and heirs of the
kingdom, which he has promised unto them who love him, James 2. 5.

The effectual servent prayer of a righteous man avails much. Elias was a man
subject to like passions as we are; and he prayed earnestly that it might not
rain; and it rained not, etc. And he prayed again, and the heavens gave rain,
and the earth brought forth her fruit, James 5. 16, 17, 18.

Blessed be God, etc. who, etc. has begotten us to a lively hope, by the
resurrection of Jesus, etc. 1 Pet. 1. 3.

Ye also as lively stones are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood,
to offer up spiritual sacrifice acceptable to God by Jesus Christ, etc. ye are
a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a peculiar ( or, a
purchased) people, that ye should show forth the praise ( or, virtues,) etc. 1
Pet. 2. 5, 9. Romans 1. 6. Rev. 5. 10.

Ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing, etc. The eyes of
the Lord are over the righteous, and his ears are open unto their prayer, 1
Pet. 3. 9, 12.

Casting all your care upon him, for he cares for you, 1 Pet. 5. 7.

According to his divine power has given us all things which pertain to life
and godliness, etc. whereby are given unto us exceeding great and precious
promises, that by these you might be partakers of the divine Nature, etc. So an
entrance shall be administered unto you abundantly into the everlasting kingdom
of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, 2 Pet. 1. 3, 4, 11.

The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation, 2 Pet. 2. 9.

Truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ, 1 John
1. 3. 1 Cor. 1. 9.

We have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous, etc. he who
does the will of God, abides for ever, etc. Ye have an unction from the holy
one, and ye know all things, 1 John 2. 1, 17, 20.

Behold what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us, that we should be
called the sons of God, etc. Beloved, now we are the sons of God, and it does
not yet appear what we shall be, etc. Whatsoever we ask we receive of him,
because we observe his precepts, and do what is pleasing to him, 1 John 3. 1,
2, 22.

Ye are of God, etc. greater is he who is in you, than he who is the world, 1
John 4. 4.

I have written these things to you who believe, that ye may know that ye have
eternal life, etc. This is the confidence that we have in him, that if we ask
any thing according to his will, he hears us, etc. We know that we are of
God, 1 John 5. 13, 14, 19.

The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to show unto his
servants things which must shortly come to pass, etc. He has made us kings,
etc. Rev. 1. 1, 6.

Hurt not the earth, till we have sealed the servants of God in their
foreheads, Rev. 7. 2, 3.

And it it was commanded them they should not hurt, etc. but only those men who
have not the seal of God in their foreheads, Rev. 9. 4.

All shall worship the beast, whose names are not written in the book of life,
Rev. 13. 8. chap. 17. 8.

The Lamb shall overcome them, etc. and they who are with him, are called, and
chosen, and faithful, Rev. 17. 14. chapter 20. 8, 9.

And I saw them who had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image,
and over his mark, etc. Having the harps of God, and they sang the song of
Moses, etc. Rev. 15. 2, 3, 4. chapter 20. 4.

See the Advantage of Faith, Chap. 11.

See more of their Privileges in Afflictions and Persecutions, Chap. 22.

In Common Calamities, Chap. 23.

In the Glory Believers shall have, Chap. 37.

In the next Chapter, Of their Relation to Christ.

See perseverance, that the Saints shall be kept, Chap. 16.

CHAP. XV.
The Union and Relations between Christ and his Church; and the mutual Love and
Esteem each of other, and the manifestation thereof.
I Will declare thy name unto my brethren, etc. Psalm 22. 22.

Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than
wine, etc. Thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the Virgins love
thee. Tell me, O thou, whom my soul loves, where thou feedest, etc. For why
should I be as one who turns aside by the flocks of thy companions? If thou
know not (O thou fairest among women) go, etc. A bundle of myrrh is my beloved
unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts, etc. Behold thou art fair
my love, etc. Cant. 1. 2, 3, 7, 8, 13, 15, 16.

As the lilly among thorns, so is my love among the daughters: As the
apple tree among the trees of the wood, so my beloved among the sons. I sat
down ( or, delighted and sat down) under his shadow with great delight, and
his fruit sweet* etc. I am sick of love, his left hand under my head, and his
right hand does embrace me, etc. O my dove, let me see thy countenance, let me
hear thy voice: for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely, Cant. 2.
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 14.

By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loves; I sought him, but I found
him not* I will rise now, and go about the City, etc. I will seek him whom my
soul loves, etc. Saw ye whom my soul loves? I found him, etc. I held him, and
would not let him go, Cant. 3. 1, 2, 3, 4.

Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in a thee; come with me, etc.
Thou have ravished ( or, taken away) my heart, my sister, spouse* Thou have
ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, etc. How fair is thy love, my sister,
spouse? How much better is thy love than wine? etc. A garden enclosed is my
sister, etc. Let my beloved come into his garden, etc. Cant. 4. 7, 9, 10, 12,
16.

It is the voice of my beloved who knocks, saying, Open to me my sister, my
love, my dove, my undefiled, etc. I opened to my beloved, but my beloved had
withdrawn himself, was gone, my soul failed when he spoke: I sought him, but
could not find: I called him, but he gave me no answer, etc. Tell him I am sick
of love, etc. My beloved is, etc. he is altogether lovely, Cant. 5. 2, 6, 10,
16.

I am my beloved's, and my beloved is mine, etc. Thou beautiful, O my love,
etc. my dove, my undefiled, etc. Who is she who looks forth as the morning,
fair as the moon, clear as the sun? Cant. 6. 3, 4, 9, 10. chapter 2. 16.

I am my beloved's, and his desire is toward me, Cant. 7. 10. Prove. 8. 31.

Set me as a seal upon thine heart, as a seal upon thine arm; for love is
strong as death, Cant. 8. 6.

Behold I, and the children whom the Lord has given me, Isa. 8. 18. Heb. 2. 13.

Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye
have done it unto me, etc. When saw we thee an hungry, etc. and did not
minister? etc. Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did
it not to me, Matthew. 25. 34, 35, 40, 45. Mark 9. 41, 42.

Go tell my brethren, that they go into Galilee, and there shall they see me,
Matthew. 28. 10. Mark 3. 35. Romans 8. 29.

He who eats my flesh, and drinks my blood, dwells in me, and I in him,
John 6. 56.

I am the good shepherd, the good shepherd gives his life for the sheep, etc.
I, etc. know my sheep, and am known of mine, John 10. 11, 14.

I am glad for your sakes that I was not there (to the intent ye may believe)
John 11. 14, 15.

Ye call me Master and Lord, and ye say well: for so I am, John 13. 13.

Let not your hearts be troubled, etc. I will come again, and receive you to my
self; that where I am, there ye may be also, etc. I will not leave you
comfortless, etc. Ye see me; because I live, ye shall live also, etc. You in
me, and I in you, etc. Peace I leave with you, etc. I will love him, and
manifest my self to him, etc. Let not your hearts be troubled, John 14. 1, 3,
18, 19, 20, 21, 23, 27. 2 John 3. 24.

I am the vine, ye are the branches, etc. As the Father has loved me, so have
I loved you: continue ye in my love, etc. These things have I spoken unto you,
that my joy might remain in you, that your joy might be full, etc. I have loved
you; greater love has no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his
friends, etc. Ye are my friends, etc. John 15. 5, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14. Luke 12. 4.

These things have I spoken, that I should not be offended, etc. I will see you
again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man takes from you, etc.
The Father himself loves you, etc. John 16. 1, 22, 27.

Christ prays for his Church at large, John 17.

Go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my Father, and your
Father; to my God, and to your God, John 20. 17.

Jesus said, Food my sheep, seed my lamb, John 21. 15, 16, 17.

When Saul persecuted the Church, Christ said unto him, Why persecutes thou me,
etc. I am Jesus whom thou persecutest, Acts 9. 4, 5.

Ye are become dead unto the law, that ye should be married unto another, even
to him who is raised from the dead, Romans 7. 4. chapter 14. 9.

Thou bear not the root, but the root thee, Romans 11. 17.

Ye are Christ's, 1 Cor. 3. 23.

Know you not that your bodies are the members of Christ, etc. He who is joined
unto the Lord is one spirit, 1 Cor. 15, 17.

When ye sin so against the brethren, ye sin against Christ, etc. 1 Cor. 8. 12.

The head of every man is Christ, 1 Cor. 11. 3.

All the members of that one body being many, are one body; so also is Christ,
etc. For by one Spirit are we all baptized into one body, 1 Cor. 12. 12, 13.
Gal. 3. 28.

The love of Christ constrains us, 2 Cor. 5. 14.

I have espoused you unto one husband, that that I may present you a chaste
virgin to Christ, 2 Cor. 11. 2.

Gave him to be the head over all things to the Church, which is the body; the
fullness of him who fills all in all, Ephesians. 1. 22, 23. Col. 1. 18.

To know the love of Christ which passes knowledge, Ephesians. 3. 19.

Grow up into him in all things, who is the head Christ, from whom the whole
body fitly joined together and compacted, etc. Ephesians. 4. 15, 16.

Christ has loved us, and given himself for us an offering, etc. Christ is the
head of the Church, and the savior of the body, etc. Christ loved the Church,
and gave himself for it, that he might sanctify and cleanse it, etc. that he
might present it to himself a glorious Church, not having spot or wrinkle, etc.
No man ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, even as the
Lord the Church: for we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his
bones, Ephesians. 5. 2, 23, 25, 26, 27, 29, 30.

I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with
Christ, which is far better, Phil. 1. 23.

What things were gain to me, those I counted loss for Christ; yea doubtless, I
count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus
my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and do count them but
dung that I may win Christ. Phil. 3. 7, 8.

Not holding the head, from which all the body by joints and bands having
nourishment ministered, and knit together, increases with the increase of God,
Col. 2. 18, 19.

Both he who sanctifies, and they who are sanctified, are all of one; for
which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren: Saying, I will declare thy
name, etc. Heb. 2. 11, 12.

Christ as a son over his own house, whose house are we, if we hold fast, etc.
Heb. 3. 6.

Jesus Christ, whom having not seen ye love, etc. 1 Pet. 1. 7, 8.

Unto you who believe, he is precious, etc. 1 Pet. 2. 7.

Jesus Christ, etc. who loved us and washed us, etc. Rev. 1. 5.

If any hear my voice, etc. I will come to him and sup with him, and he with
me, Rev. 3. 20. John 14. 21, 23.

See the Dignity of the Church, Chap. 27.

CHAP. XVI.
Of the Duties of Believers, such as profess to be Saints.
First, Toward God.
In the General, to live to God, not to themselves; to be holy Fruitful,
walking in the Light, in an honest, heavenly, and spiritual Conversation,
worthy of their high Calling; glorify God, and mind things above.
FEar God and keep his Commandments, for this the whole of man, Eccles. 12. 13,
14.

Enoch walked with God, Genesis 5. 22, 24.

Noah walked with God, Genesis 6. 9.

And the Lord said to Noah, Come thou, etc. For thee have I seen righteous
before me in this generation, etc. And Noah did according unto all that the
Lord had commanded him, Genesis 7. 1, 5.

I am the Lord your God: ye shall therefore sanctify your selves, ye shall be
holy, for I am holy, Levit. 11. 44, 45. chapter 19. 2.

Seek not after your own heart, etc. but be ye holy unto your God, etc. Numb.
15. 39, 40.

Thou art an holy people to the Lord, etc. Thou shall not eat any abominable
thing, Deuteronomy. 14. 2, 3.

Those who honor me, I will honor: and they who despise me, shall be lightly
esteemed, 1 Samuel 2. 30.

Behold, all souls are mine; as the soul of the father, so also the soul of the
son is mine: the soul which sins it shall die, Ezekiel. 18. 4.

Israel is an empty vine, he brings forth fruit unto himself, Hosea 10. 1.

He has showed thee, O man, what is good, etc. but to do justly, love mercy,
and to walk humbly with thy God, Micah 6. 8.

Is it time for you, O ye, to dwell in your ceiled houses, and this house lie
waste? etc. Ye have sown much, and brought in little, etc. Why, says the Lord
of hosts? because of mine house that is waste; and ye run every man to his own
house, therefore, etc. Haggai 1. 4, 6, 9, 10.

Bring forth therefore fruit meet for repentance, etc. The axe is laid unto the
root of the trees: therefore every tree which bring forth not fruit, is hewn
down, and cast into the fire, Matthew. 3. 8, 10. Luke 3. 8.

Let your lights so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and
glorify your Father which is in heaven, Matthew. 5. 16. 1 Samuel 2. 30. John 15. 8.

Lay up for your selves treasure in heaven; etc. For where your treasure is,
there will your hearts be also, etc. seek ye first the Kingdom of God, etc.
Matthew. 6. 20, 21, 33. Luke 12. 33, 33. John 6. 27.

A good man out of the good treasure of the heart, brings forth good things,
Matthew. 12. 35.

They are to improve their talents. See the Parable. Matthew. 25. 14, etc.

Behold, these three years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree, and find
none, cut it down, why cumbreth it the ground? etc. Strive to enter in at the
strait gate, Luke 13. 7, 24.

When ye have done all those things which are commanded you, say, We are
unprofitable servants, we have done that which was our duty to do, Luke 17, 10.

In every nation, he that fears God, and works righteousness, is accepted
to him, Acts 10. 35.

Walk while ye have the light, lest darkness come upon you, John 12. 35.

Ye call me Master, and Lord, ye say well: for so I am, John 13. 13.

Every branch in me that bears not fruit, he takes away; and every branch
that bears fruit, he purges it, that it may bring forth more fruit, etc.
Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bring forth much fruit, etc. I have
chosen you, and ordained you, that you should go and bring forth fruit, and
that your fruit should remain, John 1^. 2, 6, 8, 16.

Herein do I exercise my self, to have always a conscience void of offense,
toward God, and toward men, Acts. 24. 16.

I have declared, etc. that they should repent, etc. doing works convenient for
repentance, Acts 26. 20.

We also should walk in newness of life, etc. Yield your selves unto God, as
those who are alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of
righteousness unto God, etc. Know ye not, that to whom ye yield your selves
servants to obey, his servants ye are to whom ye obey: whether of sin unto
death, or obedience unto righteousness? etc. Romans 6. 4, 10, 13, 16, 19.

Ye also are become dead unto the Law, etc. that we should bring forth fruit
unto God, etc. That we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in the
oldness of the letter, Romans 7. 4, 6.

We are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh: for if ye live
after the flesh, ye shall die; but if ye through the spirit mortify the deeds
of the body, ye shall live, Romans 8. 12, 13.

I beseech you, brethren, by the mercies of God, that ye present your bodies a
living sacrifice, holy; acceptable unto God, your reasonable service; and be
not conformed unto this world, but be ye transformed by the renewing of your
mind, that ye may prove what is that good, that acceptable will of God, etc.
Provide things honest in the sight of all men, Romans 12. 1, 2, 17. Ephesians. 5. 10.

It is high time to awake out of sleep, etc. The night is far spent, the day is
at hand: Let us therefore cast off the works of darkness, and let us put on the
armor of light. Let us walk honestly as in the day, not in rioting and
drunkenness, etc. but put ye on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision
for the flesh, to fulfill the lusts thereof, Romans 13. 11, 12, 13, 14.

None of us lives to himself, and no man dies to himself: for whether we
live, we live unto the Lord, etc. Whether we live therefore, or die, we are the
Lord's, etc. Righteousness and peace, etc. For he who in these things serves
Christ, is acceptable to God, and approved of Men, Romans 14. 7, 8, 9, 17, 18.
chapter 11. 36. 1 Pet. 4. 2, 6.

I would have you wise to that which is good, and simple concerning evil, Romans
16. 19.

The body is not for fornication, but for the Lord, etc. Your bodies are the
members of Christ, etc. And ye are not your own; for ye are bought with a
price: Therefore glorify God in your bodies, and in your spirit, which are
God's, 1 Cor. 6. 13, 15, 19, 20. chapter 3. 16, 17.

Be ye steadfast, etc. always abounding in the work of the Lord, forasmuch as
you know, that your labor is not in vain in the Lord, 1 Cor. 15. 58.

Whether therefore ye eat or drink, or whatsoever ye do, do all to the glory of
God, 1 Cor. 10. 31.

Be ye followers of me, as I also am of Christ, 1 Cor. 11. 1.

Wherefore we endeavor ( or, labor) that whether present, or absent, we may
be accepted of him, etc. The love of Christ constrains us, because we thus
judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead, etc. That they who live,
should not henceforth live unto themselves, but unto him who died for them, 2
Cor. 5. 9, 14, 15.

Having therefore these promises (dearly beloved) let us cleanse our selves
from all filthiness of the flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of
God, 2 Cor. 7. 1.

Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but in the
sight of men, 2 Cor. 8. 20. 1 Timothy 2. 2. Hebr. 13. 18.

Walk in the spirit, and ye shall not fulfill ( or, fulfill not) the lust of the
flesh, Gal. 5. 16, 17.

Be not deceived, God is not mocked: for whatsoever a man sows, that shall he
also reap. For he who sows to the flesh, shall of the flesh reap corruption:
but he who sows to the spirit, shall of the spirit reap life, etc. For in
Christ Jesus neither circumcision avails any thing, etc. but a new creature,
etc. Gal. 6. 7, 8, 15. chapter 5. 16.

According as he has chosen us in him, etc. that we should be holy, and
without blame, before him in love, Ephesians. 1. 4.

Created, etc. unto good works which God has foreordained, that we should walk
in them, Ephesians. 2. 10. Titus 2. 14.

I therefore, etc. beseech you, that ye walk worthy of the vocation wherewith
ye are called, etc. This I say therefore, and testify in the Lord, that ye
henceforth walk not as other Gentiles in the vanity of their mind, etc. But ye
have not so learned Christ, etc. That ye put off concerning the former
conversation, the old man which is corrupt according to deceitful lusts: And be
renewed in the spirit of your minds; and that ye put on that new man. which
after God, is created in righteousness, and true holiness, Ephesians. 4. 1, 17, 20,
22, 23, 24. Col. 3. 9, 10.

Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children, etc. Ye were sometimes
darkness, but now light in the Lord: Walk as children of the light, etc. Have
no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them,
etc. See then that ye walk circumspectly, not as Fools, redeeming the time,
Ephesians. 5. 1, 8, 11, 15, 16.

That ye may approve things which differ ( or try things which are excellent)
that ye be sincere, and without offense, till the day of Christ, etc. Being
filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the
glory and praise of God, etc. According to my earnest expectation, etc. Christ
shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life or by death, etc. Let your
conversation be as becomes the Gospel of Christ, Phil. 1. 10, 11, 20, 27.

Work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, etc. That ye be blameless
and harmless, the sons of God without rebuke, in the midst of a crooked and
perverse nation, among whom ye shine ( or, shine ye) as lights in the world,
etc. All seek their own things, not the things of Jesus Christ, Phil. 2. 12,
15, 21.

Brethren, be ye followers of me, and mark them who walk so, as ye have us for
an ensample: for many walk, of whom I have told you, etc. even weeping, the
enemies of the cross of Christ, etc. who mind earthly things: for our
conversation is in heaven, Phil. 3. 17, 18, 19, 20. 1 Cor. 11. 1.

Finally brethren, whatsoever things are true, whatsoever things honest,
whatsoever things just, whatsoever things pure, whatsoever things lovely,
whatsoever things of good report: if there be any praise, think on these
things. Those things which ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and
seen in me, do, etc. Phil. 4. 8, 9.

That ye might walk worthy of the Lord, unto all pleasing, being fruitful in
every good work, Col. 1. 10. 2 These. 1. 11.

If ye then be risen with Christ, seek those things which are above, etc. Set
your affections on things above, not on things on the earth, etc. Mortify
therefore your members which are upon earth, fornication, etc. Col. 3. 1, 2, 5.

Walk in wisdom toward them who are without, redeeming the time, etc. That ye
may stand perfect, and complete in all the will of God, etc. Col. 4. 5, 12.

That ye would walk worthy of God, who has called you unto his kingdom, 1 Thessalonians. 2. 12.

We exhort you, by the Lord Jesus, that as ye have received of us, how ye ought
to walk, and to please God; so ye would abound more and more, etc. For this is
the will of God, your sanctification, etc. That every one of you should know
how to posses his vessel in sanctification, and honor, etc. For God has not
called us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness, 1 These. 4. 1, 3, 4, 7.

Now the very God of peace sanctify you wholly, and your whole spirit, and
soul, and body be preserved blameless, unto the coming of our Lord, 1 These. 5.
23.

The end of the commandment is charity from a pure heart, a good conscience and
faith unfeigned, 1 Timothy 1. 5.

Exercise thy self to godliness, etc. Godliness is profitable to all things,
having promise of this, etc. 1 Timothy 4. 7, 8. chapter 2. 2. chapter 6. 6.

Thou, O man of God, etc. Follow after righteousness, godliness, etc. 1 Timothy 6.
6, 11.

Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 22.

For the Grace of God that brings salvation, etc. teaches us, that denying
ungodliness and wordly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly in
this present world, Titus 2. 11, 12.

Put them in mind, etc. to be ready to every good work, etc. A faithful saying,
and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have
believed in God, might be careful to maintain good works, Titus 3. 1, 8.

Let us lay aside every weight, and the sin which does so easily beset us, and
let us run with patience the race that is set before us, etc. Follow peace,
etc. and holiness, without which no man shall see the Lord, Hebr. 12. 1, 14.

Who is a wise man? etc. Let him show out of a good conversation, his works
with meekness of wisdom, James 3. 13.

As obedient children, not fashioning your selves according to the former
lusts, in your ignorance: but as he who has called you is holy, so be ye holy
in all of manner conversation; because it is written, Be ye holy, for I am
holy, 1 Pet. 1 14, 15.

Ye are a chosen generation, etc. that ye should show forth the praises of him
who has called you, etc. Abstain from fleshly lust which war against the soul,
having your conversation honest amongst the Gentiles, that whereas ( or,
wherein) they speak against you as evil doers, they may by your good works
which they behold, gloruie God in the day of visitation, etc. So is the will of
God, that with well doing ye may, etc. We being dead unto sin should live unto
righteousness, 1 Pet. 2. 9, 11, 12, 15, 24. 1 Timothy 5. 14. Titus 2. 5, 1.

Let him eschew evil, and do good, etc. Who is he who will harm you, if you be
followers of that which is good? etc. Sanctify the Lord in your hearts, and be
always ready to give an answer to every man who asks you a reason of the hope
that is in you, with meekness and fear; having a good conscience; that whereas
they speak evil of you, as of evil doers, they may be ashamed who falsely accuse
your good conversation in Christ, 1 Pet. 3. 11, 13, 15, 16.

The time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the
Gentiles, etc. If any man minister, etc. that God in all things may be
glorified through Jesus Christ, 1 Pet. 4. 2, 3, 6, 11.

Giving all diligence, add to your faith virtue, and to virtue knowledge, and
to knowledge temperance, etc. godliness, etc. If these things be in you, and
abound, it shall effect that you shall not be unfruitful, etc. Give diligence
to make your calling and election sure, 1 Peter 1. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10.

Seeing that all these things shall be dissolved, what manner of persons ought
ye to be, in all holy conversation and godliness? etc. Wherefore beloved,
seeing ye look for such things, be diligent, that ye may be found of him in
peace without spot or blemish, 2 Pet. 3. 11, 14.

God is light, etc. If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in
darkness, we lie, and do not the truth; but if we walk in the light, as he is
in the light, etc. 1 John 1. 5, 6, 7.

These things write I unto you, that ye sin not. And if any man sin, we have an
advocate, etc. He who says, he abides in him, ought himself also to walk,
even as he walked, 1 John 2. 1, 6.

Every man who has this hope in him, purifieth himself, even as he is pure,
etc. He who does righteousness, is righteous, even as he is righteous, 1 John
3. 7.

Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good: He who does
good is of God, but he who does evil has not seen God, John 3. 11.

In Particular.
I. To love God, and the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ.
I The Lord thy God, etc. showing mercy unto thousands of them who love me,
Exodus 20. 6.

The Lord our God, one Lord. And thou shall love the Lord thy God, with all
thine heart, with all thy soul, and with all thy might, Deuteronomy. 6. 4, 5.

The Lord thy God, he is God, the faithful God; who keeps covenant and mercy
with them that love him, Deuteronomy. 7. 9.

And now, Israel, what does God require of thee, but, etc. to love him, and to
serve the Lord thy God, with all thy heart, and with all thy soul? Deuteronomy. 10. 12.

Therefore thou shall love the Lord thy God, etc. If you shall hearken, etc. to

etc. Deuteronomy. 11. 3, 13, 22.

The Lord your God proves you, to know whether ye love the Lord your God with
all your heart, and with all your soul, Deuteronomy. 13. 3.

6.

Joshua 22. 5.

Oh, love the Lord, all ye saints, etc. Psalm. 31. 23.

1. 3, 4.

Iniquity shall abound; the love of many shall wax cold, Matthew. 24. 12.

Peter, etc. love thou me more than these? He says unto him, Yea, Lord; thou

16, 17.

The love of God is shed abroad in our hearts, by the Holy Ghost, Romans 5. 5.

If any man love God, the same is known of him, 1 Cor. 8. 3.

Though I speak with the tongue of men and angels, and have not charity, I am
become as sounding brass, or a tinkling cymbal. And though I have the gift of
prophecy, and understand all mysteries, etc. I have all faith, etc. and have
not charity, I am nothing. And though I bestow all my goods to seed the poor,
and though I give my body to be burned, and have no charity, it profits me
nothing, etc. Charity never fails, etc. Now abides faith, hope, charity: but
the greatest of these is charity, 1 Cor. 13. 1, 2, 3, 8, 13.

If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha, 1
Cor 16. 22.

Whether we are besides our selves, it is to God, etc. for the love of Christ
constrains us, 2 Cor. 5. 13, 14.

Circumcision avails nothing, etc. but faith, which works by love, etc. The
fruit of the spirit is love, Gal. 5. 6, 22.

The Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, 2 These. 3. 5.

Hearing of thy love, etc. which thou have toward the Lord Jesus, etc. Philem.
Verse. 5.

God is not unrighteous, to forget your work, and labor of love, which ye have
showed toward his name, Heb. 6. 10.

Jesus Christ, whom having not seen, ye love, 1 Pet. 1. 7, 8.

God is love; and he who dwells in love, dwells in God, and God in him,
etc. There is no fear in love, but perfect love casts our fear, etc. He who
fears, is not made perfect in love. We love him, because he first loved us.
If any man say, I love God, and hates his brother, he is a liar: for he who
loves not his brother, whom he has seen; how can he love God, whom he has
not seen? 1 John 4. 16, 17, 18, 19, 20.

By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, etc. 1
John 5. 2.

I have something against thee, because thou have left thy first love: remember
therefore from whence thou art fallen, etc. Rev. 2. 4, 5.

As Fruits of Love to God and Christ. To delight themselves in him; long for,

I. To delight in, long for, pant after, make their Boast of, glory and rejoice

The Eunuch went on his way, rejoicing, Acts 8. 38, 39.

By whom also we have access by faith, into this grace wherein we stand; and

Rejoicing in hope, Romans 12. 12.

Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, Romans 15. 13.

Our consolation also abounds by Jesus Christ, 2 Cor. 1. 5.

Now thanks be to God, who always causes us to triumph in Christ, 2 Cor. 2. 14.

God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ,

My brethren, rejoice in the Lord, etc. We are the circumcision, etc. who

Rejoice in the Lord always; and again I say, rejoice, etc. And the peace of

Philip. 4. 4, 7.

Rejoice evermore, 1 These. 5. 16.

That by two immutable things, wherein it is impossible for God to lie, we

hope set before us, Heb. 6. 18.

In whom, though now ye see not, yet believing, ye rejoice with joy
unspeakable, and full of glory, 1 Pet. 1. 8. 1 John 1. 4.

II. To obey and hearken to the Laws and Word of God, in Christ.
THere is one Lawgiver, who is able to save, and to destroy, James 4. 12.

Now the Lord had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy
kindred, and from thy father's house, unto a land I will show thee, etc. So
Abram departed, as the Lord had spoken unto him, Genesis 12. 1, 4, 5. Heb. 11. 8.

So in putting away Ishmael and Hagar, Genesis 21. 11, 11, 13, 14.

God said unto Abraham, Take now thy son, thine only Isaac, whom thou love,

In thy seed shall all the nations of the earth be blessed: because that

God bid Moses go; and said, he would be with his mouth, etc. He refused: God

Thus did the children of Israel: as the Lord commanded Moses and Aaron, so did

Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed, and keep my covenant, then ye

Hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments: He who says,

Whom ye ignorantly worship, him declare I unto you. God who made the world and
all things therein, seeing that he is Lord or heaven and earth, dwells not in

After the way they call heresy, so worship I the God of my fathers, Acts 24.
14.

God whom I serve with my spirit, etc. The invisible things of him from the
creation of the world, are clearly seen, being understood by the things which
are made, his eternal power and Godhead: so that they were without excuse;
because that when they knew God, they glorified him not as God, etc. but became
vain, etc. Changed the truth of God into a lie, and served and worshipped the

Believe, embrace, and be found in the Practice of nothing, in the things of
God, and about his Worship, but that which clearly (according to Precepts,
Rules, and Examples of the Scriptures) appears to be Christ's mind, upon which
we can in Faith expect acceptance.
AND Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord, and all the

closet; and when thou have shut the door, pray to thy Father, etc. and when ye
pray, use not vain repititions as the heathens do: for they think, that they
shall be heard for their much speaking, etc. Your Father knows what things ye
have have need of before ye ask them; after this manner therefore pray ye: Our
Father, etc. Matthew. 6. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13. Luke 11. 1, 2, etc.

Ask and it shall be given you: seek and ye shall find: knock and it shall be
opened unto you: for every one who asks receives, etc. What man is there
among you, who if his son ask bread will he give him a stone? etc. If ye then
being evil know how to give good gifts unto your children, how much more shall
your Father which is in heaven, give good things unto them who ask him? Matthew.
7. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11. Luke 11. 9, 10, 11, 12, 13.

30.

If two of you shall agree on earth, as touching any thing that they shall ask,

All things are naked and open unto the eyes of him with whom we have to do,

To trust in God, and in none else, in all Cases: The Arguments thereto.
I. Not in any else.
THE Babel builders trusted to a City and Tower for their security, but God
scattered them, Genesis 11. 1, 2, etc.

There is none besides thee, neither is there any rock like unto God, 1 Samuel 2.
2.

Because thou have relied on the King of Affyria, and not relied on the Lord
thy God; therefore is the host of the King of Syria escaped out of thy hands,
etc. Asa in his Disease sought not to the Lord, but to the Physicians, 2 Chronicles.
16. 7, 12.

I would seek unto God, unto him would I commit my cause, Job 5. 8.

There is no king saved by the multitude of an host. A mighty man is not
delivered by much strength. A horse is a vain thing for safety; neither shall
he deliver by his great strength, Psalm 33. 16, 17. Isa. 31. 1, 3. Job 15. 31.
Psalm 20. 7.

I will not trust in my bow, nor shall my sword save me: Thou have saved, Psalm
44. 6, 7.

They who trust in their wealth, and boast themselves in the multitude of their
riches: None can by any means redeem his brother, nor give to God a ranson for
him, etc. that he should live for ever, Psalm 49. 6, 7, 9. Ezekiel. 7. 19.

Lo, this is the man who made not God his strength; but trusted in the
abundance of his riches, and. But I trusted in the mercy of God for ever, Psalm.
52. 7, 8.

Give us help from trouble, for vain is the help of man, Psalm. 60. 11.

Surely, men of low degree are vanity, men of high degree a lie: to be said in
the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity. Trust not in oppression,
etc. Psalm. 62. 9, 10.

Put not your trust in princes, nor in the sons of men, in whom is no help; his
breath goes forth, he turns to his earth; in that very day his thoughts
perish, Psalm. 146. 3, 4. Psalm 118. 8, 9.

He who trusted unto his riches, shall fall, Prove. 11. 28.

He who trusts in his own heart, is a fool, Prove. 28. 26.

Create from man whose breath is in his nostrils: for wherein is he to be
accounted of? Isa. 2. 22.

What will ye do in the day of your visitation? etc. to whom will ye flee for
help? etc. Isa. 10. 3, 4. chapter 20. 6.

Thou did not look in that day unto the armor of the house of the forest,
etc. ye made also a ditch between the two walls, etc. But ye have notlooked
unto the maker thereof Isa. 22. 8, 9, 10, 11.

Woe unto the repellious children, etc. who take counsel, but not of me, etc.
who walk to go down to Egypt, and have not asked at my mouth; to strengthen
themselves in the strength of Pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of Egypt.
Therefore shall the strength of Pharaoh be your shame, and the trust in the
shadow of Egypt confusion; etc. For the Egyptians shall help in vain, and to no
purpose, etc. Their strength is to ^it still, etc. No, we will flee upon
horses; therefore shall ye flee, etc. Isa. 30. 1, 2, 3, 5, 7, 15, 16, 17. chapter
1. 23, 29, etc.

Woe to them who go to Egypt, etc. Stay on horses and trust in chariots, because
many, etc. Isa. 31. 1, 3.

Thou have trusted in thy wickedness: thou have said, None sees, etc. Thou
have said in thine heart, I am, and none else besides me, etc, Stand now with
thine enchantments, etc. let them stand up and save thee, etc. Behold, they
shall be as stuble, etc. None shall save thee, Isa. 47. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15.

Let thy companions deliver thee: but the wind shall carry them all away:
vanity shall take them, Isa. 57. 13.

Truly, in vain is salvation hoped for from the hills, and from the multitudes
of mountains, etc. Jer. 3. 23.

Trust ye not in lying words, saying, The temple of the Lord, etc. Jer. 7. 4.

Trust ye not in any brother, for every brother will utterly supplant, Jer. 9.
4, 5.

This is thy portion, etc. because thou have forgotten me, and trusted in
falsehood: Therefore still I discover thy skirts upon thy face, etc. Jer. 13.
25, 26.

Thus says the Lord, Cursed be the man who who trusts in man, and makes
flesh his arm, and whose heart departs from God; for he shall be like the
heath in the desert, etc. Jer. 17. 5, 6.

For because thou have trusted in thy works, and in thy treasures, thou shall
also be taken, etc. Jer. 48. 7.

Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, etc. O backsliding daughter, who
trustest in her treasures, saying, Who shall come unto me? Behold, I will bring
fear upon thee, says the Lord of host, Jer. 49. 4, 5, 16.

As for us, our eyes as yet failed for our vain hope in our watching: we have
watched for a nation which could not save us, Lam. 4. 17.

Egypt shall know, etc. because they have been a staff of reed to the house of
Israel. When they took hold of thee by thy hand, thou did break and rent all
their shoulders: And when they leaned upon thee, thou breakest all their loins,
etc. Ezekiel. 29. 6, 7. Isa. 20. 5, 6.

They shall know that I am the Lord, when I have set a fire in Egypt; and when
all her helpers shall be destroyed, Ezekiel. 30. 8.

Ephraim also is like a silly dove without heart: they call to Egypt, they go
to Assyria; when they shall go, I will spread my net upon them, I will bring
them down, etc. Woe unto them, for they have fled from me, Hosea 7. 11, 12, 13.
Jer. 2. 36, 37.

Ephraim feeds upon wind, etc. they do make a covenant with the Assyrians,
etc. Hosea* 12. 1.

Woe unto them who are at ease ( or, secure) in Zion, and trust in the mountains
of Samaria, Amos 6. 1.

Trust ye not in a friend, put ye not confidence in a guide; keep the door of
thy mouth from her who lies in thy bosom. For the son dishonors the father,
etc. Micah 7. 5, 6.

Charge them who are rich, etc. that they trust not in uncertain riches, etc. 1 Timothy 6. 17.

We had the sentence of death in our selves, that we should not trust in our
selves, 2 Corin. 1. 9.

II. In God alone, a suitable Object.
GOD said, Let their be light, and there was light, etc. Genesis 1. 3, 6, 9, etc.

When Sarah doubted of the promise, because of her age: The Lord said to
Abraham, Wherefore did Sarah laugh, saying, Shall I of surety bear a child,
which am old? Is any thing too hard for the Lord? Genesis 18. 12, 13, 14. Luke 1.
37.

When Hagar was fainting, and thought there was no way but death with her
child, God showed her a well of water, etc. Genesis 21. 15, 16, 17, 18, 19.

When Joseph's Brethren had conspired to kill him, God works for his
deliverance, Genesis 37. 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 23, etc.

When God was sending Moses upon a great Work, Moses, said unto the Lord, O my
Lord, I am not eloquent, etc. but I am slow of speech, etc. And the Lord said
unto him, Who has made man's mouth? Or who makes the dumb, or the deaf, or
the seeing, or the blind? Have not I the Lord? Now therefore go, and I will be
with thy mouth, etc. Exodus 4. 10, 11, 12.

And Moses said unto the people, Fear ye not; stand still, and see the
salvation of the Lord, which he will show to you to day, etc. the Lord shall
fight for you, etc. And the Angel of God, which went before the camp, removed,
and went behind them, between the camp of the Egyptians, and the camp of
Israel, etc. Led them through the Red Sea, Exodus 14. 13, 14, 19, 20, 21, 22.

The Lord shall reign for ever and ever, Exodus 15. 18.

The Lord, etc. proclaimed the name of the Lord: The Lord, the Lord God;
merciful and gracious, long-suffering, and abundant in goodness and truth;
keeping mercy for thousands; forgiving iniquity, transgression and sin, etc.
Exodus 34. 5, 6, 7.

And Moses said, The people, amongst whom I am, are six hundred thousand, etc.
Shall the flocks and the herds be slain for them, to suffice them? Or shall all
the fish of the sea be gathered together for them? etc. And the Lord said unto
Moses, Is the Lord's hand waxed short? Thou shall see, etc. Numb. 11. 21, 22,
23.

God is not a man, that he should lie: neither the son of man, that he should
repent. Has he said, and shall he not do? Or has he spoken, and shall he not
make it good? Behold, etc. he has blessed, and I cannot reverse it, Heb. 6.
18. Numb. 23. 19, 20. Tit. 1. 2.

What god is there in heaven or earth, that can do according to thy works, and

Unto thee it was showed, that thou might know that the Lord, he is God:
there is none else besides him, etc. Deuteronomy. 4. 35, 39.

Know therefore, that the Lord thy God, he is God, the faithful God; who

Their rock is not as our Rock, the enemies themselves being judges, etc. See

There is none like unto the God of Jesurun, who rides upon the heaven for thy

Hereby ye shall know that the living God is among you, etc. Josh. 3. 10.

There is none besides thee; neither is there any rock like our God, etc. The

That ye might learn in us not to think above that which is written, that no

To be moderate, meek, patient and quiet in all things: And the Encouragement
thereto.
SImeon and Levi are brethren, instruments of cruelty, ( or, their swords are
weapons of violence:) O my soul, come not thou into their secret, etc. for in
their anger they slew a man; and in their self-will they dug down a wall.
Cursed be their anger, for it was fierce: and their wrath, for it was cruel,
Genesis 49. 5, 6, 7. Genesis 34. 2^, 26, 27.

Now the man Moses was very meek, above all the men upon the face of the earth,

When Eli had charged Hannah with Drunkenness, she meekly answered, No, my

David had rashly and hastily resolved to have avenged himself upon Nabal, and

With the froward thou will show thy self unsavory, ( or thou will wrestle,) 2 Samuel 22. 27.

The meek shall eat, and be satisfied, Psalm. 22. 26.

The meek will he guide in judgment, and the meek will he teach his way, Psalm.

The earth feared, etc. when God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the

Put away from thee a froward mouth: and perverse lips put far, Prove. 4. 24.

They who are of a froward heart, are an abomination to the Lord, Prove. 11. 20.

A fool's wrath is presently known: but a wise man hides shame, Prove. 12. 16.

On^y by pride comes contention: but with the well-advised is wisdom, Prev.
13. 10.

He who is soon angry, deals foolishly, etc. He who is slow to wrath, is of
great understanding: but he who is hasty ( or short) of spirit, exalts folly,
Prove. 14. 17, 29.

A soft answer turns away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger, etc. A
wrathful man stirs up strife: but he who is slow to anger, appeaseth strife,
Prove. 15. 1, 18.

A froward man sows strife, etc. He who is slow to anger, is better than the
mighty: and he who rules his spirit, than he who takes a city, Prove. 16. 28,
32. chapter 25. 28.

The beginning of strife is as the letting out of water, etc. He who has a
froward heart, finds no good: and he who has a perverse tongue, falls into
mischief, Prove. 17. 14, 20.

The discretion of a man deferreth anger: his glory to pass over a
transgression, etc. A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou
deliver him, yet thou must do it again, Prove. 19. 11, 19.

It is an honor to a man, to cease from strife: but every fool will be
meddling, Prove. 20. 3.

Make no friendship with an angry man: and with a furious man thou shall not
go, Prove. 22. 24.

As coals to burning coals, and wood to fire, so is a contentious man to kindle
strife, Prove. 26. 21.

A stone is heavy, etc. but a fool's wrath is heavier, etc. Wrath is cruel, and
anger is outrageous: but who is able to stand before envy, ( or jealousy?)
Prove. 27. 3, 4.

He who is of a proud heart, stirs up strife, Prove. 28. 25.

Wise men turn away wrath, etc. See thou a man who is hasty in his words, (
or matters?) there is more hope of a fool, than of him, etc. An angry man
stirs up strife; and a furious man abounds in transgression, Prove. 29. 8,
20, 22.

Better, etc. the patient in spirit, than the proud in spirit. Be not hasty in
thy spirit to be angry; for anger rests in the bosom of fools, Eccles. 7. 8,
9.

The meek also shall increase ( or add to) their joy in the Lord, Isa. 29. 19.

Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth, etc. Blessed are the

Behold, thy King comes unto thee, meek, etc. Matthew. 21. 5.

In your patience, possess ye your souls, Luke 21. 19.

Who will render unto every man according unto his deeds: to them who by
patient continuing in well-doing, seek for glory, etc. eternal life, Romans 2. 7.

Tribulation works patience; and patience, experience; and experience, hope,
etc. Romans 5. 3, 4, 5.

If it be possible, as much as lies in you, live peaceably with all men.
Dearly beloved, avenge not your selves, but rather give place unto wrath: for
it is written, Vengeance is mine, etc. Be not overcome of evil. Romans 12. 18,
19, 21.

Let us therefore follow after the things which make for peace; Romans 14. 19.

Charity suffers long, and is kind: charity envieth not, etc is not easily
provoked, etc. 1 Cor. 13. 4, 5.

The fruits of the flesh, etc. are wrath, strife, etc. but the fruits of the
spirit are peace, long-suffering, gentleness, etc. meekness, temperance, etc.
Gal. 5. 20, 22, 23.

If any man be overtaken in a fault, ye who are spiritual, restore such a one
in the spirit of meekness; considering, etc. Gal. 6. 1.

Walk worthy of the vocation wherewith ye are called, with all lowliness and
meekness; with long-suffering, forbearing. Be ye angry, and sin not: let not
the sun go down upon your wrath, neither give place to the devil, etc. Let all
bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamor, and evil-speaking be put away
from you, with all malice, Ephesians. 4. 1, 2, 26, 27, 31.

Let your moderation be known unto all men: the Lord is at hand, Philip. 4. 5.

That ye walk worthy of the Lord, etc. strengthened with all might, according
unto his glorious power, unto all patience and long-suffering, Col. 1. 10, 11.

But now you also put off all these, anger, wrath, malice, etc. put on
meekness, long-suffering, forbearing one another, Col. 3. 8, 12.

Be patient toward all men, 1 These. 5. 14.

But thou, O man of God, etc. follow after, etc. patience, meekness, 1 Timothy 6.
11. 2 Timothy 3. 10.

The servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, etc.
patient, ( or forbearing,) in meekness instructing those who oppose themselves,
if God, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 24, 25.

That aged men be sober, grave, temperate, etc. in patience, Tit. 2. 2.

Put them in mind, etc. to be no brawler, gentle, showing all meekness unto all
men, Tit. 3. 1, 2.

Ye have need of patience, that after ye have done the will of God, ye might
receive the promise, Heb. 10. 36.

Follow peace with all men, Heb. 12. 14.

The trial of your faith works patience. But let patience have her perfect
work, that ye may be perfect and entire, wanting nothing, etc. Let every man
be, etc. slow to wrath; for the wrath of man works not the righteousness of
God, etc. Receive with meekness the ingrafted word, James 1. 3, 4, 19, 20, 21.

Who is a wise man? etc. Let him show out of a good conversation his works with
meekness of wisdom. But if ye have bitter envyings and strife in your heart,
etc. For where envy and strife is, there is confusion, etc. But the wisdom
which is from above, is, first pure, then peaceable, gentle, and easy to be
entreated, etc. James 3. 13, 14, 16, 17.

Gird up the loins of your mind; be sober, and hope, etc. 1 Pet. 1. 13.

What glory is it, if when ye be buffetted for your faults, ye take it
patiently? But if when ye do well, and suffer for it, you take it patiently,
this is acceptable with God, 1 Pet. 2. 20.

Whose adorning, let it not be that outward, etc. but the hidden man of the
heart, in that which is not corruptible; the ornament of a meek and quiet
spirit, which is in the fight of God of great price, etc. He who will love
life, etc. let him seek peace, and ensue it, etc. Be always ready to give an
answer to every man who asks you a reason of the hope that is in you, with
meekness and fear, 1 Pet. 3. 3, 4, 10, 11, 15.

The end of all things is at hand; be ye therefore sober, 1 Pet. 4. 7.

Add, etc. to knowledge, temperance; and to temperance, patience, 2 Pet. 1. 6.

To take heed to our Lips, that our Words be not rash, but true, seasonable,
well ordered, and savoury.
THE Angels said, they would not go in with Lot; yet being pressed, did go in,
Genesis 19. 1, 2, 3 2 Kings 2. 16, 17.

Ye shall not, etc. lie one to another, Levit. 19. 11, 14.

How forcible are right words? But what does your arguing reprove? Job 6. 25,
26.

Ye are forgers of lies, etc. Oh, that you would altogether hold your peace,
and it should be your wisdom, etc. Will you speak wickedly for God? and talk
deceitfully for him? Job 13. 4, 5, 7.

He who speaks flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall
fail, Job 17. 5.

My lips shall not speak wickedness, not my tongue utter deceit, Job 27. 4.

not show my Opinion, Job. 32. 4, 6.

I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew

Thou shall destroy them who speak a lie, Psalm. 5, 6.

They speak vanity every one with his neighbor: with flattering lips, with a

Lord, Who shall abide in thy tabernacle? etc. He who speaks the truth in his

I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress, Psalm. 17. 3. Psalm. 141. 3.

What man is he who desires life? etc. Keep thy tongue from evil, and thy lips
from speaking guile, Psalm. 34. 12, 13.

The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom, and his tongue talks of
judgment, Psalm. 37. 30. Psalm. 119. 46, 172.

Put away from thee a froward mouth: and perverse lips put far from thee, Prove.

These six things does the Lord hate, etc. a lying tongue, etc. a false
witness, speaking lies, Prove. 6. 16, 17, 19.

A prating fool shall fa^^: the mouth of a righteous man is a well of life,
etc. In the lips of him who has understanding, wisdom is found, etc. He who
hides hatred with lying lips, and he who utters a slander, is a fool. In the
multitude of words there wants not sin; but he who refraineth his lips, is
wise. The tongue of the just is as choice silver, etc. The lips of the
righteous seed many, etc. The mouth of the just brings forth wisdom, etc. The
lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, Prove. 10. 10, 11, 13, 18, 19,
20, 21, 31, 32.

He who speaks truth, shows forth righteousness, etc. Lying lips are an
abomination to the Lord: but they who deal truly, are his delight, Prove. 12.
17, 20, 22.

He who keeps his mouth, keeps his life but he who opens wide his lips,
shall have destruction, etc. A righteous man hates lying, Prove. 13. 3, 5.

A soft answer turns away wrath: but grievous words stir up anger. The tongue
of the wise uses knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools pours forth
foolishness, etc. A wholesome tongue is a tree of life: but perverseness therein
is a breach in the spirit, etc. The lips of the wise disperseth knowledge, etc.
A man has joy by the answer of his mouth, and a word spoken in due season, how
good it is! The heart of the righteous studieth to answer: but the mouth of the
wicked pours out evil things, Prove. 15, 1, 2, 4, 7, 23, 28.

Righteous lips are the delight of Kings: and they love him who speaks right,
etc. The heart of the wise teaches his mouth, and adds learning unto his
lips. Pleasant words are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, Prove. 16. 13, 23,
24.

Excellent speech becomes not a fool: much less do lying lips a prince, etc. He
who has a perverse tongue, falls into mischief, etc. He who has knowledge,
spares his ^words, etc. Even a fool when he holds his peace, is counted
wise: he who shuts his lips, is a man of understanding, Prove. 17. 7, 20, 27,
28.

A fool's lips enter into contention; and his mouth calls for strokes, etc.
His mouth is his destruction, and his lips the snare of his soul, etc. The
words of a talebearer ( or whisperer) are as wounds, etc. He who answers a
matter before he hears, it is folly and shame unto him, etc. Death and life
is in the power of the tongue, etc. The rich man answers roughly, Prove. 18.
6, 7, 8, 13, 21, 23.

He who speaks lies shall perish, etc. shall not escape, Prove. 19. 5, 9.

Whosoever keeps his mouth and his tongue, keeps his soul from trouble, Prove.
21. 23.

A word fitly spoken, is like apples of gold in pictures of silver, Prove. 25.
11.

Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.
Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit, Prove.
26. 4, 5.

Let another man praise thee, not thine own mouth: a stranger, not thine own
lips, Prove. 27. 2.

A fool utters all his mind: but a wise man keeps it in till afterward,
etc. See thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool,
than of him, Prove. 29. 11, 20.

A time to keep silence, and a time to speak, Eccles. 3. 7.

Be not rash with thy mouth: and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any
thing before God, etc. Let thy words be few, etc. for many words also diverse
vanities: but fear thou God, Eccles. 5. 2, 3, 7.

The words of wise men are heard in quiet, Eccles. 9. 17.

The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious, ( or grace,) etc. A fool also is
full of words; a man cannot tell what shall be, Eccles. 10. 12, 14.

The words of the wise are as goads, and as nails fastened by the master of the
assemblies, Eccles. 12. 11.

I hearkened, and heard; they spoke not aright, etc. Jer. 8. 6.

They bent their tongue like their bow, for lies: but are not valiant for the
truth, etc. will not speak the truth; they have taught their tongue to speak
lies, etc. Their tongue is an arrow shot out, it speaks deceit. One speaks
peaceably to his neighbor with his mouth; in his heart he lays in wait, Jer.
9. 3, 5, 8. Acts 6. 9, 11. 13. 1 Kings 21. 7, 8.

The Lord has a controversy, etc. because there is no truth, etc. By swearing
and lying, etc. Hos. 4. 1, 2.

The prudent shall keep silence in that day; for it is an evil time, Amos 5. 13.

Keep the doors of thy mouth from her who lies in thy bosom, Micah 7. 5.

Speak ye every man truth to his neighbor, Zech. 8. 16.

Let your communication be yea, etc. for whatsoever is more than these, comes
of evil, Matthew. 5. 37.

How can ye, being evil, speak good things? for out of the abundance of the
heart the mouth speaks. A good man, out of the good treasure of the heart,
brings forth good things: and an evil man, out of the evil treasure of his
heart, brings forth evil things. But I say unto you, That every idle word
which men shall speak, they shall give an account thereof in the day of
judgment: for by thy words thou shall be justified; and by thy words thou shall
be condemned, Matthew. 12. 34, 35, 36, 37.

Every Scribe instructed, etc. is like to a master of a family, who brings
forth, etc. both new and old, Matthew. 13. 52.

Those things which proceed out of the mouth, comes forth from the heart, and
they defile the man, Matthew. 15. 18.

And all wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth, Luke
4. 22.

Peter ( too rashly) said unto Christ, Thou shall never wash my feet, John 13.
8.

Bless, and curse not, Romans 12. 14.

In the Church I had rather speak five words with my understanding, that I
might teach others also, than ten thousand words in an unknown tongue, etc. It
is a shame for a woman to speak in the Chruch, 1 Cor. 14. 19, 35.

Evil communication corrupts good manners, 1 Cor. 15. 33.

Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbor, etc.
Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth; but that which is good,
to the use of edifying, ( or to edify profitable,) that it may minister grace
unto the hearers: and grieve not the holy Spirit of God, etc. Let all
bitterness, etc. and clamor, and evil-speaking be put away, Ephesians. 4. 25, 29,
30, 31.

But fornication, etc. let it not be once named amongst you, as becomes
saints; neither filthy nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not
convenient, Ephesians. 5. 3, 4.

But now also put off all these, etc. blasphemy, filthy communication out of
your mouth: Lie not one to another, etc. Col. 3. 8, 9.

Let your speech be always with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how
ye ought to answer every man, Col. 4. 6.

Neither give heed to fables, etc. which minister questions, rather than godly
edifying, 1 Timothy 1. 4.

They learn to be idle, etc. and not only idle, but tatlers also, and
busi-bodies; speaking things which they ought not, 1 Timothy 5. 13.

Doting about questions, and strifes of words; whereof comes envy, strife,
railing, etc. perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, etc. 2 Timothy 6. 4, 5.

Charging them before the Lord, that they strive not about words to no profit,
to the subverting of the hearers, etc. Shun profane and vain bablings, for
they will increase to more ungodliness; and their word will eat as does a
canker, etc. But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do
gender strifes, 2 Timothy 2. 14, 16, 17, 23.

In all things show thy self a pattern etc. Sound speech, which cannot be
condemned; that he who is of the contrary party may be ashamed, Titus 2. 7, 8.

Speak evil of no man: to be no brawler, etc. Titus 3. 2.

Let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, etc. It any man among you seem
to be religious, and bridleth not his tongue, but deceives his own heart; this
man's religion is vain, James 1. 19, 26.

If any man offend not in word, the same is a perfect man, and able also to
bridle the whole body. Behold, we put bits in horses mouths, etc. The ships,
though great, etc. yet are they turned about with a small helm whithersoever
the governer lists: so the tongue is a little member, and boasts great
things, etc. And the tongue is a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongue
among our members, that it defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the
course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell. For every kind of beast, etc.
has been tamed of man; but the tongue can no man tame: an unruly evil, full of
deadly poison: Therewith bless we God, even the Father: and therewith curse we
men, etc. Out of the same mouth proceeds blassings and cursings. My brethren,
these things ought not so to be, James 3. 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10.

Speak not evil one of another, brethren: for whosoever speaks evil of his
brother, and judges his brother, speaks evil of the law, James 4. 11.

Wherefore laying aside all malice, etc. and evil-speaking, 1 Pet. 2. 1.

Not rendering, etc. railing for railing; but contrariwise, blessing, etc. He
who would love life, and see good days, let him refrain his tongue from evil;
and his lips, that they speak no guile, 1 Pet. 3. 9, 10.

But these, as natural brute beasts, etc. speak evil of the things they
understand not, 2 Pet. 2. 12.

The Lord, etc. to convince all, etc. of all their hard speeches, which
ungodly, etc. have spoken against me, Jude, verse. 14, 15.

All liars shall have their part in the lake which burns, etc. and there
shall in no wise enter in, etc. whosoever works, etc. and makes a lie, Rev.
21. 8, 27.

Without are dogs, etc. and whatsoever loves and makes a lie, Rev. 22. 15.

To acknowledge and mourn for Sin, d^part from it, and watch against it: The
Arguments. God complains of it; Reasoning with Sinners about it: Threatenings
and Judgments against Sin and Sinners.
I. What Sin is.
BY the law is the knowledge of sin, Romans 3. 20. chapter 7. 7, 13.

Sin is the transgression of the law, 1 John 3. 4. All unrighteousness is sin,
1 John 5. 17.

II. Acknowledge Sin unto God, both their own, and others; and mourn for them.
AND Moses returned unto the Lord, and said, Oh, this people have sinned a
great sin, and have made them gods of gold, etc. Exodus 32. 31. Deuteronomy. 9. 16, 18,
19, 20.

And Aaron shall lay both of his hands upon the head of the live goat, and
confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their
transgressions, and all their sins, etc. Levit. 16. 21.

If they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers; with
their trespasses which they have trespassed against me: and that also they have
walked contrary unto me, etc. then will I remember my covenant, Levit. 26. 40,
42.

When a man or woman shall commit any sin, etc. then they shall confess their
sins which they have done, Numb. 5. 6, 7.

Joshua said to Achan, Give glory to the God of Israel, and make confession,
etc. ^osh. 7. 19.

And David said to Nathan, I have sinned against the Lord, 2 Samuel 12, 13.

David's heart smote him, etc. And David said unto the Lord, I have sinned
greatly in that I have done, 2 Samuel 24. 10.

Wicked Ahab his mourning kept off the threatened Judgments in his days, 1 Kings
21. 27, 29.

Ezra said, I am ashamed, and blush to lift up my face to thee my God: for our
iniquities are increased over our head, and our-trespasses, etc. Ezra 9. 5, 6,
7, etc. chapter 10. 6. 2. Kings 22. 11, 13, 19.

Nehemiah confesses thus: Both I and my father's house have sinned: we have
dealt very corruptly against thee, and have not kept, etc. Nehem. 1. 6, 7. chapter
9. 16, 17, etc.

Job says, I have sinned: what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men?
Job 7. 20. chapter 9. 2, 3.

If any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it
profits me not. He will deliver his soul, etc. Job 33. 27, 28.

Job answered the Lord and said, Behold, I am vile: what shall I answer thee? I
will lay mine hand upon my mouth, Job 40. 3, 4.

I acknowledged my sins unto thee, and mine iniquity have I not hid: I said, I
will confess my transgressions unto the Lord; and thou forgavest the iniquity
of my sin, Psalm. 32. 5.

I will declare mine iniquity: I will be sorry for my sins, Psalm 35. 18.

For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me. Against
thee only have I sinned, and done this evil in thy sight, etc. Psalm 51. 3. 4,
5.

We have sinned with our fathers: we have committed iniquity, etc. Psalm 106.
6, 7.

Horror has taken hold of me, because of the wicked who forsake thy law, etc.
Rivers of water run down mine eyes, because they keep not thy law, etc. I

Psalm 119. 53, 126, 136. 158. Nehem. 13. 7, 8. Jer. 9. 1, 2. Genesis 34. 7. Mark
3. 5. Jer. 13. 17. Psalm. 139. 21, 22.

If thou should mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand? Psalm 130. 3,

He who covers his sin shall not prosper: but whose confesses and forsakes
them, shall have mercy, Prove. 28. 13.

Behold thou art wroth, for we have sinned, etc. We are all as an unclean
thing: and all our righteousness as filthy rags, etc. Isa. 64. 5, 6, 7.

Yet thou say, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me.
Behold, I will plead with thee, because thou say I have not ^nned, Jer. 2.
35.

Go and proclaim these words, etc. Return thou backsliding Israel, says the
Lord: I will not cause mine anger to fall upon you, etc. Only acknowledge thine
iniquity, that thou have transgressed against the Lord thy God, and have
scattered thy ways, etc. Jer. 3. 12, 23. 1 Samuel 12. 9, 10.

If ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret places for your pride,
and mine eyes shall weep sore, Jer. 13. 17.

O Lord, though our iniquities testify against us, do thou for thy name's
sake; for our back-sltidings are many: We have sinned against thee, etc. We
acknowledge, O Lord, our wickness, the iniquity of our fathers: for we have
sinned against thee, Jer. 14. 7, 20.

The Lord is righteous, for I have rebelled against his commandments, etc. My
heart is turned within me: for I have grievously rebelled, Lam. 1. 18, 20. chapter
3. 42.

The crown is fallen from our heads: we unto us that we have sinned, Lam. 5. 16.

Set a mark upon the foreheads of the men who sigh, who cry for all the
abominations that be done in the midst thereof, Ezekiel. 9. 4.

Ye shall remember your ways, etc. and ye shall loath your selves in your own
sight, for all your evil which ye have committed, Exek. 20. 43. chap. 16. 63.

I prayed unto the Lord my God, and made my confession, etc. We have sinned and
committed iniquity, etc. Dan. 9. 3, 4, 5, 6, 15.

I will go and return to my place till they acknowledge their offenses, and
seek my face, Hosea 5. 15.

Turn ye unto me with all your-heart, with fasting, with weeping, and with
mourning: Rent your hearts and not your garments, Joel 2. 12, 13.

Blessed are they who mourn, for they shall be comforted, Matthew. 5. 4.

Peter remembered the words of Jesus, which said unto him, Before the cock crow
thou shall deny me thrice: and he went out and wept bitterly, Matthew. 26. 75.

The prodigal Son said, I will arise and go to my father, and I will say unto
him, Father, I have sinned against heaven and before thee, and am no more
worthy to be called thy son, etc. Luke 15. 18. 19, 21.

And many who believed, came and confessed and showed their deeds, Acts 19. 18.

Paul made confession of his being a persecutor of the Saints, Acts 22. 4, 5,
19, 20.

I rejoice not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed to repentance: for
ye were made sorry after a godly manner ( or, according to God,) etc. for godly
sorrow works repentance to salvation, never to be be repented of: but the
sorrow of the world works death, etc. ye sorrowed after a godly sort: What
carefulness it wrought in you: yea clearing of your selves, yea indignation,
yea fear, yea vehement desire, yea zeal, yea revenge, 2 Cor. 7. 9, 10, 11.

And lest when I come again, my God will humble me among you, and that I shall
bewail many who have sinned already, etc. 2 Cor. 12. 21.

Many walk of whom I have told you often, and now tell you weeping, the
enemies, etc. Phil. 3. 18.

Delivered just Lot vexed with the filthy conversation of the wicked: for that
righteous man dwelling amongst them, in seeing and hearing, vexed his righteous
soul from day to day with their unlawful deeds, 2 Pet. 2. 7, 8.

If we say we have no sin, we deceive our selves, and the truth is not in us:
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to
cleanse us from all unrighteousness: If we say we have not sinned, we make him
a liar, and his word is not in us, 1 John 1. 8, 9, 10.

Be afflicted, mourn and weep, humble your selves in the sight of the Lord, and
he shall lift you up, James 4. 9, 10.

See Confession of Sin in time of Affliction, Chap. 22.

In time of Common Calamity, Chap. 23.

See Prayer, Chap. 16.

Saints Duty, confess one to another, Chap. 17.

Depart from Sin, and all appearance of it; hate it, and avoid the Occasions of
it: The reasons thereof.
THere shall not be found among you, etc. who uses divination, an observer of
times, an inchanter, or a witch, or a charmer, or a consulter with a familiar
spirit, etc. All who do so are an abomination to the Lord, etc. Deuteronomy. 18. 10,
11, 12, 14.

When Adam had sinned, he hid himself, was afraid, because naked, Genesis 3. 8,
10. Exodus 32. 25.

Abimelech said unto Isaac, What is this thou have done unto us? one of the
people might lightly have lain with thy wife, and thou should have brought
guiltiness upon us: And Abimelech charged all his people, saying, He who
touches this man or his wife, shall surely be put to death, Genesis 26. 8, 9, 10.
chapter 20. 2, 3, 4, etc.

When Joseph had been tempted to sin by Potiphar's Wife, he answered her, How
then can I do this great wickedness and sin against God? etc. when she laid
hold on him, he fled from her, Genesis 39. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 12.

See the Ten Commandments, Exodus 20.

Thou shall not follow a multitude to do evil, Exodus 23. 2.

And be sure your sins will find you out, Numb. 32. 23. Genesis 44. 16. Psalm 44.
20, 21. Joshua 7. 1, 5, 11, 12, 24, 25, 26. Job 34. 22. Psalm 44. 20, 21, Jonah
1. 4, 5, 6. 1 Kings 2. 24, 25, 28, 31, 32, etc.

If any man sin against another, the Judge shall judge him: but if a man
sins against the Lord who shall entreat for him? 1 Samuel 2. 25.

Tamar, Sister of Amnon, being tempted, said, Commit not this wickedness, 2 Samuel 13. 11, 12, 13.

I have kept the way of the Lord, and have not wickedly departed from my God,
etc. I have kept my self from mine iniquity. 2 Samuel 22. 22, 25.

The drinking was according to law, none did compel, but according to every
man's pleasure, Esther 1. 8.

Job feared God, and eschewed evil, Job 1. 1, 8.

To depart from evil is understanding, etc. Job 28. 28.

I made a covenant with mine eyes: why then should I think upon a maid? Job 31.
1.

Stand in awe and sin not, Psalm 4. 4.

For thou art not a God who has pleasure in wickedness, neither shall evil
dwell with thee, etc. thou hate all workers of iniquity, Psalm 5. 4, 5.

I kept my self from mine iniquity, Psalm 18. 23.

I have hated the congregation of evil doers, etc. I will wash mine hands in

Depart from evil, and do good, Psalm 34. 14. Psalm 37. 27.

He prophesied of Christ thus: Thou love righteousness, and hate
wickedness, Psalm 45. 7. Heb. 1. 8, 9.

If I regard iniquity in my heart, the Lord will not hear me, Psalm 66. 18.
