CHAP. XIX.
Saints, Believers Duties toward all Men, those who are with out, Unbelievers,
Enemies.
I. In General.
THou shall neither vex a stranger nor oppress him: for ye were strangers in
the land. Ye shall not afflict any widow or fatherless, etc. Exodus 22. 21, 22.

Curse not the deaf, put no offense ( or, stumbling block) before the blind,
etc. Levit. 19. 13, 14.

He does execute the judgment of the fatherless and widow, and loves the
stranger, etc. Love ye therefore the stranger, for ye were strangers, Deuteronomy. 10.
18, 19. Job 31. 32.

Who shall dwell in thy holy hill? etc. he who does no evil to his neighbor,
Psalm 15. 1, 3.

Thus speaks the Lord of Hosts, saying, Execute true judgment, and show mercy
and compassion every man to his brother, and oppress not the widow nor the
fatherless, the stranger nor the poor: and let none of you imagine evil against
his brother in your heart, Zech. 7. 9, 10. chapter 8. 16, 17. Prove. 3. 29. Isa. 58.
6, 7.

Give not that which is holy unto dogs: neither cast you your pearls before
swine, lest they trample them under their feet, and turn again and rent you,
etc. Therefore all things whatsoever ye would that men should do to you, do ye
even so unto them: for this is the law and the prophets, Matthew. 7. 6, 12. Luke
6. 31.

Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise
as serpents, and harmless as doves, Matthew. 10. 16.

And herein do I exercise my self, to have always a conscience void, of offense
toward God, and toward men, Acts (...)

Recompense to no man evil, provide things honest in the sight of all men, Romans
12. 17. Levit. 19. 18.

Render therefore to all their dues, tribute to whom tribute is due, custom to
whom custom, fear to whom fear, honor to whom honor. Owe no man any thing,
but to love one another: for he who loves another, has fulfilled the law,
etc. Love works no ill to his neighbor, Romans 13. 7, 8, 9, 10.

Give none offense, neither to the Jews nor to the Gentiles, etc. even as I
please all men in all things, not seeking mine own profit, 1 Cor. 10. 32, 33.

Charity thinks no evil, 1 Cor. 13. 5.

Providing for honest things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but in the
sight of men, 2 Cor. 8. 21.

Look not every man on his own things, but every man also on the things of
others, etc. Do all things without murmuring or dispurings: that ye may be
blameless and harmless ( or, sincere) the sons of God without rebuke, in the
midst of a crooked and perverse nation, among whom ye shine ( or, shine ye) as
lights in the world, Phil. 2. 4, 14, 15.

Let your moderation be known unto all men: the Lord is at hand, Phil. 4. 5.

Walk in wisdom toward them who are without, etc. Let your speech be always
with grace, etc. that ye may know how to answer every man, Col. 4. 5, 6.

The Lord (...) you to increase, etc. abound in love, etc. toward all men, 1
These. 3. 12. Ephesians. 5. 2.

That ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work (...) your
own hands, etc. That we may walk (...) toward them who are without, and that
ye may have ^ack of nothing ( or, of no men) 1 These. 4. 11, 12.

We exhort you, brethren, etc. be patient toward all men. See that no^e render
evil for evil unto any man: but ever follow that which is good, both among your
selves, and to all men, 1 These. 5. 14, 15.

That ye be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, charity, patience, etc.
The aged women likewise, etc. In all things show thy self a pattern of good
works, etc. sound speech that cannot be condemned, that he who is of the
contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you, Titus 2. 2,
3, 6, 7, 8.

Put them in mind, etc. to be ready to every good work, etc. To be no brawler,
our gentle, showing all meekness unto all men: for we, etc. Titus 3. 1, 2, 3.

Wherefore laying aside all malice, and all guile, and envies, and evil
speakings, etc. abstain from fleshly lusts which war against the soul: having
your conversation honest amongst the Gentiles, that whereas they ( or, wherein
they) speak against you as evil doers, they may by your good works which they
shall behold, glorify God in the day of visitation, etc. For so is the will of
God, that with well-doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men,
etc. Honor ( or, esteem) all men, 1 Pet. 2. 1, 11, 12, 15, 17. Job. 17. 5.

Sanctify the Lord God in your hearts, and be ready always to give answer to
every man who asks you a reason of the hope which is in you, with meekness
and fear, having a good conscience: that whereas they speak evil of you, as of
evildoers, they may be ashamed who falsely accuse your good conversation in
Christ, etc. 1 Pet. 3. 14, 15, 16, 17.

II. In Particular; Not to Judge them, or speak Evil of them.
THou give thy mouth to evil, etc. thou sit and speak against thy
brother, etc. thou thoughtest that I was altogether such a one as thy self,
etc. Psalm 50. 19, 20, 21.

Judge not, that ye be not judged: for with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be
judged, Matthew. 7. 1, 2.

Judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, 1 Cor. 4. 5.

Charity, etc. thinks no evil, 1 Cor. 13. 5.

Put them in mind to speak evil of no man, etc. for we our selves were
sometimes foolish, disobedie^, Titus 3. 1, 2, 3.

Speak not evil one of another, etc. who art thou who judge another? James 4.
11, 12.

Wherefore laying aside, etc. all evil speakings, 1 Pet. 2. 1.

III. Be Just, Righteous, True and Faithful to, and with them, in all things of
Trust and Dealing.
THAT which is altogether just ( or, Justice) shall thou follow, that thou,
etc. Deuteronomy. 10. 20.

Ye shall not, etc. deal falsely, neither lie one to ^o another, etc. Thou shall
not defraud thy neighbor, nor rob him, etc. ye shall do no unrighteousness in
judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure: just balances, just weights,
a just Ephah, and a just Hin shall ye have: I the Lord your God, Levit. 19. 11,
13, 34, 35, 36. Job 17. 5. Levit. 25. 17.

If thou sell ought unto thy neighbor, or buyest ought of thy neighbors hand;
ye shall not oppress one another, Levit. 25. 14.

Thou shall not have in thy house diverse measures, a great and a small, etc.
Deuteronomy. 25. 14, 15.

The righteous Lord loves righteousness, Psalm 11. 7.

A false balance is an abomination to the Lord: but a just weight is his
delight, Prove. 11. 1. chapter 16. 11. Micah 6. 10, 11.

Diverse weights ( or, a stone and a stone:) and diverse measures ( or, an Ephah
and an Ephah) are both alike abominations to the Lord, Prove. 20. 10. Amos. 8. 5.

To do justice and judgment, is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice,
etc. It is the joy of the just to do judgment, Prove. 21. 3, 15. Micah 6. 6, 7,
8.

Remove not the ancient landmarks ( or, bound) which thy father have set.
Enter not into the field of the fatherless, for their redeemer is mighty, he
shall plead their cause with thee, Prove. 22. 28. chapter 23. 10, 11.

As as a mad man, etc. so is he who deceives his neighbor, and says, Am I
not in sport? Prove. 26. 18, 19.

God complained against Israel: None calls for justice, nor any pleads for
truth, Isa. 59. 4.

Woe to him who builds his house by unrighteousness, and his chamber by wrong:
who uses his neighbors service without wages, etc. Jer. 22. 13.

In thee they deal by oppression with the stranger, Ezekiel. 22. 7, 29.

Daniel was faithful in his trust, neither was there any error or fault found
in him, Dan. 6. 4, 5.

What does the Lord require of thee, but to do justly? etc. Micah 6. 8.

The just Lord, in the midst thereof: he will not do iniquity, Zeph. 4. 5.

Have we not all one Father, has not one God created us? Why do we deal
treacherously every man against his brother? Malachi 2. 10.

Jesus said unto the Publicans, Exact no more than that which is appointed you,
etc. And to the Soldiers he said, Do no violence to any man, etc. be content
with your wages, etc. Luke 3. 13, 14.

He who is faithful in that which is least, is faithful also in much, etc. Luke
16. 10, 11, 12.

Render therefore to all their dues, tribute to whom tribute, etc. owe no man
any thing, but to love, etc. Romans 13. 7, 8.

Nay, you do wrong and defraud, etc. know ye not that the unrighteous shall not
inherit, etc. 1 Cor. 6. 8, 9.

That no man go beyond* and defraud his brother in any matter, because the Lord
is the avenger of such, 1 These. 4. 6.

Follow righteousness, 1 Timothy 6. 11.

The hire of the laborers, which ye kept back by fraud cries, and the cries,
etc. have entered, etc. James 5. 1, 4.

IV. Live at Peace with them, every one doing their own Work: not intermedling
with others, nor idle, or trifling.
SEek peace and pursue it, Psalm 34. 14. Psalm 120. 7.

Let thy feet be seldom in thy neighbors house, lest he be weary of thee, and
hate thee, Prove. 25. 17.

Accuse not a servant to his master, lest he curse thee, etc. Prove. 30. 10.

Blessed are the peace makers, for they shall be called the children of God,
etc. Whosoever shall smite thee on the right cheek, turn to him the other, etc.
Matthew. 5. 9, 38, 39, 40.

If it be possible, as much as lies in you, live peaceably with all men:
Dearly beloved, avenge not your selves, Romans 12. 18, 19.

If the unbelieving depart, let him depart, etc. but God has called us to
peace, 1 Cor 7. 15.

That ye study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work, etc. 1
These. 4. 11.

We hear that there are some among you who walk disorderly, working not at all,
but are busybodies: now them who are such we command and exhort, etc. that
with quietness they work, etc. 2 These. 3. 11, 12.

Withal they learn to be idle, wandering about from house to house: and not only
idle, but tatlers also, and busybodies; I will, etc. that they give no
occasion to the adversary to speak reproachfully, 1 Timothy 5. 13, 14, 15.

That they which have believed in God, should be careful to maintain good
works: these things are good and profitable unto men, etc. and let ours also
learn to maintain good works ( or, profess honest Trades) for necessary uses,
etc. Tit. 3. 8, 14.

Follow peace with all men, Heb. 12. 14.

But if ye have bitter envying and strife, etc. this wisdom descends not from
above, but is, etc. The wisdom that is from above is, etc. peaceable, gentle,
and easy to be entreated, etc. etc. And the fruit of peace is sown in peace of
them who make peace, James 3. 14, 15, 17, 18.

From whence comes wars and fighting amongst you? come they not hence, even of
your lusts? etc. James 4. 1.

Let none of you suffer, etc. as a busie-body in other men's matters, etc. 1
Pet. 4. 15.

He will love life, etc. let him seek peace and ensue it, 1 Pet. 3. 11.

5. Not to be Discontented, Angry, or Revengeful against them: But to behave
themselves meekly gently and patiently toward them, bearing Wrong.
LOT speaks to the wicked men t^us, I pray you brethren, do not so wickedly,
etc. Genesis 19. 5, 6, 7.

Simeon and Levi's cruelty in slaying the Shechemites greatly blamed, Genesis 34.
25, 26, 30. chapter 49. 5, 6, 7.

David resolved in haste to destroy Nabal's house, because of Nabal's
unkindness; but Abigail having interposed, he blessed God for her counsel, and
forbore his revenge, 1 Samuel 25. 32, 33, 34. Levit. 19. 18. Prove. 20. 22. chapter
24. 29.

Israel's rage against Judah was rebuked by the prophet, 2 Chronicles. 28. 9, 10.

Fret not thy self because of evildoers, neither be thou envious against the
workers of iniquity: for they shall soon be cut down, Psalm. 37. 1, 2. Prove. 24.
1, 19.

Envy not the oppressor, and choose none of his his ways, Prove. 3. 31.

Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be in the fear of the Lord all the day,
Prove. 23. 17.

Whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause, is in danger, etc. Matthew.
5. 22.

If ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive
you: but if ye forgive not men their trespasses, neither will your Father
forgive, etc. Matthew. 6. 14, 15.

Learn of me, for I am meek and lowly in heart Matthew. 11. 29.

One of them which were with Jesus, stretched out his hand and drew his sword,
and stroke a servant of the high priest, etc. Then said Jesus unto him, Put up
again thy sword into his place: for all they who take the sword shall perish by
the sword, Matthew. 26. 51, 52. chapter 5. 39.

The Samaritans did not receive Christ; and when his Disciples, James and John,
saw this, they said, Lord, will thou that we command fire from heaven and
consume them, as Elias did? and he turned and rebuked them, and said, Ye know
not what manner of spirit ye are of: for the Son of man is not come to destroy
men's lives, etc. Luke 9. 52, 53, 54, 55, 56.

Charity suffers long, and is kind; charity envieth not, etc. is not easily
provoked; thinks no evil, 1 Cor. 13. 4, 5.

In malice be ye children: but in understanding be ye men, 1 Cor. 14. 20.

The fruit of the Spirit, is, etc. long-suffering, gentleness, etc. meekness,
temperance, Gal. 5. 22, 23.

Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamor, etc. be put away from
you, Ephesians. 4. 31. Col. 3. 8.

Let your moderation be known unto all men, Phil. 4 5.

Be patient toward all men: see that none render evil for evil unto any man, 1
These. 5. 14, 15. 1 Pet. 3. 9.

The servant of the Lord must not strive, but be gentle unto all men, etc.
patient, in meekness instructing those who oppose themselves: if God
peradventure, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 2, 4, 25.

Speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers: gentle, showing all meekness to all
men, Titus 3. 2.

Let every man be slow to wrath: for the wrath of man works not the
righteousness of God, James 1. 19, 20.

The wisdom which is above, is, etc. gentle, and easy to be entreated, etc.
James 3. 17.

Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing, etc. knowing that ye are,
etc. Be ready always to give an answer unto every man, etc. with meekness, 1
Pet. 3. 9, 15.

See the Duty of not Revenging on Enemies, Persecutors, Chap. 2.

See the Duty of Moderation, Meekness, Patience, etc. in General, Chap. 16.

VI. To pity them, show them mercy, pray for them, and requite them Good for
Evil: Love for Hatred.
IF thou meet thine enemies ox or ass going astray, thou shall surely bring him
back again to him. If thou see the ass of him who hates thee, under his
burden, and would forbear to help him; thou shall surely help with him (or,
would cease to leave thy Business for him, thou shall surely leave it to join
with him) Exodus 23. 4, 4. Deuteronomy. 22. 1, 2, 3, 4.

If thy brother be waxen poor, etc. thou shall relieve him: a stranger or a
sojourner, that he may live, Levit. 25. 35.

David rewarded Saul good for evil, which Saul acknowledges, 1 Samuel 24. 17,
18, 19.

Israel were charged to cloth, feed, and help the men of Judah, then their
captives, 2 Chronicles. 28. 11. 15.

With the merciful, thou will show thy self merciful, Psalm. 18. 25.

The righteous is ever merciful, Psalm. 37, 25, 26.

He who considers the poor or sick, the Lord will strengthen him upon his bed
of languishing, Psa^m 41. 1, 2, 3.

The merciful man does good unto his own soul: but he who is cruel, etc. Prove.
11. 17.

A righteous man regards the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the
wicked are cruel, Prove. 12. 10.

He who is glad at calamities, shall not go un^^^ushed, Prove. 17. 5.

If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat: and if he be thirsty, give
him water to drink: for thou shall heap up coals, etc. and the Lord shall
reward thee, Prove. 25. 21, 22. 2 Chronicles. 28. 11, 15. Prove. 24. 11, 12.

Seek the peace of the city, whither I have caused you to be carried away
captive, and pray unto the Lord for it: for in the peace thereof, ye shall have
peace. Jer. 29. 7.

Blessed are the merciful, etc. love your enemies, bless them who curse you, do
good to them who hate you, and pray for them who despitefully use you. etc.
that you may be the children of your heavenly Father: for he makes his sun to
rise on the evil, and on the good, etc. For if ye love them who (...) you,
(...) reward have ye? Do not even the Publicans the same? Matthew. 5. 7, 44, 45,
46. Luke 6. 32, 33, 35, 36.

Christ had compassions on the multitude, and did them good, Matthew. 9. 36. chapter
14. 14. chapter 15. 32.

The Samaritan's compassion and care of the wounded, in the Parable, commended,
Luke 10. 30, 31, etc.

Recompense to no man evil for evil, etc. avenge not your selves, etc. If thine
enemy hunger, feed him, etc. Be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with
good, Romans 12. 17, 19, 20, 21.

As we have therefore opportunity, let us do good unto all men, Gal. 6. 10.

Put on bowels of mercy, kindness, etc. Col. 3. 12. Micah 6. 8.

The Lord make you to increase in love, etc. toward all men. 1 These. 3. 12.

See that none render evil for evil unto any man, but ever follow that which is
good, both among your selves, and unto all men, 1 These. 5. 15.

Exhort, etc. that supplications and prayers, etc. be made for all men, 1 Timothy
2. 1.

The wisdom that is from above, is, etc. full of mercy and good fruits, etc.
James 3. 17.

Not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise
blessing, 1 Pet. 3. 9.

He shall have judgment without mercy, who does not show mercy, James 2. 13.

See this Duty toward Persecutors, Chap. 22.

See giving to the Poor at large, Chap. 17.

VII. To behave themselves humbly, and courteously toward all, giving them due
respect.
THE children of Heth said to Abraham, Hear us my Lord, thou art a mighty
Prince amongst us: in the choice of our sepulchers bury thy dead, etc. And
Abraham stood up and bowed himself to the people of the land, etc. Genesis 23. 5,
6, 7, 11, 12.

Jacob bowed himself seven times to the ground, until he came near his brother
Esau, etc. Let my Lord I pray thee pass over before his servant, etc. let me
find grace in the sight of my Lord, Genesis 33. 3, 14, 15.

Thou shall rise up before the hoary head, and honor the face of the old man,
and fear thy God, I am the Lord, Levit. 19. 32. Romans 13. 7.

If thou meet any man, salute him not; and if any salute thee, answer him not
again, 2 Kings 4. 29.

Let me not give flattering titles to any man, etc. my maker would soon take me
away, Job 32. 21, 22.

God threatened it as an evil, that the child shall behave himself proudly
against the ancient, and the base against the honorable, Isa. 3. 5.

If ye salute your brethren only, what do you more than others? do not even the
Publicans the same? Be ye therefore perfect, as your Father which is is in
heaven is perfect. Matthew. 5. 47, 48.

When ye come into an house, salute it, Matthew. 10. 12.

When thou art bidden, etc. sit not down in the highest room, lest a more
honorable man than thou be bidden of him; and he who bade thee and him, come
and say to thee, Give this man place; and thou begin with shame to take the
lowest room, etc. Sit in the lowest room, etc. then shall thou have worship in
the presence of them who fate at meat with thee, Luke 14. 8 9, 10.

I am not mad, most noble Festus, ( said Paul;) but speak forth the word, etc.
Acts 26. 24, 25.

I, etc. communicated that gospel, etc. but privately, to them who were of
reputation, Gal. 2. 2.

Honor ( or, esteem) all men, 1 Pet. 2. 17.

Finally, etc. be courteous, 1 Pet. 3. 8.

The elder unto the elect lady, etc. And now I beseech thee, lady, 2 John,
verse. 1, 5.

VIII. To avoid all unnecessary Society and Fellowship with wicked Men.
THey shall not dwell in the land, lest they make thee sin against me, Exodus
23. 31, 32, 33.

When Jehoshaphat had helped the wicked King of Israel, Jehu, the Son of Hanani
the Seer, went out to meet him, and said to King Jehoshaphat, Should thou
help the ungodly, and love them who hate the Lord? Therefore is wrath upon thee
from before the Lord, 2 Chronicles. 19. 1, 2.

Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor stands
in the way of sinners, nor sits in the seat of scorners, Psalm. 1. 1.

Who shall abide in thy tabernacle? etc. He, in whose eyes a vile person is
contemned, Psalm. 15. 1, 4.

I have not sat with vain persons: neither will I go in with dissemblers. I
have hated the congregation of evildoers: I will not sit with the wicked,
Psalm. 26. 4, 5.

I will not know a wicked person, etc. He who works deceit, shall not dwell
in my house: He who tells lies, shall not tarry in my sight, Psalm. 101. 4, 6,
7. Psalm. 119. 115.

Woe is me, that I sojourn in Mesech, etc. with him who hates peace. I for
peace, etc. they for war, Psalm. 120. 5, 6, 7.

Do not I hate them who hate thee, O Lord? etc. Am not I grieved with those who
rise up against thee? I hate them with a perfect hatred. Psalm. 139. 21, 22.

My son, if sinners entice thee, consent not, etc. Walk not thou in the way
with them: refrain thy foot from their path, Prove. 1. 10, 15.

He who walks with wise men, shall be wise: but a companion of fools shall be
destroyed, Prove. 13. 20.

Go from the presence of a foolish man, (...) thou perceivest not the lips of
knowledge, Prove 14. 7.

Make no friendship with an angry man: and with a furious man thou shall not
go; left thou learn his ways, and get a snare unto thy soul, Prove. 22. 24, 25.

Be not thou envious against evil men: neither desire to be with them, Prove.
24. 1, 2.

I wrote to you in an epistle, not to keep company with fornicators: yet not
altogether with the fornicators of this world, etc. for then mu^t (...) needs
go out of this world, 1 Cor. 5. 9, 10. Eph^s. 5. 5, 6, 7.

Be ye not unequally yoked together with unbelievers, etc. What communion has
light with darkness? And what concord has Christ with Belial? Or what part
has he who believes, with an infidel? 2 Cor. 6. 14, 15.

CHAP. XX.
How Men come truly and spiritually to know the only True God, and Jesus
Christ, whom he has sent; and the Mysteries of Salvation by him, and expressed
in the World: To believe it, bring forth Fruit, and persevere therein, through
Difficulties, to Eternal Life.
I. Man, of himself, can do neither of these.
EXcept the Lord build the house, they labor in vain who build it: Except the
Lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain, Psalm. 127. 1.

Man's goings are of the Lord: how can a man then understand his own way? Prove.
20. 24.

A deceived heart has turned him aside, that he cannot deliver his soul; nor
say, A lie in, etc. Isa. 44. 20.

O Lord, I know that the way of man is not in himself: It is not in man that
walks, to direct his steps, Jer. 10. 23. Prove. 16. 9.

Can the Ethiopian change his skin? etc. May ye also do good, who are
accustomed to do evil? Jer 13. 23.

No man knows the Son, but the Father: neither knows any man the Father,
but the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son will reveal him, Matthew. 11. 27.

A rich man shall hardly enter into the kingdom of heaven, etc. It is easier
for a Camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter,
etc. With men this is impossible: but with God all things are possible, Matthew.
19. 23, 24, 25, 26.

Who are born, not of the flesh, but of God, etc. John 1. 13. chapter 3. 3, etc.

A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven, John 3. 27.

No man can come unto me, except the Father, who has sent me, draw him, etc.
Except it were given to him of my Father, John 6. 44, 65.

As the branch cannot bear fruit of it self, except it abide in the vine: no
more can ye, except you abide in me, etc. for without ( or, severed from) me,
ye can do nothing, John 15. 4, 5.

The carnal mind is enmity against God; for it is not subject to the law of
God, neither indeed can be, Romans 8. 7.

The natural man receives not the things of the spirit of God, for they are
foolishness unto him: neither can he know them, because they are spiritually
discerned, 1 (...) 2. 14. John 8. 43.

By the grace of God I am that I am, etc. Not I, but the grace of God with me,
1 Cor. 15. 10. Gal. 2. 20.

Not that we are sufficient of our selves to think any thing as of our selves;
but our sufficiency is of God, 2 Cor. ^ 5.

The flesh lusts against the spirit, etc., so that ye cannot do the thing
that ye would, Gal. 5. 17. Romans 7. 15, 18.

By grace are ye saved, through faith; and that not of your selves, it is the
gift of God, Ephesians. 2. 8.

II. God, in Christ, does all freely; and has promised so to do, John 15. 1.
WHO am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly
after this sort? etc. Of thine own have we given thee, 1 Chronicles. 29. 14.

But God had not given them a mind to know, and eyes to see, and ears to hear,
unto this day, Deuteronomy. 29. 4.

I. In General, Colos. 1. 10, 11.
And the Lord thy God will circumcise thine heart, and the heart of thy ^eed,
to love the Lord thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, that thou
may live, Deuteronomy. 30. 6.

The hand of God was to give them one heart to do the commandment, etc. by the
word, 2 Chronicles. 30. 12.

Out of the mouths of babes and sucklings have thou ordained strength, Psalm. 8.
2. Matthew. 21. 16.

Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right ( or, constant) spirit in
me, etc. Restore to me the joy of thy salvation: uphold me by thy free spirit,
Psalm. 51. 10, 12.

The God of Israel is he who gives strength and power unto his people, Psalm.
68. 35.

I will go in the strength of the Lord God, etc. Psalm 71. 16.

Turn us again, O God, etc. Quicken us, and we will call upon thy name, etc.
Psalm. 80. 3, 1^, 19.

I am the Lord thy God, etc. Open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it, Psalm. 81.
10.

Blessed is the man, whose strength is in thee, etc. The Lord will g^ve grace
and glory; and no good thing will he withhold, etc. Psalm. 84. 5, 11.

All my springs are in thee, Psalm. 87. 7.

Blessed are the people who know the joyful found: they shall walk, O Lord, in
the light of thy countenance: in thy name shall they rejoice all the day long,
etc. for thou art the glory of their strength, Psalm. 8^. 15, 16, 17.

Thy people shall be willing in the day of thy power, Psalm. 110. 3. Exodus 35.
21.

Trust to the Lord with all thine heart, ann lean not to thine own
understanding: in all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths,
Prove. 3. 5, 6.

The preparations ( or, disposings) of the heart in man, and the answer of the
tongue, are from the Lord, Prove. 16. 1.

Man's goings are of the Lord, Prove. 20. 24.

Draw me, we will run after thee, Cant. 1. 4. Jer. 31. 3. Hos. 11. 3, 4.

He who is left in Zion, etc. shall be called holy, etc. when the Lord shall
have washed away the filth of the daughter of Zion, etc. by the spirit of
judgment, and by the spirit of burning, Isa. 4. 3, 4.

Thou also have wrought all our works in us, ( or, for us:) by thee only will
we make mention, Isa. 26. 12, 13.

Behold, your God will come: then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and
the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped: then shall the ^ame man leap as an
heart, and the tongue of the dumb sing: for in the wilderness shall waters break
out, and streams in the Desert, etc. the parched ground shall become a pool,
and the thirsty land springs, etc. and the high way shall be there, etc. the
wayfaring men, though fools, shall not err, Isa. 35. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.

I, the Lord, have called thee in righteousness, etc. will give thee, etc. a
light to the Gentiles, to open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from
the prison, and them who sit in darkness out of the prisonhouse, Isa. 42. 6, 7.

Look unto me, and be ye saved, all ye ends of the earth: for I am God, etc. In
the Lord have I righteousness and strength, Isa. 45. 22, 24.

That thou may say to the prisoners, Go forth: To them who are in darkness,
Show your selves. They shall feed in the ways, etc. for he who has mercy on
them, shall lead them; even by the springs of water shall he guide them, Isa.
49. 9, 10.

The spirit of the Lord God is upon me, because the Lord has anointed me to
preach good tidings, etc. he has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted, to
proclaim liberty to the captives, and the opening of the prison to them who are
bound, Isa. 61. 1, 2.

Return, etc. and I will heal your backslidings. Behold, we come unto thee,
Jer. 3. 22.

I will be their God; for they shall return unto me with their whole heart,
Jer. 24. 7.

With loving kindness I have drawn thee, etc. Turn thou me, and I shall be
turned; for thou art the Lord my God. Surely, after that I was turned, I
repented: and after that I was instructed, I smote upon the thigh, etc. Behold,
the day comes, says the Lord, that I will make a new covenant, etc. I will
put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts, etc. and they
shall teach no more every man, etc. Jer. 31. 3, 18, 19, 31, 32, 33, 34. Heb. 8.
8, 9, 10, 11. chapter 10. 15, 16, 17.

I will give them one heart, and one way, that they may fear me for ever, etc.
I will put my fear in their hearts, that they shall not depart from me, Jer.
32. 39, 40. Psalm. 86. 11.

Turn thou us unto thee, O Lord; and we shall be turned, Lam. 5. 21.

I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit within you: and I will
take the stony heart out of their flesh, and I will give them an heart of
flesh, that they may walk in my statutes, and keep my ordinances, and do them;
Ezekiel. 11. 19, 20. chapter 20. 43.

Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you, and ye shall be clean, etc. A new
heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put within you: I will take
away the stony heart, etc. and I will put my spirit within you, and cause you
to walk in my statutes; and ye shall keep my judgments, and do them, etc. I
will also save you from all your uncleanness, etc. Then shall ye remember
your own evil ways, and your doings which were not good, and shall loath your
selves in your own sight for your iniquities, Ezekiel. 36. 25, 26, 27, 29, 31.
chap. 16. 61, 63. chap. 37. 14, 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 28.

I taught Ephraim to go, etc. I drew them with the cords of a man, etc. Hos.
11. 3, 4.

I will strengthen them in the Lord, and they shall walk up and down in his
name, Zech. 10. 12.

I will pour upon the house of David, etc. a spirit of grace, and of
supplication; and they shall look upon me whom they have pierced, and they
shall mourn, Zech. 12. 10.

The Lord whom ye seek shall suddenly come, etc. and he shall sit as a refiner
and purifier of silver, and he shall purify the sons of Levi, and purge them
as gold and silver, that they may offer unto the Lord, etc. Mal. 3. 1, 2, 3, 4.

Jesus did but bid the Fishermen follow him, and they immediately leave all,
and follow him, Matthew. 4. 18, 19, 20, 21, 22.

Blessed are they who hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be
filled, Matthew. 5. 6. Luke 1. 53.

The whole need not a physician, but they who are (...) etc. For I am not come
to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance, Matthew. 9. 11, 12. chapter 11. 28.

The kingdom of God is come unto you. Or else how can one enter, etc. except he
bind the strong man, and then spoil his goods? Matthew. 12. 28, 29. Luke. 17. 20,
21.

The Son of man is come to save that which was last etc. How think ye? If a man
have one hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray; does he not, etc. and
seeks that which is gone astray? Even so, it is not the will of your Father,
etc. that one of these little ones should perish, Matthew. 18. 11, 12, 13, 14.
Luke 19. 10.

Which are born, not of blood, etc. but of God, etc. Of his fullness have we
received, grace for grace, John 1. 13, 16. 1 Pet. 1. 23. Col. 1. 19.

Except a man be born again, ( or, from above,) he cannot see the kingdom of
God, etc. The wind blows where it lists, and thou hear the sound
thereof, but can not tell whence it comes, and whither it goes: so is every

And thine ears shall hear a word behind thee, saying, This is the way, walk ye

And a man shall be an hiding place from the wind, a covert from the tempest,

The Lord has given me the tongue of the learned, that I should know how to

Thus says the high and lofty one, etc. I dwell in the high and holy place:

I will make an everlasting covenant with them, and I will not turn away from

Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall rise; when I sit in

Ye shall be brought before governors, and before kings for my sake, etc. take

Whosoever shall drink of the waters which I shall give them, shall never
thirst: but the water which I shall give him, shall be in him a well of water
springing up into everlasting life, John 4. 14.

My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me, and I give them
eternal life; and they shall never perish, nei her shall any man pluck them out
of my hand: my father who gave them me is greater than I, and no man is able to
pluck them out of my father's hands: I and my father one, John 10. 27, 28, 29,
30.

Holy father, keep through thine own name those thou have given me, etc. while
I was with them in the world, I kept them in thy name, etc. I pray, etc. that
thou should keep them from the evil one, John 17. 11, 12, 15.

Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? tribulation, or distress? etc.
nay, in all these things we are more than conquerors through him who loved us:
for I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, etc. shall be able to
separate us from the love of God which is in Christ Jesus our Lord, Romans 8. 25,
30, 37, 38, 39.

Who art thou who judge another man's servant? yea, he shall be holden up:
for God is able to make him stand, Romans 14. 4.

The God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly, etc. Now to him

Jesus Christ, who shall also confirm you unto the end, that ye may be also

7, 8, 9.

There has no tentation taken you but what is common ( or, moderate) unto man:

able, but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, that ye may be
able to bear it, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

Now he who establishes us with you in Christ, and has anointed us, is God;

I sought the Lord, etc. and he said unto me, My grace is sufficient for thee,

Be strong in the Lord, and in the power of his might: Put on the whole armor

Being confident of this very thing, that he who has begun a good work in you,

Every where, and in all things I am instructed, both to be full, and to be

And I pray God, your whole spirit, soul and body, be preserved blameless,

Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, etc. establish you in every good word and

The Lord is faithful who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil, 2 Thessalonians.
3. 3.

I know whom I have believed; and am persuaded that he is able to keep that

No man stood with me, etc. notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and

To an inheritance, etc. reserved for you ( or for us) who are kept by the

But the God of all grace who has called us, etc. after that you have suffered

Whosoever is born of God, does not commit sin, for his seed remains in him:

Ye are of God, little children, and have overcome them: because, greater is he

Now unto him who is able to keep you from falling, and to present you

See more, That Saints shall be kept, Chap. 16.

God in Christ does Command, Invite, and Encourage, by Promises, to come to him
for Teachings, Spiritual Life and Strength; to bring forth Fruit, and
persevere, and to cast our Care upon him for all.
THe Lord, he it is who does go before thee; he will be with thee, he will not
fail thee, neither forsake thee; fear not, neither be dismayed, Deuteronomy. 31. 8.

Wait on the Lord, be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart;
Wait, I say, on the Lord, Psalm. 27. 14.

Cast thy burden upon the Lord, and he shall sustain thee, Psalm 55. 22.

Wisdom cries without, she utters her voice in the streets, etc. How long ye

22, 23. chapter 8. v. 1, to v. 11.

Happy is the man who finds wisdom, and the man who gets understanding,

not to be compared unto her, etc. Then shall thou walk in the way safely, and
thy foot shall not stumble, Prove. 3. 13, 14, 15, 23.

I wisdom, etc counsel is mine, and sound wisdom, I am understanding; I am
strength; By me kings reign, etc. I love them who love me, and those who seek
me early shall and me. Riches and honor are with me; yea, durable riches and
righteousness. My fruit is better than gold, yea, fine gold: and my revenue
than choice silver: I lead in the ways of righteousness, in the midst of the
paths of judgment, that I may cause those who love me to inherit substance: and
I will fill their treasures, etc. Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children,
for blessed are they who keep my ways: Hear instruction and be wise, and refuse
it not; Blessed is the man who hears me, watching daily at my gates, waiting
at the posts of my doors: for whosoever finds me, finds life, Prove. 8. 1, 12,
14, 15, 17, 18, 19, 20, 21, 32, 33, 34, 35. chapter 9. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.

When the poor and needy seek water, and there is none, and their tongue
fails for thirst; I the Lord will hear them, I the God of Israel will not
forsake them; I will open rivers in high places, and fountains in the midst of
the valleys: I will make the wilderness a pool of water, and the dry land
springs of water, Isa. 41. 17, 18. Psalm 69. 3.

I said not to the seed of Jacob, Seek ye my face in vain, etc. Look unto me,

Who is among you who ^eareth the Lord, etc. who walks in darkness, and has

Ho, every one who thirsts, come ye to the waters: and ye who have no money,

labor for that which satisfies not? Hearken diligently to me, and eat ye that

I have seen thy adulteries. etc. Will thou not be made clean? when shall it

As I live, says the Lord God, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked,

O Israel, thou have destroyed thy self: but in me is thine help, Hosea 13. 9.

But seek ye first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these

The whole need not a Physician, but they who are sick, etc. for I am not come

The Parable of the Invitation to the Marriage-Supper, of which many made

O Jerusalem, etc. How often would I have gathered thy children together, even

Ye will not come to me, that ye may have life, John 5. 34, 40. Luke 14. 17,

Jesus said, Labor not for the meat which perishes, but for that meat which

35.

In the last day, that great day of the feast, Jesus stood up and cried,

Let not your hearts be troubled: ye believe in in God, believe also in me,

Abide in me, and I in you: as the branch cannot not bear fruit of it self,

him, the same brings forth much fruit, etc. If ye abide in me, etc. ye shall
ask what ye will, and it shall be done unto you, John 15. 4, 5, 7.

He who spared not his own Son, but delivered him up for us all: how shall he

Be careful for nothing: but in every thing by prayer and supplication with

Jesus, etc. had mercy on me, etc. he might show all clemency, that I might be

God our Savior, who will have all men to be saved, and come to the knowledge

Let us run with patience the race which is set before us, looking unto Jesus

I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou may be rich;

CHAP. XXI.
How does God Work and Effect these Things in the Heart and Spirits of his
Elect?
By his Spirit, whom he promised to them, Luke 11. 15.

has shed forth this which ye now see and here, Acts 2. 33.

And they came every one, etc. whom his Spirit made willing, and they brought

Thou gave also thy good Spirit to instruct them, Nehem. 9. 20.

grass, as willows by the waterside, Isa. 44. 3, 4.

If I cast out devils by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom is come unto you,

Except a man be born again of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into

It is the Spirit who quickens, the flesh profits nothing, etc. John 6. 36.

But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, the

It is expedient for you that I go away: for if I go not away, the Comforter

judgment, etc. I have yet many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them

They were not able to resist the wisdom and spirit by which Stephen spoke.

The love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the holy Ghost, etc. Romans 5. 5.

If the spirit of him who raised Jesus from the dead, dwell in you: he who

dwells in you, etc. If ye through the spirit do mortify the deeds of the

of God, etc. Likewise the spirit also helps our infirmities: for we know not
what we should pray for as we ought: but the spirit himself makes intercession
for us, etc. Romans 8. 11, 13, 14, 26, 27. Ephesians. 2. 18. Ephesians. 6. 18. Jude, verse 20.

That ye may abound in hope through the power of the holy Ghost, etc. That the

Eye has not seen, etc. but God has revealed them unto us by his spirit: for

Such were some of you: but ye are washed, but ye are sanctified, etc. and by

No man can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the holy Ghost. Now there are

Of the Spirit of God further, his being given to, and dwelling in the Saints,
