And because ye are sons, God has sent forth the spirit of his son into your
hearts, crying, Abba father, Gal. 4. 6.

In whom also after that ye believed, ye were sealed with that holy spirit of
promise, which is the earnest of our inheritance, etc. Ephesians. 1. 13, 14.

In whom you also are built together, for an habitation for God through the
spirit, Ephesians. 2. 22. chapter 4. 6.

Be not drunk with wine, etc. but be filled with the spirit, etc. Ephesians. 5. 18.

This shall turn to my salvation through your prayers, and the supply or the
spirit of Jesus Christ, Phil. 1. 19.

If any fellowship of the spirit, etc. Fulfill ye my joy, that ye be
like-minded, Phil. 2. 1, 2.

God, who has also given unto us his holy spirit, 1 Thessalonians. 4. 8.

Then shall that wicked one be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with the
spirit of his mouth, and destroy with the brightness of his coming, 2 Thessalonians. 2.
8.

Being by the holy Ghost who dwells in us, 2 Timothy 1. 14.

According to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and
renewing of the holy Ghost, which he has shed on us abundantly, ( or, richly),
through Jesus Christ our Savior, Tit. 3. 5, 6.

God also bearing them witness, both with, etc. and gifts of the holy Ghost,
according to his own will, Heb. 2. 4.

The Prophets have enquired, etc. what manner of time the spirit of Christ
which was in them, did signify when he spoke before hand, etc. unto whom it
was revealed, etc. by them who have preached the Gospel unto you, with the holy
Ghost sent down from Heaven, 1 Pet. 1. 10, 11, 12.

Christ, etc. being put to death in the flesh, but quickened by the spirit, 1
Pet. 3. 18.

If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy are ye: for the spirit of
glory and of God rests upon you, etc. 1 Pet. 4. 14.

He has given us great and precious promises, that by these ye might be made
partakers of the divine nature, etc. Holy men of God spoke as they were moved
by the holy Ghost, 2 Pet. 1. 4, 21.

Ye have an unction from the holy one, and ye know all things, etc. but the
anointing which ye have received, abides in you etc. the same anointing
teaches you all things, John 2. 20, 27.

Whosoever is born of God does not commit sin, for his seed remains in him:
and hereby we know that he abides in us, by the spirit which he has given us,
1 John 3. 9, 24.

We know that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he has given us of his
spirit, 1 John 4. 13.

It is the spirit who bears witness, because the spirit is truth, etc. Three
who bears record in heaven, the father, the word, and the holy Ghost, and
these three are one, etc. 1 John 5. 6, 7, 8.

These are they, etc. not having the spirit, Jude verse 19.

Grace unto you, etc. and from the seven spirits which are before his throne,
Rev. 1. 4. chapter 3. 1, 5,

Hear what the spirit says unto the Churches, Rev. 2. 7, 11, 17, 29.

I beheld, and lo, etc. a lamb having, etc. seven eyes, which are the seven
spirits of God sent forth into all the earth, Rev. 5. 6.

And the spirit and bride say, come, Rev. 22. 17.

II. The Nature, Workings, and Fruits of the Spirit.
AND the spirit of God moved upon the waters, Genesis 1. 2.

And the Lord said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, Genesis 6. 3.

Balaam who came with a purpose to curse Israel, when the spirit of God came
upon him, he blessed them, Numb. 24. 1, 2, to the 14.

Is the spirit of the Lord straightened ( or, shortened)? are these his doings?
Micah 2. 7.

Handle me, and see me, for a spirit has not flesh and bones, as ye see me to
have, Luke 24. 39.

I saw the spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him,
John 1. 32.

He would have given thee living water, etc. water springing up into eternal
life, John 4. 10, 14.

He who believes, etc. out of his belly shall flow rivers of living waters,
etc. This spoke he of the spirit, etc. John 7. 38, 39.

When he is come, he will convince the world of sin, and of righteousness, and
of judgment, John 16. 8.

They were not able to resist, etc. and the spirit by which he spoke, Acts 16.
10.

The love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by the holy Ghost, Romans 5. 5.

We have not received the spirit of bondage again to fear, but the spirit of
adoption, by which we cry, etc. The spirit it self bears witness with our
spirits, that we are the children of God, Romans 8. 15, 16.

Fervent in the spirit, serving the Lord, Romans 12. 11.

We have not received the spirit of the world, but the spirit of God, 1 Cor. 2.
12.

No man speaking by the spirit of God, ceileth Jesus accursed, etc. that no man
can say that Jesus is the Lord, but by the holy Ghost, etc. There are diversity
of gifts, but the same spirit, etc. to one is given, etc. But all these works
that one and the self same spirit, dividing, etc. 1 Cor. 12. 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, etc.

Who has also sealed us, and given us the earnest of his spirit, 2 Cor. 1. 22.
chapter 5. 5.

Ye are our Epistle, etc. ye are manifestly declared the Epistle of Christ,
etc. written not with ink, but with the spirit of the living God; not in tables
of stone, but in fleshy tables of the heart, etc. The letter kills, but the
spirit gives life, etc. If the ministration of death, etc. were glorious, etc.
How shall not the ministration of the spirit be rather glorious? etc. Now the
Lord is that spirit: and where the spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty, 2
Cor. 3. 2, 3, 6, 7, 8, 17.

God has sent forth the spirit of his son into your hearts, crying, Abba
father, Gal. 4. 6.

For the flesh lusts against the spirit, and the spirit against the flesh:
and these are contrary the one to the other, etc. The fruit of the spirit is
love, joy, peace, long-suffering, gentleness, goodness, faith, meekness,
temperance, Gal. 5. 17, 22, 23.

Ye were sealed with the holy spirit of promise, which is the earnest of our
inheritance, until the purchased possession, Ephesians. 1. 13, 14.

The holy spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed unto the day of redemption, Ephesians.
4. 30.

For the fruit of the spirit is in all, goodness, and righteousness, and truth,
Ephesians. 5. 9.

God has not given us the spirit of fear, but of power, of love, and of a
sound mind, 2 Timothy 1. 7.

Having received the word in much affliction, with joy of the holy Ghost, 1
These. 1. 6. Acts 9. 31.

Christ, who through the eternal spirit offered himself, etc. Heb. 9. 14.

The anointing teaches you, etc. and is truth, and is no lie, 1 John 2. 27.

Try the spirits, whether they are of God, etc. Hereby know ye the spirit of
God: every spirit that confesses Jesus Christ to have been come in the flesh,
is of God. And every spirit which confesses not that Jesus Christ is come in
the f^esh, is not of God, etc. Greater is he that is in you, than he who is in
the world, 1 John 4. 1, 2, 3, 4.

It is the spirit who bears witness, because the spirit is truth, etc. The
Father, the Word, and the holy Ghost, and these there are one, 1 John 5. 6, 7,
8.

The spirit and the bride say, Come, Rev. 22. 17.

III. Saints Duty toward the Spirit.
1. In following after him, and making use of him.
THE manifestation of the spirit is given to ^^ry man to profit withal, 1 Cor.
12. 7.

The same anointing teaches you of all things, 1 John 2. 27.

And the Lord said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, Genesis 6. 3.

The true worshippers shall worship the father in spirit and in truth: for the
father seeks such to worship him: God is a spirit, and they who worship him,
must worship him in spirit and in truth, John 4. 23, 24.

Fervent in the spirit, serving the Lord, Romans 12. 11.

The manifestation of the spirit is given to every man to profit withal, 1 Cor.
12. 7.

I will pray with the spirit, etc. I will sing with the spirit, etc. 1 Cor. 14.
15.

Walk ye not in the same spirit? 2 Cor. 12. 18.

Are ye so foolish, having begun in the spirit, are ye now made perfect by the
flesh? Gal. 3. 3.

Walk in the spirit, and ye shall not fulfill the lusts of the flesh, etc. If ye
be led by the spirit, ye are not under the law, etc. If we live in the spirit,
let us also walk in the spirit, Gal. 5. 16, 17, 18, 25. 1 John 2. 27.

He who sows to the spirit, shall of the spirit reap life everlasting, Gal.
6. 8.

Be not drunk, etc. but be ye filled with the spirit, Ephesians. 5. 18.

The sword of the spirit, which is the word of God, etc. praying always with
all prayer and supplication in the spirit, Ephesians. 6. 17, 18.

We are the circumcision, who worship God in the spirit, Phil. 3. 3.

Wherefore as the holy Ghost says, If ye will hear his voice, etc. Hebr. 3. 7.

Build up your selves, etc. praying in the holy Ghost, Jude, v. 20.

He who has an ear, let him hear what the spirit says to the Churches, Rev.
2. 7, 11, 17, 29.

2. Not to sin against, grieve, or quench the Spirit.
But they rebelled and vexed his holy spirit, therefore he was turned to be
their Enemy, Isa. 63. 10.

But the blasphemy against the holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men, etc.
Whosoever speaks a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: out
whosoever speaks against the (...) shall not be forgiven him, neither (...)
Matthew. 12. 31, 32. Mark 3. (...)

(...) Satan filled thine heart to (...) etc. thou have not lied unto (...)
God, etc. How is it that ye have (...) to tempt the spirit of the Lord, etc.
she (...) down and died, etc. Acts 5. 2, 3, 5, 8, 9, 10.

Ye stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and ears: ye do always resist the
holy Ghost: as your fathers did, so do ye, etc. Have not your fathers
persecuted? etc. Acts 7. 51, 52.

Simon offered money, for power to confer the holy Ghost, Acts 8. 18, 19.

The Sadduces say, that there is no resurrection, neither angel nor spirit,
Acts 23. 8.

Keep the unity of the spirit in the bond of peace, etc. and grieve not the
holy spirit of God, whereby ye are sealed, Ephesians. 4. 3, 30.

Quench not the spirit, 1 These. 5. 19.

He who despised Moses law, died without mercy, etc. Of how much sorer
punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who has trodden under foot
the son of God, etc. and has done despite unto the spirit of Grace? Heb. 10.
28, 29.

The spirit of God, and of Glory, rests upon you: on their parts he is evil
spoken of, etc. 1 Pet. 4. 14.

CHAP. XXII.
Of Afflictions, Troubles, and Persecutions.
1. To whom they belong, or who way expect thom.
1. Common to all.
MAN is born unto trouble as the sparks fly upward, Job 5. 7.

Man who is born of a woman, is of few days, and full of trouble, Job 14. 1.

2. More especially, the Saints, Believers, such as are born of the Spirit.
First, The Holy Ghost affirms this.
I Will be his father, and he shall be my son: If he commit iniquity, I will
chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men:
but my mercy shall not depart away from him, etc. 2 Samuel 7. 14, 15. Psalm. 99. 8.

Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the Lord delivers him, etc.
Psalm. 34. 19.

For whom the Lord loves, he corrects; even as the father the son in whom he
delights, Prove. 3. 12.

Behold, I and the children whom the Lord has given me, are for signs and
wonders in Israel, Isa. 8. 18.

He who departs from evil, makes himself a prey, Isa. 59. 15.

They watch for iniquity, they make a man an offender for a word, etc. Isa. 29.
20, 21.

You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore will I
punish you for all your iniquities, Amos 3. 2.

Beware of men, for they will deliver you up to the Councels: and they will
scourge you in their Synagogues: and ye shall be brought before governors and
kings for my sake, etc. and the brother shall deliver up the brother to death,
and the father the child, etc. and ye shall be hated of all men for my name's
sake, etc. The disciple is not above his master, etc. It is enough for the
disciple that he be as his Master, and the servant as his Lord: if they have
called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of
the household? etc. Think not that I am come to send peace on earth, etc. A
man's enemies shall be they of his own household, Mat. 10. 17, 18, 21, 22, 24,
25, 34, 35, 36. chap. 24. 9, 10. Luke 21. 12, 13, 14, etc. Mark 10. 30.

Then said Jesus unto his disciples, If any man will come after me, let him
deny himself, and take up his cross and follow me, Matthew. 16. 24. Mark 8. 34,
35.

Woe unto you who laugh now, for ye shall mourn and weep; woe unto you when all
men shall speak well of you: for so did their fathers to the false prophets,
Luke 6. 25, 26.

Jesus said unto him, Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but
the Son of man has not where to lay his head, Luke 9. 58.

If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before it hated you. If ye
were of the world, the world would love its own; but because ye are not of the
world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.
Remember the word I said unto you, The servant is not greater than his Lord: if
they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you, etc. These things they
will do unto you for my name's sake, because they know not him who sent me,
John 15. 18, 19, 20, 21, 1 John 3. 13. John 17. 14.

These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended: But they
shall put you out of their Synagogues; yea, the time comes, that whosoever
kills you, will think that he does God service; and these things will they do
unto you, because they have not known the father, nor me, etc. Ye shall weep
and lament, but the world shall rejoice; ye shall be sorrowful, etc. In the
world ye shall have tribulation, John 16. 1, 2, 3, 20, 22, 33.

Of a truth, against the holy child Jesus, etc. both Herod, etc. were gathered
together, to do whatsoever thy hand and thy counsel determined before to be
done, Acts 4. 27, 28.

The Lord said of Paul, I will show him how great things he must suffer for my
Name, Acts 9. 15, 16.

Exhorting them to continue in the faith: and that we must through much
tribulation enter into the kingdom of God, Acts 14. 22. Mark 10. 30.

The holy Ghost witnesses in every city, saying, That bonds and afflictions
abide me, Acts 20. 23.

Always we who live are delivered to death for Christ's sake, that also the
life of Jesus, etc. 2 Cor. 4. 11. chapter 7. 5.

But as then, he who was born after the flesh, persecuted him who was born
after the spirit, so it is now, Gal. 4. 29.

We wrestle not with flesh, etc. but with principalities, etc. Ephesians. 6. 11,
12, 13.

Unto you it is given, etc. not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for
his sake, Phil 1. 29.

That no man be moved by these afflictions: for your selves know that we are
appointed thereunto, 1 These. 3. 3.

All who will live godly in Christ Jesus, shall suffer persecution, 2 Timothy 3.
12.

Whom the Lord loves he chasteneth, etc. for what son is he whom the father
chasteneth not? but if ye be without chastisements, whereof all are partakers,
then are ye bastards, and not sons, Heb. 12. 6, 7, 8.

Think it not strange concerning the fiery trial, etc. as though some strange
thing happened to you: but rejoice, in as much as ye are made partakers of
Christ's sufferings: judgment must begin at the house of God, 1 Pet. 4. 12, 13,
17.

The devil, etc. whom resist, etc. that the same afflictions are accomplished
in your brethren, 1 Pet. 5. 8, 9.

Behold, the devil shall cast some of you in prison, that ye may be tried: and
ye shall have tribulation ten days, Rev. 2. 10.

As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: Be zealous therefore, etc. Rev. 3. 19.

These are they who came out of great tribulation, and have washed, etc. Rev.
7. 14.

Secondly, That the Saints have been so exercised with Afflictions, in Soul and
Body, from God: and in their Bodies, and outward Concerns, from Men, by
Persecutions.
1. From God more immediately, Prove. 18. 14.
JAcob sorely afflicted in Joseph and other of his sons, Genesis 37. chapter 34.

The Almighty has dealt very bitterly with me, I went forth full, and the Lord
has brought me home again empty, etc. Ruth 1. 20, 21.

Job greatly afflicted in his out-things: and his body, Job 1. 13, to the end.
chapter 2. 5, 6, 7, 8. chapter 7. 3, 4, 5, etc. chapter 9. 27, 28, etc.

O that my grief were thoroughly weighed, etc. for now it would be heavier than
the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up ( or, I want words to
express my grief); for the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison
thereof drinks up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array
against me, Job 6. 1, 2, 3, 4. chapter 13. 24, 26. chapter 19. chapter 30. Psalm. 38. 2.
Psalm. 55. 4, 5.

I was full of confusion, therefore see my affliction, Job. 10. 15, 16, etc.

My soul is sore vexed, O Lord, how long? etc. I am weary with my groaning: all
the night ( or, every night) make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with
tears: mine eye is consumed because of grief, etc. Psalm. 6. 3, 7. Psalm. 32. 4.
Psalm. 102. 3, 4, etc.

My God, my God, why have thou forsaken me? etc. I cry in the daytime, and
thou hear not, Psalm. 22. 1, 2.

I am desolate and afflicted: the troubles of mine heart are enlarged, etc.
Psalm. 25. 16, 17. Ps. 40. 12. Ps. 102. 3, 4, 5, 6, 9. Ps. 143. 4.

My tears have been by meat, while they continually say unto me, Where is thy
God, Ps. 42. 3, 10.

Make me to hear joy and gladness: that the bones thou have broken may rejoice:
hide thy face from my sin, Psalm. 51. 8, 9.

Save me, O God, for the waters are come in unto my soul: I sink in deep mire,
where is no standing; I am come into deep waters ( or, depth of waters) where
the floods overflow me: I am weary of my crying: my throat is dry: mine eye
fail, while I wait for my God, Psalm. 69. 1, 2, 3. Psalm. 42. 6, 7.

All the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every morning, Psalm. 73.
14.

In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; my sore ran in the night, and
ceased not! my soul refused to be comforted: I remembered God, and was troubled;
I complained, and my spirit was overwhelmed, Selah. Thou hold mine eyes
waking: I am so troubled that I cannot speak, etc. Will the Lord cast off for
ever? Will he be favorable no more? Is his mercy clean gone for ever? does his
promise fail? Psalm. 77. 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8. Psalm. 142. 3, 4, 6. Psalm. 143. 4, 7.
Luke 18. 8.

My soul is full of troubles, etc. Thou have laid me in the lowest pit, in
darkness, in the depths: thy wrath lies hard on me, thou have afflicted me
with all thy waves, etc. I am afflicted, and ready to die: I suffer thy
terrors: I am distracted: thy fierce wrath goes over me: thy terrors have cut
me off, Psalm. 88. 3, 6, 7, 9, 14, 15, 16, 17. Psalm. 38. 4, 6, 8, 10. Ps. 31. 9,
10. Prove. 18. 14. Psl. 40. 12.

Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O Lord, Psalm. 130. 1.

Jonah cast into the sea, and in the belly of the fish, Jonah 1. 15. chap. 2.

For this cause many are weak and sickly among you, etc. We are chastened of
the Lord, etc. 1 Cor. 11. 30, 31, 32.

We are troubled on every side: without were fightings, within were fears, 2
Cor. 7. 5.

Hezekiah, etc. was left of God, in the business of the ambassadors of the
king of Babylon, to try him, that he might know all which was in his heart, 2 Chronicles. 33. 31.

2. From Men, by Persecutions of various kinds, Gal. 4. 29.
WE are troubled on every side, yet not distressed, etc. persecuted, but not
forsaken, etc. 2 Cor. 4. 8, 9, 10, 11.

First, From Men openly wicked: Heathens, Infidels.
Joseph, because he refused to sin with Potiphar's wife, was by her means
imprisoned in Egypt, Genesis 39. 7, 8, 9, to. v. 21.

When Israel began to increase in Egypt, the king said, Come, let us deal
wisely with them, lest they multiply: and it come to pass, when there fall out
any war, etc. Therefore did they set over them taskmasters, to afflict them
with their burdens, etc. They made them serve with rigor: and they made their
lives bitter with hard bondage, etc. ordered the Midwives to kill the
male-children, Exodus 1. 7, 8, 9, to v. 17.

Afterward they laid the burden heavier, allowing them no straw, and yet
required the tale of brick, Ezod. 5. 6, 7, 8, 9, 11.

Pharaoh pursued after Israel with a great army unto the red sea, Exodus 14. 7,
8, 9, 10.

The adversaries of Israel and Judah troubled them in their building, and hired
counselors against them to frustrate their purpose, etc. Afterward Rehum the
Chancellor wrote to the king, etc. The Jews are building the rebellious and bad
City, etc. If this City be builded, and the walls set up again, then will not
they pay toll, tribute, etc. and so thou shall endamage the revenue of the
kings: now because we have maintenance from the king's palace, it was not meet
for us to see the king's dishonor, etc. This City is a rebellious City, and
hurtful unto kings, etc. and that they have moved sedition within the same of
old, etc. If this City be built, etc. by this means thou shall have no portions
on this side the river, etc. So they hasted to Jerusalem, and by force stayed
the work, Ezra 4. 1, 4, 5, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 23, 24.

Sanballat laughed us to scorn, etc. said, etc. Will ye re rebel against the
king? Nehem. 2. 19. chapter 6. 6, 7, 8.

When Sanballat and others heard that the walls of Jerusalem were made up, etc.
they were very wroth, and conspired all of them together to come to fight
against Jerusalem, and to hinder it, etc. Nehem. 4. 2, 3, 7, 8.

They hired men to draw Nehemiah to sin, that they might have occasion to
reproach him, Neh. 6. 12, 13.

When Haman saw that Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence: then was Haman
full ofwrath, etc. wherefore Haman sought to destroy all the Jews, etc. said
unto the king, There is a certain people, etc. and their laws are diverse from
all people, neither keep they the king's laws: therefore it is not for the
king's profit to suffer them. Let it please the king that it may be written,
that they may be destroyed: and I will pay, etc. The king grants his desire,
etc. Esth. 3. 5, 6, 8, 9, 10, 11.

Many say of my soul, There is no help from him in his God. Selah. Psalm. 3. 2.

The wicked in pride does persecute the poor, etc. Psalm. 10. 2, 8, 9.

The wicked bend their bow, etc. that they may privily shoot at the upright in
heart, Psalm. 11. 2.

All they who see me, laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the
head, saying, He trusted in the Lord that he would deliver him let him deliver
him, seeing ( or, if) he delights in; him, Psalm. 221. 7, 8.

They devise deceitful matters against them who are quiet in the land, etc.
They have said, Aha, aha, our eyes has seen, etc. so would we have it, Psalm,
35. 20, 21, 25.

The wicked plotteth ( or, practices) against the just, and gnasheth upon him
with his teeth, etc. The wicked have drawn out their sword, etc. to cast down
the poor and needy, to slay such as be of upright conversation, Psalm. 37. 12,
14.

They also who seek after my life lay snares: and they who seek my hurt speak
mischievous things, and imagine deceits all the day long, etc. when my foot
llippeth, they magnify themselves against me, etc. They also who render evil
for good are my adversaries, because I follow that which is good, Psalm. 38. 12,
16, 19, 20. Ps. 109. 4, 5.

For thy sake are we killed all the day long: we are counted as sheep for the
slaughter, Psalm. 44. 22.

Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people as they eat
bread? Ps. 53. 4. Ps. 25. 19.

Being angry with intestine hatred, they persecute me, Psalm. 55. 3.

Man would swallow me up: he fighting daily oppresses me: my enemies would
daily swallow me up, for they be many who fight against me, etc. every day they
wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil, Psalm. 56. 1, 2, 5.

The mighty are gathered against me, not for my transgression, nor my sin: O
Lord, they run and prepare themselves without my fault, etc. Psalm. 59. 3, 4, 7.
Ps. 119. 86, 161.

The workers of iniquity, who whet their tongues like a sword, etc. bitter
words: that they may shoot in secret at the perfect, etc. Psalm. 64. 2, 3, 4, 5.

They who hate me without a cause, are more than the hairs of mine head, Psalm.
69. 4. Psalm. 109. 2, 3, 4.

They who hate thee, have lifted up the head; they have taken crafty counsel
against thy people, and consulted against thy hidden ones: They have said,
Come, and let us cut them off, etc. Psalm. 83. 2, 3, 4, 5. Psalm. 31. 13.

How long shall the wicked triumph? shall they utter and speak hard things,
etc. they break in pieces thy people, O Lord, and afflict thine heritage, etc?
Who frame mischief by a law: they gather themselves together against the soul
of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood, Ps. 94. 3, 4, 5, 20, 21.

The proud have forged a lie against me, Ps. 119. 69, 86.

We are exceedingly filled with contempt: our foul is exceedingly filled with
the scorning of those who are at ease, with the contempt of the proud, Psalm.
123. 3, 4.

The enemy has persecuted, etc. my spirit overwhelmed, etc. my heart is
desolate, etc. my spirit fails, etc. Psalm. 143. 3, 4, 7.

All that pass by the way clap their hands at thee: they hiss and wag their
head at the daughter of Jerusalem, saying, Is this the City? etc. we have
swallowed up: certainly this is the day we looked for: We have found, etc. Lam.
2. 15, 16.

There are certain Jews whom thou have set o^r the affairs of the provinces,
etc. These men, O king, have not regarded thee; they served not thy gods, nor
worship golden-images, etc. and they cast them into the fiery-furnace, Dan. 3.
9, 12, 20, 21.

The wicked devoureth the man who is more righteous than he, Habak. 1. 13.

The princes and the presidents sought to find occasion against Daniel
concerning the kingdom; but they could find none, etc. Then said these men, We
shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him
in the law of his God, etc. They procure a law, that none should ask of any god
or man, but the king, etc. watch Daniel, accuse him, and cast him into the
lions den, Dan. 6. 4, 5, to v. 17.

They afflict the just, therefore the prudent shall keep silence, etc. for it is
an evil time, Amos 5. 12, 13.

Herod had laid hold on John, and bound him, and put him in prison for Herodias
sake, etc. for John said to him, It is not lawful for thee to have her, etc.
and he sent and beheaded John in the prison, Mat. 14. 3, 4, 9, 10.

Herod and Pilate (who were at enmity before) persecute Christ, and were made
friends, Luke 23. 11, 12.

Because you are not of the world, etc. therefore the world hates you, John
15. 19.

They disputed with Stephen: and they were not able to resist the wisdom and
spirit by which he spoke: then they stirred up the people, etc. and came upon
him, and caught him, and brought him to the council, and set up false
witnesses, Acts 6. 9, to 14.

Herod the king stretched forth his hand to vex certain of the church, and he
killed James the brother of John with the sword: and because he saw it pleased
the Jews, he proceeded to take Peter, and imprison him, etc. Acts 12. 1, 2, 3,
4.

They caught Paul and Silas, and drew them into the marketplace unto the
rulers, and brought (...) to the magistrares, saying, These men being Jews do
exceedingly trouble our city, and teach customs which are not lawful for us to
receive, neither to observe, being Romans, etc. they beat them, put. them into
prison, Acts 16. 19, to v. 25. chapter 19. 9.

The Philosophers, etc. say unto Paul, What will this babbler ( or, base fellow)
say? Acts 17. 18.

There arose no small stir about that way: for a certain man, etc. who made
silver shrines for Diana, etc. complained against Paul, made a great uproar,
laid hold of Paul's companions, Acts 19. 23, to v. 30.

We would not have you ignorant of our trouble, which came to us in Asia, 2
Cor. 1. 8, 9.

I suffer trouble unto bonds, 2 Timothy 2. 9.

Ye endured a great fight of afflictions: partly whiles ye were made a
gazing-stock, both by reproaches and afflictions, etc. Ye took joyfully the
spoiling of your goods, etc. Heb. 10. 32, 33, 34.

Others were tortured, etc. Others had trial of cruel mockings and scourgings:
yea, moreover of bonds and imprisonments, etc. of whom the world was not
worthy, Heb. 11. 35, 36, 37, 38.

Do not rich men oppress you by tyranny, and draw you to the tribunals? James
2. 6.

Ye have condemned and killed the just: and he does not resist you, James 5. 6.

They speak evil of you, as of evil doers, etc. 1 Pet. 3. 16. chapter 4. 4.

The world has not known you, because they have not known him, etc. Marvel
not, my brebrethren, if the world hate you, 1 (...) 3. 1, 13. chapter 3. 30.

I John, etc. was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and
for the testimony of Christ Jesus, Rev. 1. 9.

Secondly, From hypocritical Professors of the true, God, Jews, Men zealous of
the Law and Traditions.
The Lord had respect unto Abel and his offering. But unto Cain and his
offering he had no respect, etc. Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and
slew him, Genesis 4. 4, 5, 8. 1 John 3. 12. Genesis 27. 43.

Esau came^forth against Jacob with four hundred men, Genesis 32. 6, 7, 8, etc.

Joseph's brethren hate him, and could not speak peaceably unto him, etc. they
conspired against to slay him, etc. they cast him into a p^t, etc. they sell
him to the Ishmaelites, etc. Genesis 37. 4, 10, 11, 18, 20, 24, 27, 28. chapter 45. 4,
5.

Joshua envied Eldad and Medad for prophesying, and would have Moses forbid
them, but Moses rebukes him, Numb. 11. 27, 28, 29.

Saul eyed David that day and forward, etc. He said, I will smite David, etc.
he became his enemy continually, often attempted to take away his life from
him, 1 Samuel 18, 8, 9, 11, 17, 29. ch 19. 1, 9, 10, 11. chapter 22. chapter 24. chapter 26.

Absalom conspired against his father David, 2 Samuel 15.

Shimei cursed David when he fled from Absalom, 2 Samuel 16. 5, 6, 7, 8, 13.

Ahab pursued Elijah in every nation, etc. he said to Elijah, when he saw him,
Art thou he who troubles Israel? 1 Kings 18. 10, 17. chapter 21. 20.

Jezebel threatens to take away Elijah his life, 1 Kings 19. 1, 2.

Jeremy says, O Lord, etc. revenge me of my persecutors, etc. for thy sake I
have suffered rebuke, Jer. 15. 15. Matthew. 5. 12. Jer. 20. 1, 2, 7, 10. chapter 26.
11. chapter 37. 14, 15, 16. chapter 38. 4, 6.

They hate him who rebukes in the gate: and they abhor him who speaks
uprightly, etc. they afflict the just, Amos 5. 10, 12. 1 Kings 22. 8.

John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say he has a devil: the Son
of man came eating and drinking, and they say, behold a man gluttonous, etc.
Matthew. 11. 18, 19.

Behold, I send unto you Prophets, and wise men, and Scribes, and some of them
ye shall kill and crucify, and some of them shall ye scourge in your
Synagogues, and persecute them from City to City, Matthew. 23. 31, 32, 34.

Some said Christ was a good man: others said no, but he deceives the people:
howbeit no man spoke openly of him for fear of the Jews, John 7. 12, 13. Luke
23. 2.

The Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ,
he should be put out of the Synagogue, etc. They reviled the man who owned
Christ to them; they say, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and do thou
teach us? and they cast him out ( or, excommunicated him). John 9. 22, 28, 33,
34.

The chief Priests consulted that they might put Lazarus also to death, because
that by reason of him, many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus, John
12, 10, 11.

When Peter had spoke unto the people, the Priests and the Rulers of the temple
came upon them, being grieved that they taught the people, and preached, etc.
the resurrection, etc. And they laid hands on them, and put them in hold, etc.
that it spread no further among the people, let us straightly threaten them, etc.
So when they had further threatened them, etc. Acts 4. 1, 2, 3, 17, 21.

The high Priest rose up, and all who were with him, etc. and were filled with
indignation ( or, envy) and laid their hands on the Apostles, and put them into
the common prison, etc. when the Apostles had spoke to them, they were cut to
the heart, and they took counsel to slay them, Acts 5. 16, 17, 18, 32. Mark.
15. 10.

They suborn witnesses against Stephen, and said, We have heard him speak
blasphemous words against Moses, and against God, etc. That Jesus shall destroy
this place, and change the customs which Moses delivered us. Acts 6. 10, 11,
12, 13, 14. So against Christ, Matthew. 26, 59, 60, 61. so against Naboth, 1
Kings 7. 8. to the 13. Psalm ^^9 69.

They run upon Stephen with one accord, and cast him out of the City. and
stoned him, Acts 7. 57, 58.

There was a great persecution against the Church at Jerusalem, and they were
all scattered abroad, etc. Saul made havoc of the Church, entering into every
house, and haling men and women, committing them to prison, Acts 8. 1, 3. chapter
26. 10, 11.

Saul breathed out threatening and slaughter against the Disciples of the Lord:
Went unto the high Priest, and desired of him letters, etc. that if he found
any of this way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound unto
Jerusalem, etc. When he was converted, the Jews took council to kill him, etc.
and they watched the gates day and night to kill him, Acts 9. 1, 2, 22, 23, 24.
Gal. 1. 13, 14. 1 Timothy 1. 13.

Herod having killed James, and because he saw it pleased the Jews, be
proceeded, Acts 12. 2, 3.

When the Jews saw the multitude, they were filled with envy, and spoke against
those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming, etc. But
the Jews stirred up the devout and honorable women, and the chief men of the
City, and raised persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and expelled them out
of their coasts, Acts 13. 45, 50.

In Iconium, they went both together into the Synagogue to speak, etc. But the
unbelieving Jews stirred up the Gentiles, and made their minds evil affected
against the brethren, etc. and they fled unto Lystra, etc. And there came
thither certain Jews from Antioch, etc. who persuaded the people, and having
stoned Paul, drew him out of the City, supposing he had been dead, Acts 14. 1,
2, 6, 19.

When Paul had reasoned with them of Thessalonica, that Christ had suffered,
etc. the Jews who believed not, moved with envy, took unto them certain lewd
fellows of the baser sort, and gathered a company, and set all the City in an
uproar, and assaulted the house of Jason, etc. they drew Jason and certain
brethren unto the rulers of the City, crying, These who have turned the World
upside down, are come hither also, whom Jason has received: and these all do
contrary to the decrees of Caesar. saying, That there is another King, one
Jesus, etc. When the Jews, etc. had knowledge that the word of God was preached
of Paul at Berea, they came thither also, and stirred up the people, Acts 17.
1. 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 13.

After Paul had preached at Corinth, etc. the Jews made an insurrection with
one accord against Paul, and brought him to the Judgment Seat, saying, This
fellow persuaded men to worship God contrary to the law, Acts 18. 11, 12, 13.

The Jews when they saw Paul in the Temple, stirred up all the people, and laid
hands upon him, crying our, Men of Israel help, this is the man who teaches
all men every where, against the people, and the law, and this place, etc. and
has polluted this holy place, etc. They took him, and drew him out of the
Temple, etc. went about to kill him, Acts 21. 27, 28, 29, 30, 31.

They cried out against Paul, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth:
for it is not fit be should live, etc. After they bind themselves under a
curse, to kill him, Acts 22. 22, 23. chapter 23. 12.

The high Priest and Elders, by Tertullus the Orator, said of Paul before the
Governor, We have found this man a pestilent fellow, a mover of sedition among
all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the
Nazarens: who also has gone about to profane the temple, etc. Paul said,
Neither can they prove the things whereof they accuse me, etc. I confess, after
the way they call heresy, so worship I, etc. Acts 24. 1, 2, 5, 6, 13, 14.

The high Priest and chief of the Jews, informed Festus against Paul, and
besought him, etc. that he would send him to Jerusalem, laying wait in the way
to kill him, etc. They laid many and grievous complaints against him, which
they could not prove, Acts 25. 2, 3, 7.

As concerning this sect, we know that it is every where spoken against, Acts
28. 22.

Paul confesses that when he profited in the Jewish religion, he persecuted
the Church, Gal. 1. 13, 14.

Ye also have suffered like things of your own contrymen, even as they have
of the Jews, who both killed the Lord Jesus and their own prophets, and have
persecuted us, etc. forbidding us to speak to the Gentiles, 1 Thessalonians. 2. 14, 15,
16.

Alexander the copper-smith did me much evil, etc. of whom be thou also aware:
for he has greatly withstood our words, 2 Timothy 4. 14 15.

The dragon persecuted the woman, Rev. 12. 13, 15, 16, 17.

See more Chap. 28. of Hypoeritet in this matter.

II. For what Ends does God Chastise his Children, and suffer them to be
Persecuted.
1. To Exercise and try their Faith and Obedience.
GOD tempted Abraham when he put him upon offering his son Isaac, Genesis 22. 1,
2, 3, etc.

The Lord thy God led thee these forty years to humble thee, and to prove thee,
to know what was in thine heart, whether thou would keep his commandments, or
no, Deuteronomy. 8. 2, 16.

I also will not henceforth drive out any from before them, of the nations
which Joshua left when he died: that through them I may prove Israel, whether
they will keep the way of the Lord, etc. or not, Judges 2. 21, 22, 23, chapter 3. 4.

In the business of the Ambassadors God left Hezekiah to try him, that he
might know all that was in his heart, etc. 2 Chronicles. 32. 31.

And the Lord said unto Satan, Have thou considered my servant Job, etc.? still
he holds fast his integrity, although thou movest me against him to destroy
him without cause, Job. 2. 3.

What is man, etc.? that thou should visit him every morning, and try him
every moment? Job 7. 17, 18.

Thou, O Lord, have proved us: thou have tried us as silver is tried: thou
broughtest us into the net: thou laidst afflictions upon our loins, Psalm. 66.
10, 11, 12.

Some of them of understanding shall fall to try them, etc. Daniel 11. 35.

I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver
is refiued, and will try them as Gold is tried, Zech. 13. 9.

Others had trials of cruel mockings and scourgings, etc. Heb. 11. 36, 37.

Count it all joy when ye fall into diverse tentations: knowing that the trying
of your faith works patience; etc. Blessed is the man who endures
temptations: for when he is tried, he shall receive, etc. James 1. 2, 3, 12.

Though now for a season, it need be, ye are in heaviness: that the trial of
your faith being much more precious, etc. 1 Pet. 1. 6, 7.

Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial, which is to try you,
as though some strange thing happened unto you. But rejoice, in as much as ye
are partakers of Christ's suffering, etc. 1 Pet. 4. 12, 13.

Fear none of those things which thou shall suffer: behold, the devil shall
cast some of you into prison, that ye may be tried, Rev. 2. 10.

I will keep thee from the hour of tentation, which shall come upon all the
world, to try them who dwell upon the earth, Rev. 3. 10.

2. To Humble and Purge them.
THE Lord thy God led thee forty years in the wilderness to humble thee, etc.
Who sed thee in the wilderness with manna, etc. that he might humble thee, etc.
etc. Deuteronomy. 8. 2, 16.

So Manasseth made Judah, etc. to err, to do worse than the heathen: Wherefore
the Lord brought upon them the captain of the host of the King of Assyria, who
took Manass^h, etc. bound him with ^etters, and carried him to Babylon. And
when he was afflicted, he besought the Lord his God, and humbled himself
greatly before the God of his fathers, etc. And God brought him again into his
kingdom, etc. He then took away the strange Gods, etc. 2 Chronicles. 33 9, 10, 11,
12, 13, 15, 16.

Job complains of his afflictions: then says, what is man that thou should
magnify him, etc. I have sinned, what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver
of men? Job. 7. 16, 17, 18, 19, 20.

Will thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and will thou pursue the dry
stubble? for thou writest bitter things against me, Job. 13 25.

If they be, etc. holden in cords of afflictions: then he shows them their
work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded: he opens their ears
to discipline, and commands that they return from iniquity, Job. 36. 8, 9, 10.

Behold, I am vile; What shall I answer thee? I will lay my hand upon my mouth:
once have I spoken: but, etc. but I will proceed no farther, Job 40. 4, 5.

I have heard of thee, etc. but now mine eyes see thee: wherefore I abhor my
self, etc. Job. 42. 5, 6.

Has he smitten him, etc.? By this therefore shall the iniquity of Jacob be
purged: and this is all the fruit, to take away his sin, Isa. 27. 7, 8, 9.

Ephraim by chastisement was humbled and instructed, Jerem. 31. 18, 19.

My fury and mine anger was poured out, etc. They are not humbled unto this
day: neither have they feared, nor walked in my law, Jer. 44. 6, 10.

I will cause you to pass under the rod, etc. and you shall remember your ways,
etc. and ye shall loath your selves in your own sight, Ezekiel. 20. 37, 38, 43.

Some of them of understanding shall fall, etc. to purge and to make them
white, Dan. 11. 35.

I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine them as silver,
Zech. 13. 9.

Le^t I should be exalted above measure, etc. there was given to me a thorn in
the flesh, a messenger of Satan to buffet me, 2 Cor. 12, 7.

3. To make them to remember God, and things above: to look to, own them, and
close with them.
JAcob was greatly afraid and distressed: and Jacob said, O God of my father
Abraham, etc. the Lord, who said unto me Return, etc. Gen 32. 6, 7, 8, 9, 10,
11, 12.

When Joseph's brethren were dealt roughly with, they remembered their sin
against Joseph, Genesis 42. 21.

He suffered thee to hunger, etc. that thou may know that man lives not by
bread alone, but, etc. Deuteronomy. 8. 3.

But when they in their trouble did turn to the Lord God of Israel and sought
him, etc. 2 Chronicles. 15. 4.

When Manasseh was in affliction, he besought the Lord his God, etc. then
manasseth^knew that the Lord he was God, 2 Chronicles. 33. 12, 13. Job. 36 9, 10.

God has overthrown me, and has encompassed me with his net, etc. For I know
my redeemer I veth, and he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth, etc.
in my flesh shall I see God, Job. 19. 6, 25, 26, 27.

When my heart is overwhelmed, lead me to the rock that is higher than I: for
thou have been a shelter, Psalm. 61. 2, 3.

When he slew them, then they sought him, and returned and enquired early after
God: and they remembered that God was their rock, etc. Psalm. 78. 34, 35. Isa.
9. 13.

It is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I might learn thy statutes:
the law of thy mouth is better to me than thousands of gold, etc. Psalm. 119.
71, 72.

My beloved had withdrawn himself: was gone, my soul failed, etc. I sought him,
etc. Cant. 5. 6.

Such as escape of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him who
smote them; but shall stay upon the Lord, the holy one of Israel in truth, Isa.
10. 20, 21.

In that day it shall come to pass, that the glory of Jacob shall be made thin,
etc. At that day shall a man look to his maker, and his eyes shall have respect
to the holy one of Israel; and he shall not look to the altars, etc. Isa. 17.
4, 5, 6, 7, 8.

In vain have I smitten your children: they receive no correction, Jer. 2. 30.
Amos 4. 10.

Wherefore does a living man complain, etc.? let us search and try our ways:
and turn again unto the Lord, Lam. 3. 39, 40. Isaiah 9. 13. Jeremiah 31. 18, 19.

I will cause you to pass under the rod, etc. and ye shall know that I am the
Lord, Ezekiel 20. 37, 38.

Behold, I will hedge up thy way, etc. Then shall she say, I will go and return
to my first husband, for then was it better with me than now, etc. Hos. 2. 6,
7, 8, chapter 5. 15.

I will bring a third part through the fire, etc. they shall call on my name,
and I will hear them, Amos. 4. 10.

We had the sentence of doath in our selves, that we should not trust in our
selves, but in God who raises the dead: who delivered us, etc. 2 Cor. 1. 8, 9,
10.

Our light affliction, works for us a far more exceeding and eternal weight
of glory: while we look not at the things which are seen, but at the things
which are not seen, etc. 2. Cor. 4. 17, 18.

See Repentance, Chap. 33.

4. For Gods own Glory, and the furtherance of the Gospel.
I will harden Pharaohs heart, that he shall follow after them: and I will be
honored upon Pharaoh and upon all his host, that the Egyptians may know that I
am the Lord, etc. And the Egyptians pursued after them, etc. and the children
of Israel were sore afraid, etc. Exodus 14. 4, 9, 10, 17, 18.

He fed thee with Manna, etc. that he might make thee know, that man does not
live by bread alone; but by every word which proceeds out of the mouth of the
Lord, does man live, Deuteronomy. 8. 3.

Howbeit, because by this deed thou have given great cause to the enemies of
the Lord to blaspheme, the child also that is born unto thee, shall surely die,
2 Samuel 12. 14.

Have thou considered my servant Job? etc. and still he holds fast his
integrity, although thou movest me against him, to destroy him without cause,
Job 2. 3.

Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of wrath shall thou
restrain, Psalm 76. 10.

The Three Children's Sufferings made Persecutors acknowledge, and give Honor
to God, Dan. 3. 27, 28, 29.

So Daniel's Sufferings made Darius the King (who had caused him to be cast
into the Lions Den) to acknowledge and honor God, Dan. 6. 20, 26, 27.

Master, Who did sia? this man, or his parents; that he was born blind? Jesus
answered, Neither has this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the work of
God might be made manifest in him, John 9. 1, 2, 3.

Jesus said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that
the Son of God might be glorified thereby, John 11. 3, 4.

This spoke he, signifying by what death he should glorify God, John 21. 18,
19.

We are troubled on every side, etc. that the life also of Jesus might be made
manifest in our body: for we who live, are always delivered unto death, that
the life of Jesus might be manifest in our mortal flesh, 2 Cor. 4. 8, 9, 10, 11.

When Paul was buffeted, etc. he besought the Lord thrice that it might depart:
and it was said, My grace is sufficient for thee, for my strength is made
perfect in weakness: Most gladly will I therefore rather glory in my
infirmities, that the power of Christ may rest upon me, etc. 2 Cor. 12. 7, 8,
9, 10.

I would have you understand, etc. that the things which have happened to me,
have fallen out to the furtherance of the gospel, etc. and many of the brethren
of the Lord waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word
without fear, Philip. 1. 12, 13, 14.

If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, etc. the spirit, etc. on your part
he is glorified, 1 Pet. 4. 14.

5. For the effecting of great Good and Advantage to those who are exercised
with Trouble, etc.
JOseph's Afflictions and Sufferings, his being sold by his brethren, and
afterward being imprisoned, happened, through God, to his great honor and
advantage: He advanced to be next the King; his Brethren, who sold him, made to
bow to him, and honor him, and are nourished by him; his Father's Sorrow also
recompensed, in that Joseph provided for him in the Famine, Genesis 37. 28, 34,
35. chapter 29. 5, 20. chapter 41, 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44. chapter 45. 5, 7, 8. chapter 47. 11,
12.

But as for you, ye thought evil against me: but God meant it unto good, to
bring to pass as at this day, to save much people alive, Genesis 50. 20, 21.

The more they afflicted them, the more they multiplied and growed, Exodus 1.
11, 12. Ezra. 5. chapter 6.

And Israel saw that great work which the Lord did upon the Egyptians: and the
people feared the Lord, and believed the Lord and his servant Moses, Exodus 14.
31.

Who fed thee with Manna, etc. that he might humble thee, etc. to do thee good
in the latter end, Deuteronomy. 8. 16.

Hezekiah left of God, to try him, that he might know all that was in his
heart, 2 Chronicles. 32. 31.

When Manasseh was afflicted, he sought the Lord, the Lord his God; and humbled
himself greatly before the God of his fathers, and prayed unto him, etc. Then
Manasseh knew that the Lord, he was God, etc. He took away the strange gods,
etc. 2 Chronicles. 3. 3, 11, 12, 13, 15, 16.

Tatnai the Governor opposing the Jews, wrought for their advantage in the end,
Ezra 5. chapter 6.

If they be bound in fetters, etc. then he shows them their work, and their
transgressions that they may have exceeded: He opens also their ear to
discipline, Job 36. 8, 9, 10.

Before I was afflicted, I went astray: but now I have kept thy word, etc. It
is good for me that I have been afflicted, that I might learn thy statutes,
etc. Thou in faithfulness have afflicted me, Psalm. 119. 67, 71, 75.

They who sow in tears, will reap in joy: He who goes forth, and weepeth,
bearing precious seed, shall doubtless, come again with rejoicing, etc. Psalm.
126. 5, 6.

When Christ withdrew from the Spouse, he endeared himself the more to her,
Cant. 5. 6, 10, 11.

When the Lord has performed his whole work upon mount Zion, and on Jerusalem,
I will punish the fruit of the stout heart of the king of Assyria, etc. Such as
are escaped out of the house of Jacob, shall no more again stay upon him who
smote them, but shall stay upon the Lord, etc. Isa. 10. 12, 20, 21.

When thy judgments are in the earth, the Inhabitants of the world will learn
righteousness, Isa. 26. 9.

So will I acknowledge them who are carried away captive of Judah, whom I have
sent out of this place, into the land of the Chaldeans, for their good: for I
will set mine eyes upon them for good Jer. 24. 5, 6.

God's chastening of Ephraim, did him much good in the end, Jer. 31. 18, 19, 20.

They shall bear the punishment of their iniquity, etc. that the house of
Israel may go no more astray from me, neither be polluted any more with all
their transgressions: but that they may be my people, and I etc. Ezekiel. 14. 10,
11.

I will cause you to pass under the rod: and I will bring you into the bond of
the covenant, Ezekiel. 20. 37.

Daniel and the three other, by their afflictions, were more advanced, Dan. 3.
chapter 6.

I will hedge up thy ways with thorns, etc. Then shall she say, I will go and
return to my first husband: for then it was better with me, etc. I will allure
her, and bring her into the wilderness, and speak comfortably ( or, friendly)
unto her, Hos. 2. 5, 6, 7, 8, 14.

I will also leave a poor and an afflicted people; and they shall trust in the
name of the Lord, Zeph. 3. 12.

He who loses his life for my sake, shall find it: For what is a man profited,
if he should gain the whole world, and lose his own soul? Matthew. 10. 39. Mark
8. 34, 35.

And every one who has forsaken houses, or brethren, etc. or lands, for my
name's sake, shall receive an hundredfold, and shall inherit everlasting life,
Matthew. 19. 27, 29.

Tribulation works patience; and patience, experience, etc. Romans 5. 3, ^ 5.

And we know that all things work together for good unto them who love God,
Romans 8. 28. Psalm. 25. 10.

Excommunication designed for good, that the spirit may be saved in the day of
our Lord Jesus, 1 Cor. 5. 5.

When we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, that we should not be
condemned with the world, 1 Cor. 11. 32.

Though our outward man decay, yet our inward man is renewed day by day: for
our light afflictions, which are but for a moment, works for as a far more
exceeding eternal weight of glory; while we look not at things which are seen,
2 Cor. 4. 16, 17, 18. Heb. 10. 34, 35, 36.

In nothing terrified by your adversaries; which as to them an evident token of
perdition; but to you of salvation, and that of God, Philip. 1. 28.

Tribulations, which ye endure, etc. that ye may be accounted worthy of the
kingdom of God, 2, These. 1. 5.

It is a faithful saying, etc. If we suffer, we shall also reign, 2 Timothy 2. 11,
12, Romans 8. 17, 18. 1 Pet. 4. 13.

We have fathers of our flesh, who correct us; and we give them reverence:
Shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits, and live?
for they, etc. chastened us after their own pleasure; but he, for our profit,
etc. No chastening for the present seems to be joyous, etc. nevertheless
afterward it yields the peaceable fruits of righteousness unto them who are
exercised thereby, Heb. 12. 9, 10, 11.

Ye are in heaviness, etc. that the trial of your says, etc. might be found
unto praise, and honor, and glory, at the appearing of Jesus Christ, 1 Pet. 1.
6, 7.

See Second Consideration following.

III. The Considerations which should stay, bear up, and comfort the Spirits of
Satuts in their Afflictions, and under Persecutions.
Cons. 1. That it is their Portion, which God appointed them in this Life as a
Privilege; and that too for such Ends. See them last before.
Cons. 2. That such who are so exercised, are blessed and happy, and so
pronounced in Scripture; a Seal of their Sonship, and God's choice Love to
them, and of their Salvation.

Blessed are they who mourn, for they, etc. Blessed are they who are persecuted

If ye bear chastisements, God exhibits himself to you as to sons: for what son

As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten, Rev. 3. 19.

Cons. 3. That God well knows the Design and Ways of Satan, and all the
Adversaries of Believers: And that they can do no more, or proceed farther
against the Saints, than what God permits. He turns about their Purposes.
YOur father deceived me, etc. but God suffered him not to hurt me. If he said
thus, etc. Laban pursued Jacob, etc. And God came unto Laban the Syrian in a
dream in the night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to Jacob
from good to bad, ( or, either good or bad,) etc. It is in the power of my hand
to do you hurt: but the God of your father spoke unto me yester-night, saying,
Take thou heed that thou speak not to Jacob, Genesis 31. 7, 8. 23, 24, 29, 42.

When Esau was coming against Jacob with four hundred Men, and Jacob was
afraid, yet God changed Es^u's Heart; so that when he met Jacob, he embraced

seen the face of God, and thou wast pleased with me, Genesis 32. 6, 7, 8. chapter 33.
3, 4, 10.

And the terror of God was upon the cities that were round about them, and

All which God prevented, and purposed better things, Genesis 37. 18, 19, 20, etc.
chap. 39. chapter 50. 19, 20.

The enemy said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divide the spoil; my

special notice of their Afflictions and Troubles, and is said to be persecuted
and afflicted in their Persecutions and Afflictions.

Cons. 8. That the greater the Afflictions and Distresses of the Saints have
been, the more wonderful have their Deliverances been: and then has Salvation
been nearest, when Extremity was highest, and Danger nearest.
WHen Lot was taken prisoner and carried away, and all his goods, God by
Abraha^^ wonderfully recovered all, and brought him back again, Genesis 14. 11,
12, 13, 14, 15, 16.

Joseph's strange deliverance out of the prison and pit there, Genesis 41.

^agar is in such distress for her child, for want of water, that she lays it
down and leaves it, that she might not see it die, and sits far off weeping;
then Gods speaks to her by the Angel: and God opened her eyes, and she saw a
well of water, etc. Genesis 21. 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19, 20.

Jacobs salvation from Esau, etc. and his seeing Joseph when he reckoned
Benjamin lost, Genesis 32. chapter 33. chapter 43. 14. chapter 45. 27, 28.

When the Egyptians oppressed most, and made Isreal's burdens heaviest, insomuch
that they despaired, then God came and made known himself, and said to Moses,
Now shall thou see what I will do to Pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he
let them go, etc. I have also heard the groanings of the children of Israel,
etc. I will bring ye out from under the burden of the Egyptians, and I will rid
you out of their bondage; and I will redeem you with a stretched out arm, and
with great judgment, etc. Exodus 5. chapter 6, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

And God did so deliver them, after he had showed many wonders upon the
Egyptians, and smote their firstborn, Exodus 12. 29, 30, 31, 32, etc.

And the Lord went before them by day, in a pillar of a cloud, to lead them the
way, and in a pillar of fire by night, to give them light, etc. Exodus 13. 21.

When Pharaoh and his host pursued Israel, so that they reckoned themselves
lost, and were in great distress, then the Angel of God which went before the
camp, removed and went behind them, etc. between the camp of the Egyptians and
them: and the Lord divided the sea, while Israel passed through, and there
drowned all the Egyptians, Exodus 14. 10, 11, 12, 16, 17, 18, etc.

When Israel wanted bread in the wilderness, God rained Manna and flesh, Exodus
16.

The Lord shall judge his people, and repent himself for his servants, when he
sees that their power is gone, and there is none shut up or left, Deuteronomy. 32.
36. he often did so with Israel. Judges throughout, and 2 Kings 14. 26.

David was in frequent danger from Saul, yet God did wonderfully deliver him, 1 Samuel 23. 26, 27, 28. chapter 24. chapter 26.

When David was great in distress, because Ziklag was burned, his wives, and
the wives of his followers taken away, and all their substance, by the
Amalekites, and his men spoke of killing him; then God directs him to pursue
the Amalekites, and he recovered all again by a wonderful hand, 1 Samuel 30. 1,
2, 3, to the 20. again, 1 Samuel 23. 27.

When king David was in great danger at hand, by the counsel of Ahitophel in
the time of Absoloms rebellion, God overthrew his counsel, by the counsel of
Hushai, and so marvellously preserved David, 2 Samuel 17. 1, 2, 3, etc.

When Elijah f^ed from Ahab in a time of famine, God commanded the Ravens to
feed him, etc. and the Ravens brought him bread and flesh in the morn, etc.
when the brook dried up, God sent him to a widow to nou^^sh him; when her meal
was out, God caused the barrel of meal not to wa^te, the cruse of oil not to
fail until the Lord sent rain, 1 King. 17. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, to the 17. Genesis
45. 6, 7.

So again, when he fled from Jezebel, an had requested of God that he might
die, the angel comes to him, and gives him bread and water twice, and then
enabled him to go in the strength thereof many days, 1 Kings 19. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,
6, 7, 8.

When the wife of one of the sons of the Prophets was in distress, because of
poverty, and danger of creditors, God by Elisha makes her pot of oil to
increase, to the filling of many vessels, to pay her debts with, 2 Kings 4. 1,
2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

When the Assyrians came to Dothan to take Elisha, God marvelously delivered
him from their hands. When Samaria was besieged, and in great distress by
reason of the sad famine in it, God on a sudden makes the Assyrians fly and
leave plenty behind them in their camp, and so relieved his people, 2 Kings 6.
chapter 7.

When Jerusalem was in sore distress, God sent an Angel to the Assyrians, 2
Kings 19. 25.

When Judah was environed, the battle before and behind them then God delivered
them, and overcame their enemies, slew five hundred thousand of them, 2 Chronicles.
13. 14, 15, 16, 17, 18.

God delivered the afflicted Jews by Nehemiah, in a wonderful manner, Nehem. 1.
2, 3, chapter 2.

When the Jews were by Hamans procurement appointed to slaughter, and the
decree just ready to be executed, and they greatly distressed and helpless:
Then God appeared, and delivered in a mavelous manner, Esther 1. 19, 20.
chap. 3. chap. 6. chap. 7.

Thou have enlarged me when I was in distress, Psalm. 4. 1.

When the Apostles were put into the prison, the Angel of the Lord brought them

In nothing terrified, etc. which is to them an evident token of, etc. but to
