his righteousness, etc. Who is a God like unto thee, who pardons iniquity?
etc. he retains not his anger for ever: because he delights in mercy, he
will turn again, he will have compassion upon us, Micah 7. 8, 9, 18, 19.

Blessed are they who mourn, for they shall be comforted, Mat. 5. 4.

Verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye shall were and lament, etc. but your
sorrow shall be turned into joy, etc. ye now therefore have sorrow, but I will
see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, John 16. 20, 22.

And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly, Romans 16. 20.

God is faithful, etc. but will with the temptation also make a way to escape,
1 Cor. 10. 13.

God, who delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver, 2 Cor. 1. 10.

It is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them who trouble
you: and to you who are troubled, rest with us, when the Lord Jesus, etc. 2
These. 1. 6, 7.

What persecutions I endured, but out of them all the Lord delivered me, 2 Timothy
3. 11.

The Lord stood with me, etc. and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion,
2 Timothy 4. 17, 18. Heb. 13. 5, 6.

The Lord knows how to deliver the godly (...) of temptations, 2 Pet. 2. 9.

Cons. 11. That Afflictions and Petsecutions have been the lot of Christ
himself, and of the Saints in all Ages.
THE disciple is not above his Lord, nor the servant above his master: it is
enough for the d^^ciple that he be as his Master, etc. If they have called the
master of the house Beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of his
household? Fear them not therefore, Mat. 10. 24, 25, 26.

If the world hate you, you know that it hated me before it hated you, etc.
remember the word that I said unto you, The servant is not greater than the
Lord: if they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you, John 15. 18, 20.

We are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men, etc. even
unto this present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are naked, and are
buffetted, and have no certain dewlling place, etc. being reviled, etc.
persecuted, etc. we are made as the filth of the world, and the offscouring of
all things unto this day, 1 Cor. 4. 9, 11, 12, 13.

There has no temptation taken you, but what is common to man, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

For we who live, are always delivered to death for Jesus sake, 2 Cor. 4. 11.

But as then, he who was born after the flesh, persecuted him who was after the
spirit: even so it is now, Gal. 4. 29.

Wherefore seeing we also are compassed about with so great a cloud of
witnesses, etc. let us run with patience the race which is set before us,
looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of faith, who for the joy which was
set before him, endured the cross, etc. for consider him who endured such
contradiction of sinners against himself, lest you be wearied and faint in your
minds, Heb. 12. 1, 2, 3.

Take, my B^^thren, the Prophets who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for
an example of suffering affliction and of patience, Jam. 5. 10.

Hereunto also are ye called: because Christ also suffered for us, leaving us
an example that ye should also follow his steps, 1 Pet. 2. 21.

Your adversary the Devil as a roaring lion, etc. whom resist steadfast in the
says; knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished in your brethren who
are in the world, 1 Pet. 5. 8, 9.

How long, O Lord, etc. do thou not judge and avenge our blood on them who
dwell on the earth! and it was said unto them, That they should rest yet for a
little season, until their fellow servants also, and their brethren which
should be killed as they were, should be fulfilled, Rev. 6. 10, 11.

IV. What are the Duties of the Saints, and how they ought to behave themselves
under their Afflictions and Sufferings, both toward God and Men.
First, Toward God.
1. To eye God in them, Afflictions being sent of him.
JOseph said to his Brethren, it was not you who sent me hither, but God, Genesis
45. 5. 8. chapter 50. 19, 20.

I will harden Pharaoh's heart, that he shall follow after them, etc. Exodus 14.
1. chapter 4. 21.

When Israel wanted water in the desert, they did not eye God in it, but chide
with Moses, Numb. 20. 2, 3.

But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the Lord thy God
hardened his spirit, and made his heart obstinate, Deuteronomy. 2. 30.

Are not these evils come upon us because our God is not amongst us? Deuteronomy. 31.
17.

See now that I, even I, am he, etc. I kil^, and I make alive: I wound, and I
heal: neither is there any who can deliver you out of my hand, Deuteronomy. 32. 39.

The Almighty has dealt very bitterly with me, etc. God has brought me home
again empty, Ruth 1. 20, 21.

When Samuel had told Eli what the Lord would do against his house, he said, It
is the Lord, 1 Samuel 3. 18.

Shimei cursed David, etc. David said, So let him curse, because the Lord has
said unto him, Curse David; who then shall say wherefore? 2 Samuel 16. 6, 7, 8,
9, 10.

Satan said, Put forth thine hand, etc. Job said. The Lord gave, and the Lord
has taken, Job ^ 11, 21. chap. 2. 5.

Afflictions comes not forth of the dust, neither does trouble come out of the
ground, etc. the chastening of the Lord: for he makes fore, and binds up: he
wounds, etc. Job 5. 6. 17, 18. chapter 9. 12.

I will say unto God, etc. wherefore contendest thou with me? Job 10, 2. chapter
30. 11.

God has overthrown me, etc. he hath^ fen^^^ up my way, that I cannot pass,
etc. Job 19. 6, 7. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12. chap. 13. 26, 27. Lam. 1. 12, 13, etc.
chap. 2. 5, 6.

When he gives quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hides his
face, who then can behold him? Job 34. 22.

I opened not my mouth because thou did it, etc. when thou with rebukes do
correct man for iniquity, thou make his beauty to consume away etc. Psalm. 39.
9, 11.

Thou have cast us off and put us to shame, etc. thou have given us like sheep
for meat, Psalm. 44. 9, 10, etc.

Thou who have showed me great and sore troubles, shall quicken me, Psalm. 71.
20.

Thou turnest man to destruction, Psalm. 90. 3.

Their Enemies, he turned their heart to hate his people, and to deal subtly
with his servants, Psalm. 105. 25.

Despise not the chastening of the Lord, etc. Prove. 3. 11, 12. Heb. 12. 5, 6.

O Assyrian, the rod of thine anger, etc. I will send him against an
hypocritical Nation, etc. Isa. 10. 5, 6.

I make peace, I create evil: I the Lord do all these things, Isa. 45. 7.

I was wroth with my people: I have, etc. given them into thine hand, Isa. 47.
6.

Thou have cast me into the deep etc. thy billows and (...) waves have passed
over me, Jonah 2. 3.

The Lord's voice cries unto the city, etc. Hear ye the rod, and who has
appointed it, Micah 6. 9.

In vain have I smitten your children, they have received no correction, Jer.
2. 30.

When we are judged, we are chastened of the Lord, 1 Cor. 11. 32.

Moses endured, as seeing him who is invisible, Heb. 11. 27.

Whom the Lord loves, he chasten^th, and scourges every son whom he receives,
Heb. 12. 6. 7.

See more of Common Calamities, Chap. 23.

2. To submit to God with an humble, quiet, and silent Spirit, under Troubles.
WHen Benjamin must to Egypt, or Jacob could have no food, he says, If I am
bereaved, I am, etc. Genesis 43. 14.

When God had slain Nadab and Abihu Aaron's son, and Moses had told Aaron, that
God would be sanctified in all those who came near him, etc. Aaron held his
peace, Levit. 10. 1, 2, 3.

If their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then except of the
punishment of their iniquity: then will I remember my covenant, Levit. 26. 41,
42.

Ye shall eat until it come out at your nostrils, and it be loathsome unto you:
because that ye have despised the Lord who is among you, and have wept before
him, saying, Why came we forth out of Egypt? Numb. 11. 19, 20. Exodus 14. 10,
11, 12.

Do thou unto us whatsoever seems good unto thee: deliver us only, we pray
thee, this day, Judges 10. 15.

When Samuel had told Eli all which God had threatened against Eli's house; Eli
said, It is the Lord, let him do what seems him good, 1 Samuel 3. 14, 15, 16,
1^, 1^.

David said, Carry back the Ark of God into the city: it I shall find favor in
the eyes of the Lord, he will bring me again, etc. But if he thus say, I have
no delight in thee: behold, here am I, let him do to me as seems good to him,
2 Samuel 15. 25, 26.

Behold, the day comes, that all which is in thine house, and that which thy
fathers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried unto Babylon:
nothing shall be left, says the Lord, etc. Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah,
Good is the word or the Lord, which thou have spoken, etc. 2 Kings 20. 16, 17,
18, 19.

When Job had received all the sad messages of his Ladies, he worshipped, and
said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither:
the Lord gave, and the Lord has taken away, blessed be the name of the Lord.
In all this Job sinned not, Job 1. 19, 20, 21.

Then said his wife to him, etc. Curse God, and die. But he said unto her, etc.
What? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not (...) evil? in
all this did not Job sin, Job 2. 9, 10.

He is wise in heart, etc. Who has hardened himself against him and prospered?
Who? etc. How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason
with him; whom, tho I were righteous, would I not answer? etc. Job 9. 3, 4, 13,
14, 15, 32.

Shall any teach God knowledge, seeing he judges those who are high? one dies
in his full strength ( or, in the strength of his perfection), etc. and another
dies in the bitterness of his soul, and never eats with pleasure, Job. 21.
22, 23, 24, 25.

God is greater than man: why do thou strive against him? for he gives not
account of any of his matters: for God speaks once, yea twice, man perceives
it not, etc. Job 33. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15.

For he will not lay upon man more than is right, that he should enter into
judgment with God, etc. Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have born
chastisement, I will not offend: that which I see not, teach thou me. If I have
done iniquity, I will do not more, Job 34. 23, 31, 32.

The Lord answered Job, and said, shall he who contendeth with the Almighty,
instruct him? he who reproves God, let him answer it. Then Job answered, and
said, Behold, I am vile, what shall I answer thee? I will lay my hand upon my
mouth; once have I spoken, but I will not answer, etc. Job 40. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
chap. 42. 3, 4, 5, 6.

I was dumb, I opened not my mouth, because thou did it, Psalm. 39. 9.

My son, despise not the chastenings of the Lord, neither be weary of his
correction: for whom the Lord loves, he corrects, Prove. 3. 11, 12. Heb. 12.
5, 6.

Who would set the briers, etc. against me, etc. I would burn them together,
Isa. 27. 4.

Woe unto him who striveth with his maker: let the potsherd strive with the
potsherds of the earth: shall the clay say to him who fashioneth it, what? etc.
Isa. 45. 9.

In vain have I smitten your children, they received no correction, Jer. 2. 30.

Cannot I do with you as this potter, says the Lord? Behold, as the clay is in
the potter's hand, so are ye in my hand, O house of Israel, Jer. 18. 4, 5, 6.

Thou have chastened me, etc. after that I was instructed, I smote upon my
thigh, I was ashamed, etc. Jer. 31. 18, 19.

God tells his people in Babylon, that if they would abide there, he would
build them, and not pull them down; but if they submitted not to their
condition, but said, They would go down to Egypt where they might see no war,
etc. Then judgments should follow them thither, and there they should die, Jer.
42. 10, to v. 17.

It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth; he sits alone, and
keeps silence, because he puts his mouth in the dust: if so be, there may
be hope, etc. Wherefore does the living man complain, etc. for the punishment
of sins? Lam. 3. 27, 28, 29, 39.

I will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him,
Micah 7. 9.

In your patience possess ye your souls, Luke 21. 19.

None of these things move me, neither is my life dear unto me, so that, etc.
Acts 20. 24.

Tribulation works patience, and patience experience, etc. Romans 5. 4, 5.

Patience in tribulations, Romans 12. 12.

Neither murmur ye as some of them murmured, and were destroyed, 1 Cor. 10. 10,
11.

Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in
persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I
strong, 2 Cor. 12. 10. 2 Timothy 2. 3.

I have learned, in whatsoever state I am, therewith to be content, Phil. 4.
11, 12.

Endure hardship as a good soldier of Christ, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 3.

We our selves glory in you, etc. for your faith and patience in all your
persecutions, 2 These. 1. 4.

Consider him who endured such, etc. lest ye be weary and faint in your minds,
etc. Fathers of our flesh, who correct us, etc. Shall we not much rather be in
subjection to the father of spirits, and live? for they, etc. chasten us after
their pleasure; but he for our profit, Hebr. 12. 3. 9, 10. James 1. 12.

Submit your selves therefore to God: resist the Devil, James 4. 7.

The husbandman waits, etc. Be ye also patient, stablish your hearts: for the
coming of the Lord, etc. James 5. 7, 8, 11.

If ye do well, and suffer for it, and take it patiently, this is acceptable to
God, 1 Pet. 2. 20.

Think it not strange concerning the fiery trial, etc. as though some strange
thing happened, etc. 1 Pet. 4. 12.

Humble your selves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt
you in due time, 1 Pet. 5. 6.

I know thy work, etc. and thy patience, etc. Rev. 2. 2, 3, 19.

3. To confess their Sins, and justify God.
PHaraoh, etc. said, I have sinned, etc. the Lord is righteous, and I and my
people are wicked, Exodus 9. 27.

If they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, with
their trespasses, etc. then will I remember my covenant, etc. Levit. 26, 40,
41, 42.

The princes, etc. and the king, humbled themselves, and they said, The Lord is
righteous, 2 Chronicles. 12. 6. 1 Kings 21. 27, 28, 29.

Thou art just in all that is brought upon us, for thou have done right, but we
have done wickedly, etc. Ezra 9. 10, 11, 12, 13. Neh. 9. 33, 34, etc. Judge. 10.
13, 14, 15. Dan. 9. 14.

I have sinned, what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? Job 7. 20.

How should man be just with God? if he will content with him, he cannot answer
him one of a thousand, etc. If I justify my self, mine own mouth shall condemn
me, Job 9. 2, 3, 20. chapter 4. 17. Psalm. 143. 2.

He looked unto men: and if any say, I have sinned, etc. he will deliver his
soul from going into the pit, etc. Job 33. 27, 28.

He will not lay upon man more than is right, etc. Job 34. 23.

Behold, I am vile, what shall I answer thee? etc. Job 40. 3, 4.

I uttered that I understood not: things to^ wonderful for me, which I knew
not, etc. I abhor my self, and repent in dust and ashes, Job 42. 3, 5, 6.

Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, etc. that thou may be justified,
etc. Psalm. 51. 4.

He has not dealt with us after our sins: nor rewarded us according to our
iniquities, Ps. 103. 10. Ezra 9. 13.

The church in her affliction confesses her sin, Isa. 59. 11, to v. 16.

Thou art wroth, for we have sinned, etc. Isa. 64. 5, 6, 7.

Thou say, Because I am innocent, surely his anger shall turn from me:
behold, I will plead with thee, because thou say, I have not sinned, Jer. 2.
35.

Only acknowledge thine iniquity, etc. Jer. 3. 12, 13, 25.

Daniel confesses to God at large in the time of the captivity, Dan. 9. 5, to
v. 16.

Jerusalem has grievously sinned, therefore she is removed, etc. Zion
spreads forth her hands, etc. The Lord is righteous, for I have rebelled,
Lam. 1. 8, 9, 18, 20.

It is the Lord's mercy we are not consumed, etc. wherefore does the living man
complain? etc. Let us search, and try our ways, and turn again, etc. Lam. 3.
22, 39, 40, 42.

The crown is fallen from our head: woe to us that we have sinned, Lam. 5. 16.

I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledge their offense, and
seek my face: i^ in their afflictions they will seek me early, Hos. 5. 15.

I will bear the indignation of the Lord, because I have sinned against him,
Micah 7. 9.

Do thou not fear God, seeing thou art in the same condemnation? and we
indeed justly, for we receive the due reward of our deeds, etc. Luke 23 40, 41.

See more of Confession at large, Chap. 16.

See more of Confession of Sins in time of Common Calamities, Chap. 23.

One to another, Chap. 17.

See Prayer, Chap. 16.

4. To hold fast to God, own the Lord Jesus, his People and Ways, in the midst
of Trouble, Afflictious and Persecutions.
SHall such an one as I flee? etc. and go into the temple to save his life?
Nehem. 6. 11.

Job's Wife said unto him in his great Affliction, Do thou still retain thy
integrity? Curse God, and die. But he said unto her, Thou speak as one of
the foolish women speaks: What? etc. In all this did not Job sin with his
lips, Job 2. 9, 10.

All this is come upon us, yet have we not forgotten thee, neither have we
dealt falsely in thy covenant. Our heart is not turned back: neither have our
steps declined from thy way. Though thou have sore broken us in the place of
dragous, and covered us with the shadow of death: if we have forgotten the name
of our God, etc. Psalm. 44. 17, 18, 19, 20.

The proud have had me greatly in derision: yet have I not declined from thy
law, etc. Many are my persecutors, and mine enemies: yet do I not decline from
thy testimonies, etc. Princes have persecuted me without a cause: yet does my
heart stand in awe of thy word, Psalm. 119. 51, 87, 157, 161.

The Lord spoke unto me, etc. and instructed me, that I should not walk in the
way of this people; saying, Say ye not, A confederacy, to all them to whom this
people shall say, A confederacy: neither fear ye their fear, nor be afraid:
Sanfie the Lord of hosts himself; and let him be your fear, and your dread; and
he shall be for a sanctuary, Isa. 8. 11, 12, 13, 14.

When Jeremiah had prophesied to Judah, then spoke the priest and the prophets
unto the princes, and to all the people, saying, This man is worthy to die; for
he has prophesied against this city, etc. Then spoke Jeremiah unto all the
princes, and to all the people, saying, The Lord sent me to prophecy against
this house, etc. therefore now amend your ways, etc. But as for me, behold, I
am in your hand; do with me as seems good, etc. Jer. 26. 11, to 15.

Daniel, (when a Captive in Babylon,) he purposed in his heart, that he would
not defile himself with the Portion of the King's Meat, nor with the Wine which
he drank: and therefore he requested, (...) that he might not defile himself,
etc. denied Pulse to eat, and Water to drink, Dan. 1. 8, to 13.

When a strict Law had been made by the King, that every one should fall down
and worship the (...) image he had set up, under pain of being cast into the
Fiery Furnace, Shadrach, Meshach and (...) refuse to do it; and in the presence
of the King, said, We are not careful to answer thee in this matter, etc. Our
God, whom we serve, is able to deliver us, etc. and he will, etc. But if not,
Be it known unto thee, O king, that we will not serve thy gods, nor worship the
golden image which thou have set up, Dan. 3. 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18.

When a Decree was passed, That whosoever should ask a Petition of any God or
Man for thirty days, save of the King, he should be cast into the Lions Den:
And Daniel knew that the Writing was signed; He went into his house; and his
windows being open in his chamber toward Jerusalem, he kneeled upon his knees
three times a day and prayed, and gave thanks, as he did aforetime, Dan. 6. 7,
8, 9, 10.

Ye shall be hated of all men for my name sake: but he who endures unto the
end, shall be saved, etc. He who loves father or mother more than me, is not
worthy of me, etc. And he who takes not his cross, and follows after me, is
not worthy of me, etc. He who loses his life for my sake, shall find it,
Matthew. 10. 22, 37, 38, 39. chapter 16. 24, 25, 26.

He hears the word, and anon with joy receives it; yet has he not root in
himself, but dureth for a while; for when tribulation or persecution arises
because of the word, by and by he is offended, Matthew. 13. 20, 21.

When Christ was taken, his Disciples fled. Peter denied him: but afterward
wept bitterly for his so doing, Matthew. 26. 56, 70, 72, 74, 75.

Whosoever therefore shall be ashamed of me, and of my words, in this
adulterous and sinful generation; of him also shall the Son of man be ashamed,
when he comes in the glory of his Father, etc. Mark 8. 36. John 9. 21, 22.

These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be offended, John 16.
1. Gal. 5. 11. chapter 6. 32.

When the Apostles had been commanded not to speak at all, etc. in the name of
Jesus, they say, Whether it be right in the sight of God, to hearken unto you
more than unto God, judge ye: For we cannot but speak the things which we have
seen and heard, Acts 4. 19, 20.

Again: When they were charged with Preaching, contrary to their Command, the
Apostle said, We ought to obey God, rather than men. And they preached Christ
before the Council, who caused them to be beaten; and gave them a new Charge,
not to preach: yet they daily, in the Temple, and in every House, ceased not to
teach and preach Jesus Christ, Acts 5. 27, 28, 29, 30, 40, 41, 42.

None of these things move me, etc. so that I may finish my course with joy,
and the ministry, etc. Acts 20. 23, 24.

I am ready, not only to be bound, but also to die, etc. for the name of the
Lord Jesus, Acts 21. 13.

Paul, before Foelix, said, after the way they call heresy, so worship I the
God of my fathers, Acts 24. 14.

If I preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer? etc. Then is the offense of the
cross ceased, Gal. 5. 11. chapter 6. 12.

Many of the brethren of the Lord waxing confident by my bonds, are much more
bold to speak the word without fear, etc. That ye stand fast, etc. striving
together for the faith of the gospel; and in nothing terrified by your
adversaries, Philip. 1. 14, 27, 28.

Be thou not therefore ashamed of the testimony of the Lord, nor of me his
prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the gospel, etc. I suffer
these things; nevertheless, I am not ashamed, 2 Timothy 1. 8, 12. Heb. 13. 13.

If we suffer, etc. If we deny him, he also will deny us, 2 Timothy 2. 12.

-- Nor faint when thou art rebuked of him, Heb. 12. 5.

If any man suffer as a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but glorify God, 1
Pet. 4. 16.

Earnestly contend for the faith once delivered to the saints, Jude, verse. 3.

Thou shall suffer, etc. Be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a
crown of life, Rev. 2. 10. chapter 12. 11.

See more of Perseverance, Chap. 16.

5. To be cheerful under Affliction; and rejoice to to be counted worthy to
suffer for Christ.
BE of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart; all ye who hope in the
Lord, Psalm. 31. 24.

Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vine,
etc. yet I will rejoice in the Lord, I will joy in the God of my salvation,
Heb. 3. 17, 18.

When they shall revile you, and persecute you, and shall say all manner of
evil against you falsely for my sake, rejoice, and be exceeding glad, Mat. 5.
11, 12.

He who takes not up his cross, and follows me, is not worthy of me, Matthew.
10. 38. chapter 16. 24, 25.

In the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer, I have overcome
the world, John 16. 33.

When the Apostles had been put into the common Prison, brought before the
Council, and been beaten there, they departed from the presence of the Council
rejoicing that they were counted worthy to suffer shame for his name, Acts 5.
18, 27, 40, 41.

Paul and Silas being thrust into the inner Prison, and their Feet made fast in
the Stocks, sang Praises unto God, and the Prisoners heard, Acts 16. 24, 25.

Bonds and afflictions abide in me; but none of these things move me, Acts 20.
23, 24.

What mean ye to weep, etc. I am ready, not to be bound only, but also to die,
Acts 21. 13.

And not only so, but we glory in tribulation also, Romans 5. 3.

As sorrowful, yet always rejoicing, 2 Cor. 6. 10.

Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in
persecutions, in distresses, for Christ's sake, 2 Cor. 12. 9, 10.

I Paul am made a minister, who now rejoice in my sufferings for you, Col. 1.
23, 24.

That no man should be moved by these afflictions: for your selves know that we
are appointed, etc. 2 These. 3. 3.

Thou therefore endure hardship, as a good soldier of Christ, 2 Timothy 2. 3. Heb.
12. 5.

For (...) etc. took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in your
selves, etc. Heb. 10. 34.

Moses choosing rather to suffer, etc. esteeming the reproach of Christ greater
riches than the treasures of Egypt, Heb. 11. 25, 26.

Wherefore lift up the hands which hang down, and the feeble knees, Heb. 12. 12.

My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into diverse temptations; knowing
this, that the trying of your faith, works patience, etc. Blessed is the man
who endures temptation; for when he is tried, he shall receive the crown,
James 1. 1, 2, 12.

If ye suffer for righteousness sake, etc. be not afraid of their terror,
neither be troubled, 1 Pet. 3. 14.

Beloved, think it not strange concerning the fiery trial, which is to try you,
etc. but rejoice, in as much as ye are partakers of Christ's sufferings: that
when his glory shall be revealed, ye may be glad also. If any suffer as a
Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God in this behalf: for
the time is come, when judgment, etc. 1 Pet. 4. 12, 13, 16.

Let us go forth therefore unto him, without the camp, bearing his reproach,
Heb. 13. 13.

6. To cry to the Lord for Help, Support and Salvation.
JAcob in his distress, when Esau pursued him, prayed earnestly, etc. Genesis 32.
8, 9, etc. 24, 25, etc.

Jacob in his great distress, when Joseph had kept Simeo^, and required
Benjamin also, said, God Almighty give you mercy before the man, that he may
send away your other brother, and Benjamin: If I be bereaved, etc. Genesis 43. 14.

The children of Israel lifted up their eyes, and behold, the Egyptians marched
after them, and they were sore afraid: And the children of Israel cried out
unto the Lord, Exodus 14. 10.

When all the waters were bitter, that the people could not drink, Moses cried
unto the Lord, Exodus 15. 23, 24, 25.

Moses cried unto the Lord, saying, What shall I do unto this people? they be
almost ready to stone me, etc. So when Amalek fought with Israel, Moses held up
his hand, and then Israel prevailed, etc. Exodus 17. 1, 2, 3, 4, 11, 12.

If thou afflict them, etc. and they cry at all to me, I will surely hear their
cry, Exodus 22. 23.

The Lord shall scatter you among the nations, etc. But if from thence thou
shall seek the Lord thy God, thou shall find him; If thou seek him with all
thine heart, and with all thy soul, Deuteronomy. 4. 27, 29.

When Israel were delivered into the hand of their enemies, they cried unto the
Lord; and the Lord (...) up a Deliverer, Judges 3. 8, 9. chapter 10. 13, 14. 2 Chronicles. 15. 3, 4. 1 Samuel 6. 16.

Hannah was in bitterness of Soul, and prayed unto the Lord, and wept fore, 1 Samuel 1. 10, 11, 12, 13.

Samuel prayed for Israel, when the Philistines came against them, 1 Samuel 9. 9.

David, in his distress, prayed the Lord to turn the Counsel of Acicitophel
into foolishness, 2 Samuel ^5. 31. chapter 12. 22.

In my distress I called upon the Lord, and cried to my God; and he did hear my
voice out of his temple, 2 Samuel 22. 7. Psalm. 18. 6.

When Jerusalem was in distress, by reason of the Assyrians, and Rabshakeh's
railing and threatening, Hezekiah spread the Letter before the Lord, and prayed
before the Lord, and said, O Lord God. etc. 2 Kings 19. 14, 15, 16, etc. Isa.
37. 14, 15, etc.

Hezekiah was sick unto death, etc. he turned his face to the wall, and prayed
unto the Lord, saying, I beseech thee, O Lord, etc. He wept, 2 Kings 20. 1, 2,
3. Isa. 38. 1, 2, 3.

When there came an Host of one thousand thousand against Judah, Asa cried unto
the Lord his God, and said, Lord, it is nothing unto thee, to help, etc. 2 Chronicles. 14. 9, 10, 11, 12.

There came a great Multitude against Jehoshaphat, etc. He feared, and set
himself to seek the Lord, and proclaimed a Fast, etc. And Jehoshaphat stood in
the congregation, and said, O Lord God of our fathers, Art not thou God? etc. 2 Chronicles. 20. 2, 3, 4, etc.

When Manasseh was in affliction, he besought the Lord his God, etc. and prayed
unto him; and he was entreated of him, 2 Chronicles. 33. 11, 12, 13. Job 36. 8, 9.

I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction, Job 10. 15. Psalm.
9. 13.

He hears the cry of the afflicted, Job 34. 28. Psalm 102. 17.

The hypocrite in heart, they cry not when he binds them, Job 36. 13.

O Lord save me from all them who persecute me; and deliver me, Psalm. 7. 1.

Our fathers, etc. they cried to thee, and were delivered, etc. He has not
despised nor abhorred the afflictions of the afflicted; neither has he hid his
face from him: but when he cried unto him, he heard, Psalm. 22. 4, 5, 24. Psalm.
107. 6, 13.

I sought the Lord, and he heard me, and delivered me from all my fears. This
poor man cried, and the Lord heard, and saved him out of all his troubles,
Psalm. 34, 4, 6, 17. Psalm. 35.

The Psalmist prays for Help and Salvation in such a time, Psalm. 38. 20, 21,
22. Psalm. 39. 10, 13. Psalm. 69. 14, 15. Psalm. 88. Psalm. 143. 7, 8, 9.

For thy sake are we killed all the day long, etc. Awake: Why sleep thou, O
Lord? Arise, etc. Wherefore hidest thou thy face, forgettest our affliction?
etc. Psalm. 44. 22, 23, 24, 25, 26. Psalm. 74. 9, 10, 11.

Call upon me in the day of trouble, and I will deliver thee, and thou shall
glorify me, Psalm. 50. 15.

David prays earnestly in his low Condition, for Joy and Comfort, Psalm. 51. 7,
8, 9, 10, etc.

In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the night, Psalm.
77. 2.

In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee; for thou will answer me, Psalm.
86. 7.

I called upon the Lord in distress: the Lord answered me, and set me in a
large place, Psalm. 118. 5. Psalm. 130. 1.

The heart of the king is in the hand of the Lord: he inclines it which way he
will, Prove. 21. 1.

The Church, in her low Condition, prays earnestly; Look down, etc. Isa. 63.
15, to 19. Psalm. 74. 9, 10, 11, Isa. 64. 8, 9.

Lord, correct me in judgment: not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to
nothing, Jer. 10. 24.

I called upon thy name, O Lord, out of the low dungeon, etc. Lam. 3. 55, 59,
etc.

Daniel and his Friends, in his great Strait and Danger about the King's Dream,
prays to God, Dan. 2. 13, 14, 18.

I will go and return unto my place, till they acknowledge their offense, and
seek my face: In their affliction they will seek me early, Hos. 5. 15.

Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord, shall be delivered, Joel 2. 32.

When the Mariners were in the Tempest, they called upon their Gods; and roused
up Jonah, to call upon his God: If so be, God will think upon us, that we
perish not, Jonah 1. 4, 5, 6.

Jonah prayed unto the Lord his God, out of the fisnes belly, and said, I cry,
etc. Jonah 2. 1, 2, etc.

The Ninevites prayed, etc. Who can tell if God will turn? etc. Jonah 3. 8, 9.
2 Samuel 12. 22.

When Peter saw the Wind boisterous, he was afraid: and beginning to sink, he
cried, saying Lord, save me. And immediately Jesus, etc. caught him, Matthew. 14.
30, 31.

Shall not God avenge his Elect, who cry to him day and night? Yea, he will
avenge them, Luke 18. 7, 8.

When the Apostles had been imprisoned, and convened before Council, they lift
up their voice to God with one accord, and said, Lord, Thou art God, etc.
Behold their threatenings, and grant unto thy servants, etc. Acts 4. 24, 29, 30.

Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayers were made without ceasing, of
the Church, to God for him, Acts 12. 5, 12.

Paul, when he was under the buffeting of Satan, says, For this thing I
besought the Lord thrice, that it might depart from me, 2 Cor. 12. 7, 8.

Is any among you afflicted? Let him pray, etc. Is any sick among you? Let him
call for the Elders of the Church, and let them pray over him, etc. and the
prayers of the faithful shall save the sick, James 5. 13, 14, 15.

See more of Prayer, Chap. 16.

See more of Duties in common Calamities.

7. Not to fear; but believing, commit their Case to God, and quietly wait for
his Salvation.
HE has said, I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee. So that we may boldly
say, The Lord is my helper; I will not fear what man can do unto me, Heb. 13.
5, 6.

Israel's Impatience in waiting for God, made them quarrel with Moses; and
Moses, with God; although God was in his way of delivering, Exodus 5. 21, 22, 23.

The children of Israel said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt,
have thou taken us away, to die in the wilderness? etc. And Moses said unto the
people, Fear ye not, stand still, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he
shall show to you this day, etc. The Lord shall fight for you, Exodus 14. 10, to
14.

Because of Israel's Unbelief, and Impatience in waiting for God, they were not
suffered to enter Canaan; only their Children, of whom they had said, They
should be a prey, they did possess the land, Deuteronomy. 1. 32, to 39.

As an encouragement, we should remember what God has done formerly, Dent. 7.
17, 18, 19.

And David was greatly distressed, etc. but David encouraged himself in the
Lord his God, 1 Samuel 30. 6. chapter 17. 34, 35, 36, 37.

It may be the Lord will lock on my affliction; and that the Lord will requite
good for his cursing this day, 2 Samuel 16. 12.

Elisha said, when the City was environed with Enemies, Fear not; for they who
be with us, are more than they who be with them, etc. But when there was a
Famine in Samaria, the King (because Deliverance hastened not) said, Behold,
this evil is from the Lord: What should I wait for the Lord any longer? 2 Kings
6. 14, 15, 16, 33. 2 Chronicles. 32. 7, 8.

In the great Famine of Samaria, the great Lord who would not believe the
Plen^y the Prophet had foretold, was told by the Prophet, that he should see
it, but not eat thereof: And so it fell out unto him, 2 Kings 7. 1, 2, 17, 18,
19, 20.

Though Judah was beset by Israel, yet Judah prevailed, because they relied
upon the Lord God, etc. 2 Chronicles. 23. 14, 18. Ezra 8. 21, 22, 23.

God was angry with Asa for relying upon the King of Assyria, and not on God, 2 Chronicles. 16.

Be not afraid, nor dismayed; for the battle is not yours, but God's etc. Stand
ye, and see the salvation of the Lord with you, 2 Chronicles. 20. 15, 16, 17.

To God I would commit my cause, Job 5. 8. Psalm. 9. 10. Psalm. 10. 14. Psalm. 11.
1.

I waited patiently for the Lord, and he inclined to me, etc. He brought me out
of an horrible pit, Psalm. 40. 1, 2.

Why art thou cast down, O my soul? why art thou disquieted in me? Hope thou in
God; for I shall yet praise him, Psalm. 42. 5, 11. Psalm. 31. 24.

Cast thy burden upon the Lord; and he shall sustain thee, Psalm. 55. 22.

The Lord is merciful, etc. he will not always chide, etc. Psalm. 103. 8, 9.

Our bones are scattered at the graves mouth, etc. But mine eyes are unto thee,
O Lord, Psalm. 141 7, 8. Job 13. 15.

Despise not the chastening of the Lord: neither be weary of his correction,
Prove. 3. 11, 12. Heb. 12. 5, 6.

If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small, Prove. 24. 10.

The fear of man brings a snare: but whosoever trusts in the Lord, shall be
safe, Prove. 29. 25.

If thou see the oppression of the poor, etc. marvel not, etc. for he who is
higher than the highest regards, etc. Eccles. 5. 8.

Take heed, and be quiet: fear not, neither be faint-hearted, etc. because
Syria, Ephraim, etc. have taken evil counsel against thee, etc. It shall not
stand, Isa. 7. 3, to 7.

And I will wait upon the Lord, who hides his face from the house of Jacob;
and I will look for him, Isa. 8. 17.

It shall be said in that day, Lo, this is our God; we have waited for him, and
he will save us, Isa. 25. 9. chapter 26. 8.

Thou will keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee, etc. Come,
my people; enter thou into thy chamber, etc. hide thy self, etc. until the
indignation be over, Isa. 26. 3, 20.

The Egyptians shall help in vain, etc. therefore have I cried, etc. their
strength is, to sit still, etc. Thus says the Lord, In returning, and rest,
you shall be saved: in quietness, and in confidence, shall be your strength,
etc. Isa. 30. 7, 15.

Fear not, for I am with thee: Be not dismayed, for I am thy God, etc. Isa. 41.
10, 13, 14. Genesis 15. 1. chapter 26. 24.

Who is among you who fears the Lord, who obeys the voice of his servant,
who walks in darkness, and has no light? Let him trust in the name of the
Lord, and stay upon his God. Behold, all ye who kindle a fire, etc. Isa. 50.
10, 11.

Fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be afraid or their revilings, etc. I,
even I am he who comfort you. Who art thou, that thou should be afraid of
a man that shall die, etc. and forgettest the Lord, thy Maker? Isa. 51. 7, 12,
13. Matthew. 10. 28, 31.

It is the Lord's mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions
fail not, etc. It Is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the
salvation of the Lord, Lamen. 3. 22, 25, 26.

The three Children threatened, said, Our God, etc. will deliver us out of thy
hand, Daniel 3. 16, 17.

When my soul fainted within me, I remembered the Lord, Jonah 2. 7.

None upright amongst men, they all lie in wait to shed blood, etc. that they
do evil with both hands earnestly, etc. The son dishonors the father, etc.
therefore will I look unto the Lord, I will wait for the God of my salvation,
Micah 7. 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

The Lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble, and he knows them who
trust in him, Nahum. 1. 7.

Take no thought, etc. for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye
shall speak, Matthew. 10. 19, 20, 28, 31. chapter 6. 27.

Come unto me all ye who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest,
Matthew. 11. 28.

When they shall deliver you up, etc. study not before what to say, it shall be
given you then, etc. Mark 13. 11. Luke 24. 14, 15, etc.

God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that you are
able; but will with the temptation also make a way to escape, 1 Cor. 10. 13.

We should not trust in our selves, but in God, etc. who delivered us from so
great a death, and does deliver: in whom we trust, that he will yet deliver, 2
Cor. 1. 9, 10. Judges 13. 22, 23. 1 Samuel 17. 34, 35, 36, 37.

In nothing terrified by your adversaries, Phil. 1. 28.

Be careful for nothing, but in every thing, etc. let your request be made
known unto God, Phil. 4. 6.

We our selves glory in you, etc. for your patience and faith in all your
persecutions, 2 These. 1. 4.

Christ also suffered for us, leaving us an example, etc. When he suffered he
threatened not, but committed his cause to him who judges righteously, 1 Pet.
2. 21, 23.

If ye suffer, etc. be not afraid of their terror, etc. but sanctify the Lord,
etc. 1 Pet. 3. 14, 15. Hebr. 13. 16. Rev. 2. 10.

Wherefore let them who suffer according to the will of God, commit the keeping
of their soul to him in well-doing, as unto a faithful Creator, 1 Pet. 4. 19.

See more of Trust in God, Chap. 16.

See of Waiting for God, Ibid.

See more of not Fearing, Ibid.

Secondly, The Duties of Saints, and how they ought to behave themselves
toward Enemies and Persecutors, in a time of Persecution and Suffering from
them.
1. To be patient, quiet, and sober toward them: not revenge, or return Evil
for Evil, or Reviling for Reviling, but forgive them.
JOseph, instead of revenging upon his Brethren, for their injuring of him,
speaks kindly to his Brethren, and said, Be not grieved, nor angry with your
selves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve
life, etc. So now it was not you who sent me hither, but God, etc. Genesis 45. 6,
7, 8. Genesis 50. 19, 20, 21.

Though Saul hunted for David's life, yet would not David avenge himself upon
him, 1 Samuel 24. chapter 26.

When Shimei cursed David, he bore it quietly, and would not avenge himself, 2 Samuel 16. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11.

And afterward Abishai said to David, Shall not Shimei be put to death for
this, because he cursed the Lord's anointed, etc. David said to Shimei, Thou
shall not die, 2 Samuel 19. 21, 22, 23.

Job quarrelled not with the Instruments which spoiled him, but acknowledged
'twas the Lord, Job 1. 20, 21.

O God, to whom vengeance belong, etc. show thy self, Psalm 94. 1.

Envy thou not the oppressor ( or, the Man of Violence,) Prove. 3. 31.

Say not thou, I will recompense evil: wait on the Lord, and he shall save,
Prove. 20. 22.

Say not, I will do so to him as he has done to me: I will render to the man,
etc. Prove. 24. 29.

He was oppressed, etc. yet he opened not his mouth, etc. as a sheep, etc. so
he opened not his mouth, Isa. 53. 7. Psalm 38, 13, 14.

Jeremy said, As for me, behold, I am in your hand, do with me as seems good,
etc. Jer. 26. 11, 14.

Resist not: but whosever shall finite thee on the right cheek, turn to him the
other, Matthew. 5. 38, 39.

If ye forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive
you, Matthew. 6. 14, 15.

When one of Christ's Disciples drew his Sword, etc. he bid him put it up, etc.
Matthew 26. 51, 52.

James and John said, Lord, Will thou that we command fire down from heaven,
and consume them? etc. but he turned and rebuked them: and said, Ye know not
what manner of spirit ye are of: for the Son of man is not come to destroy men's
lives, etc. Luke 9. 53, 54, 55, 56.

Ye shall be hated, etc. in your patience possess. ye your souls, etc. Luke 21.
16, 17, 19.

Paul said to Festus (when he had said, He was beside himself) I am not mad,
most noble Festus, etc. Acts 26. 24, 25.

Recompense to no man evil for evil, etc. Avenge not your selves, but rather
give place to wrath: for it is written, Vengeance is mine, I will repay, faith
the Lord, Romans 12. 17, 19. Deuteronomy. 32. 35.

Being reviled, we bless, etc. being defamed, we entreat, 1 Cor. 4. 12, 13.

See that none render evil for evil unto any man, 1 These. 5. 15.

Ye have condemned and killed the just, and he does not resist you, James 5. 6.

So is the will of God, that with well-doing ye may put to silence the
ignorance of foolish men, etc. Christ suffered, etc. leaving us an example that
ye should follow his steps, etc. who when he was reviled, reviled not again:
when he suffered, he threatened not, 1 Pet. 2. 15, 21, 23.

Not rendering evil for evil, or railing, etc. 1 Pet. 3. 9.

2. Not to desire, or rejoice, in the hurt of Enemies and Persecutors.
DAvid mourned and wept when Saul was slain, although he had been his deadly
enemy; hated and pursued him several years, 2 Samuel 1. 4, 5, to the end.

Abner his great enemy, who set up Ishbosheth in opposition to him, being
slain, David said, I and my kingdom are guiltless before the Lord for ever,
etc. He commands all to mourn for him: and himself mourned, followed him to his
funeral, 2 Samuel 3. 27, 28, 29, 31, 32.

So David, instead of rejoicing that Ishbosheth was slain, commanded his young
men to kill those who slew him, 2 Samuel 4. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12.

When Israel had conquered Judah: the Prophet commanded them to let the
Captives go, feed them, and clothe them, and not insult over them, 2 Chronicles. 28.
9, 10, etc.

If I rejoice at the destruction of him who hated me, or lift up my self when
evil found him: neither have I suffered my mouth to sin, by wishing a curse to
his soul, Job 31. 28, 29, 30.

He who is glad at calamities shall not go unpunished, Prove. 17. 5.

Rejoice not when thine enemy falls, and let not thine heart be glad when he
stumbleth: lest the Lord see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his
wrath from him, Prove. 24. 17, 18.

3. To pray for, and do good to Persecutors and Enemies.
IF thou see the ass or ox of thine enemy going astray, thou shall, etc.
bring it back, etc. Exodus 23. 4, 5.

Miriam had spoken against Moses; yet he prays for her, against her Leprosy,
Numb. 12. 1, 10, 13.

Saul said to David, Thou have rewarded me good, whereas I have rewarded thee
evil, 1 Samuel 24. 17.

Israel came and fought against Judah: and being overcome, Judah shows them
kindness, 2 Chronicles. 28.

If thine enemy hunger, give him bread to eat: and if he be thristy, give him
water to drink, etc. Prove. 25. 21. Romans 12. 20.

Seek the peace of the city, whither I have caused you to be carried captives:
and pray unto the Lord for it, Jer. 29. 7.

I say unto you, Love your enemies: bless them who curse you: do good to them
who hate you: and pray for them who despitefully use you, and persecute you;
that you may be the children of your Father, etc. For he makes his sun to rise
on the evil, etc. If you love them who love you, etc. do not even the Publicans
the same? Matthew. 5. 44, 45, 46, 47, 48.

Christ said, ( when upon the Cross) Father, forgive them, for they know not
what they do, Luke 23. 34.

They stoned Stephen; and he, etc. cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this
sin to their charge, Acts 7. 59, 60.

Paul prayed for Agrippa, that he were not only almost, but altogether as he,
except his bonds, Acts 26. 28, 29.

Bless them who persecute you, etc. Wherefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him,
etc. be not overcome of evil, but overcome evil with good, Romans 12. 14, 20, 21.

Being reviled, we bless, 1 Cor. 4. 12.

4. To use lawful and honest Means for avoiding and tasing of, and delivering
themselves from Afflictions and Persecutions, Matthew. 4. 5, 6, 7.
WHen there was a Famine in the Land where Abram was, he removed to Egypt, Genesis

When Abram had heard, that Lot was taken, etc. he pursues the Enemy, and
rescues him, Genesis 14. 14, 15, etc.

When Jacob heard of his brother Esau his coming against him, he was greatly
afraid and distressed: and he divided the people that was with him, and the
flocks, etc. and said, It Esau come to the one company and smite it, then the
other company which is left shall escape, etc. And he took of that which came
to his hand, a present for his brother Esau, etc. for he said, I will appease
him with the present which goes before me, etc. Genesis 32. 6, 7, 8, 13, 20. chapter
33. 3, 8, 13, 14.

Joseph in the Prison, desired the King's Cupbearer to speak to the King on his
behalf, Genesis 4. 14, 15, etc.

Saul sought to smite David, etc. but he slipped away out of Readiness Presence,
etc. and escaped that night. Saul also sent messengers unto David's House to
watch him, and to slay him, etc. His Wife let him down through a Window, and he
went and fled, and escaped, 1 Samuel 19. 10, 11, 12.

David consulted with Jonathan about his safety from Saul, 1 Samuel 20.

Elijah being threatened by Jezebel, arose, and went for his life, etc. 1 Kings
19. 2, 3.

Hezekiah laid figs to his sore, by the Prophet's direction, and recovered, 2
Kings 20. 7.

Sanbaliat, etc. conspired all of them together to come to fight against
Jerusalem, and to hinder the work: nevertheless, we made our prayer unto our
God, and set a watch against them day and night, because of them, Nehem. 4. 7,
8.

Sanballat sent often to Nehemiah to come unto him, but he refused: because he
knew they thought to do him some mischief, Nehem. 6. 2, 3, 4.

Esther and Mordecai did many things to procure the Jews escape, Esther 8. chapter
9. Prove. 24. 11.

Give strong drink to him who is ready to perish, etc. and wine to those of a
heavy heart, Prove. 31. 6.

Jeremy entreated the King that he might not return to the prison, lest he
should die there, Jer. 37. 18, 20.

Daniel applied himself to the Captain of the King's Guard, and to the King
himself, for himself and friends. Dan. 2. 13, 14, 15, 16.

When Herod sought Christ to kill him, the Angel said to Joseph, etc. Arise,
and take the young child, etc. flee into Egypt, and be thou there, etc. for
Herod will seek the young child to destroy him, Matthew. 2. 13, 14, 15.

Behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye therefore wise
as serpents, and harmless as doves, etc. But when they persecute you in this
city, flee ye into another, Matthew. 10. 16, 23.

The Pharisees, etc. held a council against him, how they might destroy him:
but when Jesus knew it, he withdrew himself from thence, etc. he charged the
multitude not to make him known, Matthew. 12. 14, 15, 16.

When Jesus heard that John was beheaded, hedeparted thence into a desert-place
apart, Matthew. 14. 12, 13.

Though Christ was free, and ought not to be charged with Tribute-money; yet he
said to Peter, Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go, etc. take, and
give unto them for thee and me, Matthew. 17. 24, 25, 26, 27.

When Christ had raised the Ruler's Daughter from the dead, he commanded that
something should be given her to eat, Mark 5. 41, 42, 43.

Jesus walked in Galilee: for he would not walk in Jury, because the Jews
sought to kill him, John 7. 1,

They took up stones to cast at him: but Jesus hid himself, and went out, etc.
and so passed by, John 8. 59.

From that day forth they took counsel together to out him to death: Jesus
therefore walked no more openly among the Jews; but went thence into a country
near the wilderness, John 11. 35, 54.

The doors were shut where the Disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews,
John 20. 19.

When Saul persecuted the Church at Jerusalem, the brethren were scattered
abroad, Acts 8. 1, 3, 4. chapter 11. 19.

The Jews laid wait to kill Paul; but their laying wait was known unto Saul,
and they watched the gates day and night to kill him: then the Disciples took
him by night, and let him down by the wall in a basket, etc. The Grecians went
about to slay him; which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to
Cesaria, and sent him forth to Tarsus, Acts 9. 23. 24, 25, 29, 30. chapter 19. 30,
31. chapter 17. 10, 14, 15. 2 Cor. 11. 32, 33.

Paul and Barnabas being at Iconium, the Jews and Gentiles made an assault to
use them despitefully, and to stone them: they were aware of it, and fled into
Listra and Derbe, etc. Acts 14. 1, 5, 6.

When the Magistrates sent to let the Apostles out, Paul said, Let them come
themselves, etc. Acts 16. 36, 37.

When Paul was in danger, the brethren often sent him and others away from the
place, Acts 17. 5, 10, 13. chapter 19. 30, 31.

The Captain commanded that Paul should be examined by scourging, etc. Paul
said, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man who is a Roman, and uncondemned?
which prevented his being scourged, Acts 22. 24, 25, 26, 29. chapter 16. 37, 38.

Paul said to Ananias, Sit thou to judge me after the law, and command
me to be smitten contrary to the law, etc. But when Paul perceived that the one
part were Sadduces, and the other Pharisees, he cried out in the Council, Men
and Brethren, I am a Pharisee, the son of a Pharisee, of the hope and
resurrection of the dead, I am called in question; (whereupon the Council
divided, and broke to pieces.) When Paul understood that there was a conspiracy
to kill him, he gave notice thereof to the Captain, who conveyed him away from
them, Acts 23. 3, 6, 7, 8, 9, 14, 15, 16, 17, etc.

Paul pleaded in his defense before Felix; and after appealed to Coesar, Acts
24. 10, 11, etc. chapter 25. 8, 9. chapter 26. 1, 2, 3, etc.

Paul persuaded those in the ship to eat meat: when they were in danger, he
said, This is for your health, etc. Acts 27. 33, 34, 35.

I beseech you, etc. that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for
me, that I may be delivered from them who do not believe, in Judea, Romans 15.
30, 31.

Alexander the copper-smith did me much evil, etc. of whom be thou ware also,
for he has greatly withstood our words, 2 Timothy 4. 14, 15.

Some, of whom the world was not worthy, wandered in deserts, etc. in dens and
caves of the earth, Heb. 11. 38.

5. To look to the cause of our Sufferings, that it ^e for well-doing, for
Christ, and a good Conscience: and not as busy Bodies in things unnecessary.
THey also who render me evil for good, are mine adversaries: because I follow
the thing which is good, Psalm. 38. 20. Psalm. 35. 20. Psalm. 209. 4, 5.

Do not ye serve my gods, nor worship the golden image, etc.? but if ye worship
not, ye shall be cast into the midst of a burning fiery furnace, Dan. 3. 14,
15, 18.

Daniel cast into the lions den for praying to God, contrary to the Kings
decrees, Dan. 6. 7, 8, 9, 10, etc.

Therefore the prudent shall keep silent in that time, for it is an evil time,
Amos. 5. 13. Psalm. 39. 1.

Blessed are ye when men shall revile you, etc. falsely for my sake, etc. for
righteousness sake, Matthew. 5. 10, 11.

When they charged the Apostles not to preach in Christ's name, they said,
Whether it be right in the sight of God to hearken unto you more than unto God,
judge ye? for we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard, Acts
4. 17, 18, 19, 20.

The high Priest asked them, saying, Did not we straightly command you, that you
should not teach in this name, etc. Then Peter and the other Apostles answered
and said, We ought to obey God rather than men, Acts 5. 27, 28, 29.

But in all things approving our selves, etc. as deceivers, and yet true, 2
Cor. 6. 4, 8.

If I do preach Circumcision, Why do I yet suffer persecution? then is the
offense of the cross ceased, Gal. 5. 11. chapter 6. 12.

Having your conversation honest, etc. that whereas they speak against you as
evil doers, etc. It is the will of God that with well-doing ye may put to
silence the ignorance of foolish men, etc. this is thank worthy, if a man for
conscience toward God endure grief, suffering wrongfully, 1 Pet. 2. 12, 15, 19.

If ye suffer for righteousness sake, happy are ye: be not afraid, etc. It is
better, if the will of God be so, that ye suffer for well-doing, than for
evil-doing, 1 Pet. 3. 13, 14, 17.

If ye be reproached for the name of Christ, happy are ye, etc. but let none of
you suffer as a murderer, or as a thief, or as an evil-doer, or as a busie-body
in other men's matters: yet if any suffer as a Christian, let him not be
ashamed, 1 Pet. 4, 14, 15, 16. Amos 5. 13.

Thirdly, The Duties of others: and how they ought to behave themselves toward
such who are Afflicted and Persecuted.
To Sympathize with them, Visit, Help, Comfort, and Pray for them: take heed
they add not to their Trouble.
THE heart knows its one bitterness, and a stranger does not intermeddle with
his joy, Prove, 14. 10.

When Abram heard that his brother Lot was taken captive, he armed ( or, led
forth) his trained ( or, instructed) servants, etc. and pursued those who took
Lot: and he smote them, etc. and he brougth back all the goods: and also
brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, Genesis 14. 12,
13, 14, 15, 16.

When David fled from Saul into a wood, Jonathan went to him and strengthened,
etc. 1 Samuel 23. 15, 16, 17.

When Nehemiah had heard that the Jews were in great affliction and reproach
(though he were then a servant to the king): he sat down, and wept, and mourned
certain days, and fasted and prayed before the God of heaven, etc. Nehem. 1. 2,
3, 4, 5, etc.

Thou shall not vex a stranger, etc. Ye shall not afflict any widow, or
fatherless child, Exodus 22. 21, 22.

When Jobs three friends heard of the evil which was come upon him, they came
every one from his own place, etc. for they had made an appointment together to
come to mourn with him, and to comfort him, etc. They wept, Job 2. 11, 12, 13.

Thou have strengthened the weak hands: thy words have upholden him who was
falling, and thou have strengthened the feeble knees: But, etc. Job. 4. 3, 4.

To him who is afflicted, pity should be showed from his friend, Job. 6. 14.

Job said to his friends, ye are forgers of lies, ye are all Physicians of no
value: O, that you would altogether hold your peace, etc. Will you speak
wickedly for ^od, etc.? Job 13. 4, 5, 7.

Job answered and said, I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are
ye all ( or, troublesome comforters are ye all)? shall vain words have an end,
etc.? I also could speak as ye do, if your souls were in my souls stead; I
could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you: but I would
strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should assuage your
grief, Job. 16. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.

How long will ye vex my soul, etc. these ten times have ye reproached me: you
are, etc. He has put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily
estranged from me: my kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have
forgotton me: they who dwell in my house, and my maldens, count me for a
stranger; I am an alien in their sight, etc. have pity upon me, my friends; for
the hand of God has touched me, Job. 19. 2, 13, 14, 15, 16, 19, 21. Psalm. 69.
8, 20.

Because he has loosed my cord, and afflicted me: they have also let loose the
bridle before me, etc. Did not I weep for him who is in trouble? was not my
soul grieved for the poor? Job. 30. 11. 25.

Blessed is he who considers the poor (or sick), etc. the Lord will
strengthen him upon the bed, etc. Psalm. 41. 1, 2, 3.

God is said to be afflicted in the afflictions of his people, Isa. 63. 9.

Woe to them who are at ease in Zion, etc. Ye that put far away the evil day,
etc. that lie upon beds of ivory, etc. but they are not grieved for the
afflictions of Joseph, Amos 6. 1, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

I am very sore displeased with the heathen that are at ease: for I was but a
little displeased, and they helped forward the affliction, Zecha. 1. 15.
Obadiah, v. 11. 12, 13, 14.

When Jesus saw the multitude, he had compassion on them, because they fainted
( or, were tired and laid down), etc. Matthew. 9. 36.

I was an hungry, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty* and ye gave me drink: I
was a stranger, and ye took me in: naked, and ye clothed me: I was in prison,
and ye came unto me: I was sick, and ye visited me, etc. Inasmuch as ye have
done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me,
Matthew. 25. 35, 36, 37, 40.

When Jesus had put forth the parable of a man falling among thieves, and was
wounded, and the Priest and Levite passing by, and looking on: but the
Samaritan had compassion on him, and went to him, and bound up his wounds, and
took care of him; he said, Go, and do thou likewise, Luke 10. 30, 31, 32, 33,
34, 35, 36, 37.

Simon, Simon, Satan has desired to have you, that he might sift you as wheat:
but I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not; and when thou art
converted, strengthen thy brethren, Luke 22. 31, 32.

Peter therefore was kept in prison: but prayer was made without ceasing ( or,
earnest and instant prayer was made) of the Church unto God for him, Acts 12.
5. 12.

Rejoice with them who do rejoice, and weep with them who do weep: be of the
same mind one toward another, Romans 12. 15, 16.

The members should have the same care one of another: and whether one member
suffer, all the members suffer with it: or one member be honored, all the
members rejoice with it: now ye are the body of Christ, and members in
particular, 1 Cor. 12. 24, 25, 26, 27.

Blessed be God, etc. who comfort us in all our tribulations, that we may be
able to comfort them who are in any trouble, by the comfort wherewith we our
selves are comforted of God, 2 Cor. 1. 3, 4.

Bear ye one another burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ, Gal. 6. 2.

Be kind one to another, render-hearted, Ephe. 4. 32.

Ye have done well that ye did communicate with mine afflictions, etc. Ye sent
once and again to my necessity, Phil. 4. 14, 15, 16. Isa. 58. 10.

Put on therefore (as the elect of God, holy and beloved) bowels of mercy, Col.
3. 12,

Be not thou therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his
prisoner: but be thou partaker of the afflictions of the Gospel, etc. The Lord
give mercy unto the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me, and was
not ashamed of my chain: But when he was in Rome, he sought me out very
diligently, and found me: the Lord grant unto him that he may find mercy of the
Lord in that day, etc. how many things he ministered unto me at Ephesus, thou
know, 2 Timothy 1. 8, 16, 17, 18.

At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God
that it may not be laid to their charge, 2 Timothy 4. 16,

Ye endured a great fight or affliction: partly, whiles ye were made a
gazing-stock, both by reproaches and afflictions: and p^^tly, whilst ye became
companions of them who were so used; for ye had compassion on me in my bonds,
etc. Heb. 10. 32, 33, 34.

Be not forgetful to entertain strangers: for thereby some have entertained
Angels unawares. Remember them who are in bonds, as bound with them: them who
suffer adversity, as being your selves also in the body, Heb. 13. 2, 3.

Pure religion, etc. is to visit the fatherless and the widows in their
affliction, James 1. 27.

See Duties in common Calamities, Chap. 23.

See Duty of Christians one to another, Chap. 17

CHAP. XXIII.
Of Public or Common Calamities and Judgments, whence they are.
I. That they are of Gods ordering, and none can keep them off.
GOD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, etc. And the Lord
said, I will destroy man whom I have created, etc. And behold, I even I do
bring a flood of waters upon the earth to destroy all flesh, etc. Accordingly
he brings the flood, Genesis 6. 5, 7, 17. chapter 7. 4. Job. 37. 11, 12, 13.

The Lord rained upon Sodom, and upon Gomorrah brimstone and fire from the Lord
out of heaven: and he overthrew those Cities, Genesis 19. 24, 25.

God said, I will harden Pharaohs heart, that he shall not let the people go,
Exodus 4. 21. chapter 14. 4. Joshua 11. 20.

See now that I am he, and there is no God with me: I kill, I make alive: I
wound, I heal; neither is there any who can deliver out of my hand, Deuteronomy. 32.
39.

Gods anger was hot against Israel, therefore he left their enemies amongst
them, Judges 2. 20, 21, 22, 23.

If ye turn away and forsake my statutes, etc. then will I pluck them up by the
roots out of my land, etc. 2 Chronicles. 7. 19, 20.

The Lord stirred up against Jehoram the spirits of the Philistines, and of the
Arabians, etc. and they came up into Judah, and brake into it, etc. 2 Chronicles.
21. 16, 17, 2 Kings 24, 2. 3.

They mocked the messengers, etc. till the wrath of the Lord arose against his
people, and there was no remedy: therefore he brought upon them the king of the
Chaldees, who slew their young men, etc. 2 Chronicles. 36. 15, 16, 17.

Afflictions come not out of the dust, etc. he makes fore and binds up, Job.
5. 17, 18. chapter 9. 12.

He turned their hearts to hate his people, and to deal subtly with his
servants, Psalm 105. 25.

He gave them into the hand of the heathen: and they who hated them, ruled over
them, Psalm. 106. 41, 42. Psalm. 44. 10. 11, 12, 13, 14. Psalm. 60. 10. Lam. 2. 17.

O Assyrian, etc. I will send him against an hypocritical nation, etc. to tread
them down, etc. Isa. 10. 5, 6.

Behold the Lord comes out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the
earth, Isa. 26. 21.

Ye scornful men, etc. when the overflowing scourge shall pass through, then
shall ye be overthrown by it, etc. I have heard from the Lord of hosts, a
consumption determined upon the whole earth, Isa. 28. 14, 15, 18, 22.

Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the Lord
against whom, etc? Isa. 42. 24. Ezekiel. 39. 23, 24. Job. 12. 23.

I make peace, and create evil: I the Lord do all these things, Isa. 45. 7.

I was wroth with my people: I have, etc. given them into thine hand, etc.
therefore shall evil come upon thee, etc. thou shall not be able to put it off,
etc. Isa. 47. 6, 11. Jer. 46. 15.

I have forsaken mine house: I have left mine heritage: I have given the dearly
beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies, Jer. 12. 7, 8, 9, 10.

At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom,
to pluck up, and to pull down, and to destroy: If that nation, etc. Jer. 18. 7.
8.

O sword of the Lord, etc. how can it be quiet, seeing the Lord has given it a
charge against Askelon, etc. Jer. 47. 6, 7.

Is there any sorrow like unto my sorrow, where with the Lord has afflicted me
in the day of the Lords anger? Lam. 1. 12, 13. 14, etc. chapter 3.

Shall there be evil in a city, and the Lord has not done it? Amos. 3. 6.

Therefore thus will I do unto thee, O Israel, etc. prepare to meet thy God,
etc. Amos 4. 12.

Before these days there was no, etc. neither any peace to him who went out or
came in: because of the affliction; for I set all men: every man against his
neighbor, Zech. 8. 10.

See more in Afflictions, Chap. 22.

II. The Privileges of the Saints and Servants of God, in such a time.
WHen God destroyed the whole world by the flood, Noah found grace in the eyes
of the Lord, and he and his family were saved in the Ark, Genesis 6. 8, 17, 18,
chapter 7. 1, etc.

God would have spared Sodom for the sake of ten righteous persons, Genesis 18. 32.

In the destruction of Sodom, Lot was preserved and all his, and sent out by
the Angel from the overthrow, and escaped, Genesis 19. 12, 13, 15, 16, 17.

Jacob, and his family nourished by Joseph, in the great famine, Genesis 47. 12,
13.

I have seen the affliction of my people, etc. and I am come down to deliver
them, etc. Exodus 3. 7, 8. Acts 7. 34.

God smote the Egyptians universally, in the destruction of their ^rst-born.
But he said, Against any of the children of Israel shall not a dog move his
tongue, against man or beast, etc. The plague shall not be upon you, Exodus 11.
5, 6, 7. chapter 12. 11, 12, 13.

The Lord will judge his people, etc. when he sees that their power is gone,
Deuteronomy. 32. 36. 2 Kings 14. 26.

Elijah and the widow fed in the time of the famine, 1 Kings 17.

God said to Josiah, Thou shall be gathered into thy grave in peace, and thine
eyes shall not see all the evil which I will bring upon this place, 2 Kings 22.
16, 17, 18, 20.

In famine he shall redeem thee from death: in war from the power of the sword:
at destruction and famine thou shall laugh, Job. 5. 20, 22. Psalm 33. 18, 19.

Thou shall not be afraid, etc. nor for the pestilence, etc. for the
destruction, etc. Psalm. 91. 5. 6, 7. Psalm. 37. 18, 19.

Though the earth be moved, etc. There is a river, the streams whereof shall
make glad the city of God, etc. God is in the midst of her, etc. Psalm. 46. 2,
3, 4, 5, 6.

Despise not the chastening of the Lord: neither be weary, etc. Prove. 3, 11, 12.

Come my people, enter thou into thy chambers, and shut thy doors about thee:
hide thy self, etc. until the indignation be over-past: for behold, the Lord
comes out of his place to punish the inhabitants of the earth, etc. Isa 26.
20, 21.

The whole land shall be desolate, yet will I not make a full end, Jer. 4. 27.
chapter 5, 18. Isa, 17. 4, 5, 6.

For my name sake will I defer mine anger, etc. that I cut thee not off, etc.
for my name sake, etc. Isa. 48. 9, 11.

Run to and fro through the streets of Jerusalem, etc. if ye can find a man, if
there be any who executes judgment, who seeks truth, and I will pardon it,
Jer. 5. 1.

When Jeremy was taken with the rest of the Jews, God took care of him, Jer.
39. 11, 12, 14.

I will make a full end of all nations, where I have driven thee: but I will
not make a full end of thee, Jer. 46. 48. Levit. 26. 44, 45.

Set a mark upon the foreheads of them who sigh and cry for all the
abominations, etc. Slay utterly, old and young, etc. but come not near any man
upon whom is the mark, Ezekiel. 9. 4, 5, 6.

Though Noah, Daniel, and Job were in thee, they should deliver but their own
souls only, Ezekiel. 14. 14, 18, 20.

All ye meek of the earth, who have wrought his judgment, etc. it may be ye
shall be hid in the day of the Lords anger, Zeph. 2. 3.

Hurt not the earth, etc. till we have sealed the servants of God in their
foreheads, Rev. 7. 2, 3.

And it was commanded that they should not hurt, etc. but only those men which
have not the seal of God in their foreheads, Rev. 9. 4.

See more of the Privileges, Chap. 14.

III. The Duties of Saints in such a Time.
WHen God had said, he would not go with Israel, but send his Angel, because
they had sinned. The people mourned and would not put on their ornaments, Exodus
33. 1, 2, 3, 4, etc.

If they shall confess their iniquity, etc. if then their uncircumcised hearts
be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity: then I
will remember my covenant with Jacob, etc. Lev. 26. 40, 41, 42.

When Gods anger brake out against Israel, Moses prayed for them, Numb 11. 1, 2.

When Israel fled before the men of Ai, Joshua prayed, and God commands him to
arise, and search out the sin, and remove the cause, Joshua 7. 6, 7, 8, 9, to
the 16.

Israel in all their distresses cried to the Lord, he helped, Judges 3. 9. chapter
4. 3. chapter 6. 7. chapter 10. 10, 13, 14. 1 Samuel 12. 9, 10.

If I shut up heaven, that there be no rain, etc. or if I send pestilence, etc.
If my people, etc. shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and
turn from their evil ways, then will I hear from heaven, forgive their sins,
and heal their land, 2 Chronicles. 7. 13, 14. Deuteronomy. 4. 29, 30. chapter 30. 1, 2, 3, etc.

When Jerusalem was in distress, the princes, the king humbled themselves, etc.
And God said, They have humbled themselves, I will not destroy them, etc. 2 Chronicles. 12. 6. 7. chapter 32. 26.

For a long time was Israel without the true God, etc. but when they in their
trouble did turn, etc. and sought him, 2 Chronicles. 15. 3, 4.

When Judas was beset by Israel, they cried unto the Lord, 2 Chronicles. 13. 14.

Jehosaphat proclaimed a fast throughout all Judea, in such a case, 2 Chronicles.
20. Ezra 8. 21, 22, 23.

Nehemiah mourned, and wept, and fasted, when he had heard of the sad calamity
of the Jews, and he prayed, etc. So did Jeremy, Neh. 1. 3, 4, 5. chapter 2. 2, 3.
Lam. 3. 48, 49.

When the Jews were near destruction by Hamans means, etc. Mordecai, and the
Jews greatly mourned, fasted, wept, lay in sackcloth, Ester 4. 1, 2, 3, 16.

The Psalmist makes complaint, and prays to God earnestly for the church in
great calamity, Psalm. 74. Psalm. 79. Psalm. 80.

By the rivers of babylon, there we sat down, we wept, when we remembered Zion,
etc. If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, etc. Psalm. 137. 1. 4. 5, 6.

Despise not the chastening of the Lord, nor be weary, etc. Prove. 3. 11, 12.

The people turned not to him who smote them, neither do they seek the Lord of
hosts, Isa. 9. 13, 14.

I will weep bitterly, labor not, etc. And in that day did the Lord of
hostscall to weeping, and to mourning, and to baldness, etc. and behold joy,
and gladness, slaying of oxen, etc. This iniquity shall not be purged from you
till ye die, says the Lord, Isa. 22. 4, 12, 13, 14.

In the way of thy judgments, O Lord, we have waited for thee, etc. Come my
people, enter into your chambers, etc. until the indignation be overpast, Isa.
26. 8, 12, 20, 21.

Hezekiah spread Rabshakehs letter before the Lord, and prayed unto the Lord,
etc. Isa. 57. 14, 15, etc.

There is none, etc. who stirs up himself to take hold of thee, for thou
have, etc. consumed, etc. Isa. 64. 7, 8, 9, 10.

Thou have stricken them, but they have not grieved: thou have consumed them,
but they have refused to receive correction, etc. They refused to return, Jer.
5. 3. chapter 2. 30.

Oh that my head were water, and mine eyes a fountain of tears, that I might
weep day and night, for the slain of the daughter of my people, etc. Jer. 9. 1.

Mine eyes shall weep in secret places for your pride: and mine eye shall weep
sore, and run down with tears, because the Lords flock is carried away captive,
Jer. 13. 17.

In the great famine, Jeremy confesses sin, and prays to, and pleads with God
for Israel at large, Jer. 14.

At what instant I shall speak concerning a nation, and concerning a kingdom,
to pluck up, and to pull down, and to destroy: If that nation, etc. turn from
their evil, I will repent of the evil which I thought. Behold, I frame evil
against you, etc. return ye now, every one from, etc. Jer. 18. 7, 8, 11.

God complained against Judah, that tho they were destroyed, yet not humbled,
Jer. 3. 44, 6, 10.

The Lord blamed Baruch for seeking great things for himself in such a day,
Jer. 45.

Arise, etc. pour out thy soul like water before the Lord, lift up thine hands,
etc. for the life of thy children, etc. Lam. 2. 19, 20.

Let us search, and try our ways, and turn again to the Lord: let us lift up
our heart with our hand unto God in the heavens, Lam. 3. 39, 40, 41, 42.

Set a mark upon the foreheads of the men who sigh and cry for all the
abominations that be done in the midst thereof, Ezekiel. 9. 4.

I sought for a man among them, who should make up the hedge, and stand in the
gap before me, for the land, that I should not destroy it: but I found none,
Ezekiel. 22, 30.

Daniel in the captivity confesses, and prays, Dan. 9. 3, 4, etc.

Come let us return unto the Lord, for he has torn, and he will heal, Hosea 6.
1.

God calls upon Israel, to sanctify a fast, and to ^y unto the Lord, Joel. 1.
13, 14. Zeph. 2. 1, 2, 3.

Turn to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with
mourning: and rent your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the Lord,
etc. Who knows if he will return and repent, and leave a blessing behind him,
etc.? Blow the trumpet in Zion, sanctify a fast, Joel 2. 12, 13, 14, 15, 16,
17, Deuteronomy. 30. 1, 2, 3, etc.

Because I will do this, prepare to meet thy God. O Israel, Amos 4. 11, 12.

The prudent shall keep silent in that time: for it is an evil time, etc. let
judgment run down like water, etc. Amos 5. 13, 14, 15, 24. Micah. 7. 5, 6. 7.

Woe to them who are at ease in Zion, etc. but are not grieved for the
affliction of Joseph, Amos 6. 1, 3, 6. Isa. 57. 1.

The mariners call upon Jonah to pray, and enquired for what cause they were in
that danger, Jonah 1. 5, 6, 7, etc.

The people of Nineveh upon a threatening, fast, pray, and return from their
evil, Jonah 3. 5, 6, etc.

Though there be no ox in the stall, etc. yet will I rejoice in the Lord, I
will joy in the God, etc. Hab. 3. 17, 18, 19.

Is this a time for you to dwell in your cieled houses, and this house lie
waste! etc. therefore thus says the Lord, consider ( or, set your heart upon)
your ways, Haggai 1. 4, 5, 7.

When ye fasted and mourned, did ye at all fast unto me, etc? Execute true
judgment, etc. Zech. 7. 5, 9, 10. Isa. 58. 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8.

When ye hear of wars, etc. be not troubled: for such things must be, Mark 13.
7.

Jesus said unto them, Suppose ye that these Galileans were sinners above all
the Ga^leans, because they suffered such things? I tell you, nay: but except ye
repent, ye shall all likewise perish. Or, those eighteen upon whom the tower in
Siloe fell, and slew them; think ye that they were sinners above all men who
dwelt in Jerusalem? I tell you, nay: but except ye repent, etc. Luke 13. 1, 2,
3, 4, 5.
