And herein do I exercise my (...) to have always a conscience void of offense
toward God and toward man, Acts 24. 16.

Which show the work of the law written in their hearts: their conscience also
bearing them witness ( or, the Conscience witnessing with them:) and their
thoughts the mean while ( or, between themselves) accusing or else excusing one
another, Romans 2. 15, 16.

I say the truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience also bearing me witness in
the Holy Ghost, Romans 9. 1.

Wherefore ye must needs be subject, not only for wrath, but for conscience
sake, Romans 13. 5.

Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, eat, asking no question for conscience
sake: for the earth is the Lord's, etc. If any of them who believe not, bid
you, etc. Whatsoever is before you, eat, asking no question for conscience
sake; but if any man say unto thee, This is offered to idols, eat not for his
sake, etc. and for conscience sake, etc. Conscience, I say, not thine own, but
of the others: for why is my liberty judged of another man's conscience? etc.
Give none offense, neither to the Jews, nor to the Gentiles, nor to the Church
of God, 1 Cor. 10. 25, 26, 27, 28, 29, 32. chapter 8. 7.

Our rejoicing is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and
godly sincerity, nor with sleshly wisdom, etc. 2 Cor. 1. 12.

By the manifestation of the truth, commended our selves to every man's
conscience in the sight of God, 2 Cor. 4. 2.

We are made manifest unto God; and I trust also, are made manifest in your
consciences, 2 Cor. 5. 11.

Now the end of the commandment is charity, out of a pure heart, and of a good
conscience, etc. holding faith and a good conscience: which some having put
away, concerning faith have made shipwreck, 1 Timothy 1. 5, 19.

Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience, 1 Timothy 3. 9.

The Spirit speaks expressly, that in the latter times some shall depart from
the faith, etc. speaking lies in hypocrine, having their consciences seared
with a hot iron, forbidding to marry, etc. 1 Timothy 4. 1, 2, 3.

I thank God, whom I serve, etc. with a pure conscience, 2 Timothy 1. 3.

Unto them who are defiled and unbelieving, is nothing pure; but even their
mind and conscience is defiled, Titus 1. 15.

In which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, which could not make him who
did the service, (...) as pertaining to the conscience, etc. If the blood of
bulls and goats sanctifies, to the purifying of the flesh; how much more shall
the blood of Christ, etc. purge your consciences from dead works, to serve the
living God? Heb. 9. 9^ 13, 14.

The law having a shadow of good things, etc. can never, with those sacrifiees
they offered year by year continually, make the comers thereunto perfect; then
would they not have ceased to be offered; because that the worshippers once
purged, should have had no more conscience of sins: but in those sacrifices
there is a remembrance, etc. Let us draw near, etc. having our hearts sprinkled
from an evil conscience, etc. Heb. 10. 1, 2, 3, 22.

We trust we have a good conscience in all things, willing to live honestly,
Heb. 13. 18.

This is thank-worthy, if a man for conscience toward God, endure grief,
suffering wrongfully, 1 Pet. 2. 19.

Having a good conscience; that whereas they speak evil of you, etc. Baptism
does also now save us: not the putting away the filth of the flesh, but the
answer of a good conscience toward God, by the resurrection of Jesus, 1 Pet.
3. 16, 21.

Let us not love in word, etc. Hereby we know, etc. For if our heart condemn
us, God is greater than our heart, and knows all things. Beloved, if our
heart condemn us not, then have we confidence toward God, 1 John 3. 18, to 22.

CHAP. XXX.
Of the Devil: Of his Subtilty, Wiles and Ways, by himself, and in and by his
Instruments, Wicked Men, False Teachers, Deceivers and Seducers. The
Description of them; And what concerns the Saints therein.
First, Of Satan, the Devil himself.
NOW the serpent was more subtle than any beast of the field, which the Lord
God had made: And he said unto the woman, Yea, because ( or, has) God said, Ye
shall not eat of every tree of the garden? The woman said, etc. We may eat,
etc. but of the fruit of the tree in the midst of the garden, God has said, Ye
shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die. And the serpent
said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die; for God does know, that in the
day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be open, and ye shall be as gods,
knowing good and evil. And the woman saw that the tree was good, Genesis 3. 1, to
7.

Satan was a lying Spirit in the Prophets, to persuade Ahab, etc. 1 Kings 22.
21, 22, 23. 2 Chronicles. 20. 21, 22.

And Satan stood up against Israel, and provoked David to number Israel, 1 Chronicles. 21. 1. 2 Samuel 24. 1.

Now there was a day, when the sons of God came to present themselves before
the Lord: and Satan ( or, the adversary) came also among ( or, in the (...) of)
them, etc. The Lord said to Satan, From whence come thou? Then said he, etc.
From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it, etc. He
said, Does Job serve God for naught? Have thou not made an hedge about him?
etc. Put forth thine hand, and touch that which he has, and he will curse thee
to thy face, etc. Then Satan, having leave given him, destroyed all he had, Job
1. 6, 7, to the end; chapter 2. 1, 2, 3.

Have thou considered my servant Job? etc. still he holds fast his integrity,
although thou movedst me against him, to destroy him without a cause. And Satan
answered the Lord, and said, Skin for skin; yea, and all that a man has, will
he give for his life: but put forth thine hand now, and touch his bone, and his
flesh, and he will curse thee to thy face. And the Lord said, He is in thine
hand; but ( or, only) save his life. So went Satan, etc. and smote Job, Job 2.
3, 4, 5, 6, 7.

And he showed me Joshua the high priest, standing before the Angel of the
Lord; and Satan standing on his right hand, to resist him. And the Angel said
unto Satan, The Lord rebuke thee, O Satan; even the Lord, who has chosen, etc.
Zech. 3. 1, 2.

Jesus, etc. in the wilderness, to be tempted of the devil. When he had fasted,
etc. the tempter came to him: He said, If thou be the Son of God, command that
these stones be made bread. But he answered, and said, It is written, etc. Then
the devil takes him, etc. and sets him on a pinnacle of the temple, and
says unto him, If thou be the Son of God, cast thy self down: For it is
written, He shall give his Angels charge, etc. Jesus said, It is written again,
etc. The devil, etc. shows him all the kingdoms of the world, and the glory of
them; and says unto him, All these things will I give thee, if thou will fall
down and worship me, etc. Get thee hence, Satan; for it is written, Thou shall
worship the Lord thy God; and him only shall thou serve, Matthew. 4. 1, to 12.

When Jesus was come on the other side, etc. there met him two possessed with
devils, etc. they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus, thou
Son of God? Art thou come hither to torment us before our time? etc. So the
devils besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer us to go away into the
herd of swine. And he said unto them, Go, etc. The whole city came out, and
besought him, that he would depart out of their coasts, Matthew. 8. 28, to 35.
Mark 5. 2, 3, 4, 5, etc. Luke 8. 27, 28, etc.

When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walks through dry places,
seeking rest, and finding none. Then he says, I will return to my house, from
whence I came out: And when he is come, he finds it empty, swept and
garnished. then goes he, and takes with him seven other spirits, more wicked
than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last state of that
man is worse, etc. Matthew. 12. 43, 44, 45.

When any one hears the word, etc. and understands it not; then comes the
wicked one, and, etc. The tares are, the children of the wicked one: the enemy
who sowed them, is the devil, Matthew. 13. 10, 38, 39.

Jesus rebuked the devil, and he departed out of him, and the child was cured,
etc. Howbeit, this kind goes not out, but by prayer and fasting, Matthew. 17.
18, 21.

Christ suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him, Mark 1. 34.

Lord, even the devils are subject to us, through thy name. And he said unto
them, I beheld Satan, as lightning, fall from heaven, Luke 10. 17, 18.

And he was casting out a devil, etc. Some of them said, He casts out devils
by Beelzebub, the chief of the devils, etc. If Satan also be divided against
himself, how shall his kingdom stand? etc. If I by Beelzebub cast out devils,
by whom do your children cast them out? Luke 11. 14, 15, 17, to 21. Mark 3. 22,
23.

Ought not this woman, etc. whom Satan has bound, etc. be loosed? etc. Luke
13. 16.

Simon, Simon; behold, Satan has desired you, that he may ^ift you as wheat:
but I have prayed for thee, that thy faith fail not, Luke 22. 31, 32.

Ye are of your father, the devil; and the lusts of your father ye wi^^ do. He
was a (...) from the beginning, and abode not in the truth, because there is no
truth in him: when he speaks of a lie, he speaks of his own; for he is a
liar, and the father of it, John 8. 44.

The devil having now put it into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to
betray, etc. After Jesus had given the sop to Judas, satan entered into^ him,
John 13, 2, 26, 27. Luke 22. 3.

The prince of this world comes, and has nothing in me, John 14. 30.

When the Spirit is come, etc. he will reprove ( or, convince) the world of,
etc. of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged, John 16. 8, 9, 11.

I pray, etc. that thou should keep them from the evil one, John 17. 15.

Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled thine heart, to lie to the Holy
Ghost? Acts 5. 3.

And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly, Romans 16. 20.

Then come together again, lest Satan tempt you for your incontinency, etc. 1
Cor. 7. 5.

Confirm your love toward him, etc. left Satan should get an advantage of us:
for we are not ignorant of his devices, 2 Cor. 2. 7, to 12,

If our gospel be hid, it is hid to them who are lost; in whom the god of this
world has blinded the mind of them who believe not, le^t the light or the
glorious gospel, etc. 2 Cor. 4. 3, 4.

But I fear le^t by any means, as the serpent be guiled Eve through his
subtilty, so your mind should be corrupted, etc. No marvel; for Satan himself
is transformed into an Angel of light, 2 Cor. 11. 3, 14. Acts 13. 10.

There was given me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan, to buffet me, 2
Cor. 12. 7.

Ye walked, etc. according to the prince of the power of the air, the spirit
that now works in the children of disobedience, Ephesians. 2. 2.

Let not the sun go down upon your wrath, neither give place to the devil,
Ephesians. 4. 26, 27.

Put on the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles
of the dev^^: for we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against
principalities and powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this world,
against spiritual wickednesses ( or, wicked spirits) in high places: Wherefore
take unto you the whole armor, etc. above all things, the shield of faith;
whereby ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked one*
Ephesians. 6. 10, 11, 12, 13, 16.

We would have come unto you (even I Paul) once and again, but Satan hindered
us, 1 These. 2. ^8.

I sent to know your ^aith, lest by some means the tempter have tempted you. 1
These. 3. 5.

-- That wicked, etc. whose coming is after the working of Satan; with all
power, and sig^s, and lying wonders, 2 These. 2. 8, 9.

Lest being lifted up with pride, he fall into the condemnation of the devil, 1 Timothy 3. 6.

In meekness instruct, etc. that they may recover themselves out of the snare
of the devil, who are taken captive ( or, alive) by him at his will, 2 Timothy 2.
25, 26.

Through death he might destroy death, and him who had the power of death, even
the devil, Heb. 2. 14.

Resist the devil, and he will flee from you, Jam. 4. 7.

Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the devil, as a roaring lion,
walks about, seeking whom he may devour: whom resist, steadfast in the faith,
knowing that the same afflictions are accomplished, etc. 1 Pet. 5. 8, 9.

I write unto you, young men; because ye have overcome the wicked one, 1 John
2. 13, 14. chapter 5. 18. 2 These. 3. 3.

He who commits sin, is of the devil; for the devil sins from the
beginning. For this purpose the Son of God was manifest, that he might destroy
the works of the devil: not as Cain, who was of that wicked one, and slew his
brother, 1 John 3. 8, 12.

The Angels who kept not their first state ( or, principalities) he has
reserved in everlasting chains. The A^changel, when contending with the devil
about the body of Moses, durst not bring against him a railing accusation; but
said, The Lord rebuke thee, Jude, verse. 6, 9.

The devil shall cast some of you into prison, etc. Thou dwell where Satan's
seat is, Rev. 2. 10, 13.

-- Them of the synagogue of Satan, etc. Rev. 3. 9.

The angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in the Hebrew, etc. is Abaddon; in
Greek, Apollyon, Rev. 9. 11.

There was War in heaven; Michael and his Angels fought against the dragon,
etc. and the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and
Satan, who deceives the whole world; he was cast out into the earth, and his
angels, etc. with him, etc. The accuser of the brethren is cast down, who
accused them before our God, day and night, etc. Woe unto the inhabiters of the
earth, etc. for the devil is come down unto you, having, etc. Rev. 2. 7, to 13.

Three unclean spirits came out of the mouth of the dragon, etc. the spirits of
devils, working miracles, etc. Rev. 16. 13, 14.

Satan laid hold on, bound, cast into the pit, and sealed up from deceiving,
etc. let loose again, Rev. 20.

Secondly, The Instruments of Satan; Seducers, Deceivers, etc. Saints Duty.
WHen a prophet speaks in the name of the Lord, if the thing follow not etc.
the Lord has not spoken, etc. Deuteronomy. 18. 22.

The devil was a lying spirit in the prophets, to deceive Ahab, 1 Kings 22. 19,
20, 23. Ezekiel. 12. 9.

The prophets prophecy lies in my name; I sent them not, neither have I
commanded them, neither spoke unto them: they prophecy unto you a false vision
and divination, and a thing of naught, and the deceit of their heart, Jer. 14.
14, 15.

Beware of false propets, who come to you in she^p's clothing; but inwardly
they are ravening wolves: ye shall know them by their fruits, etc. We have
prophesied in thy name, cast out devils, and done many wonderful works, Matthew.
7. 15, 16, 22, 23.

Take heed, etc. of the leaven of the Pharisees, etc. of the doctrine of the
Pharisees, etc. Matthew. 16. 6, 11, 12.

Take heed that no man deceive you: for many shall come in my name, and say, I
am Christ; and shall deceive many, etc. Many false prophets shall arise, and
deceive many, etc. Then if any shall say unto you, Lo, here is Christ, or there
is Christ, believe it not: for there shall arise false Christ's, and false
prophets, and shall show great signs and wonders; insomuch that (if it were
possible) they should deceive the very elect. Behold, I have told you before:
wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert, etc. go not
forth, etc. For as the lightning comes out of the east, etc. so shall also the
coming of the Son of man, etc. Matthew. 24. 4, 5, 11, 23, to 28.

-- Ye received me not: If another shall come in his own name, him ye will
receive, John 5. 43.

Elymas, etc. seeking to turn away the Deputy from the faith, etc. Paul, etc.
said, O full of subtilty, and all mischief! thou child of the devil; thou enemy
of all righteousness: will thou not cease to pervert the right ways of the
Lord? etc. Acts 13. 7, to 12.

Certain, etc. have troubled you with words, subverting your souls, saying,
etc. Acts 15. 1, 24.

After my departure shall grievous wolves enter in among you, not sparing the
flock: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to
draw away disciples after them: therefore watch, Acts 20. 28, to 32.

The Sadduces say, that there is no resurrection, nor angels, nor spirit, Acts
23. 8, 9.

Mark them who cause divisions, etc. contrary to the doctrine, etc. and avoid
them: for they who are such, serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own
belly; and by good words, and fair speeches, deceive the hearts of the simple,
Romans 16. 17, 18.

There must be also herenes among you, that they who are approved, might be
made, etc. 1 Cor. 11. 19.

How say some among you, That there is no resurrection from the dead? 1 Cor.
15. 12.

We are not as many, who corrupt the word of God, etc. 2 Cor. 2. 17.

Them who desire occasion, etc. for such are false Apostles, deceitful workers;
transforming themselves into the Apostles of Christ, etc. Satan himself is
transformed into an Angel of light: therefore it is no great thing if his
ministers be transformed into the ministers of righteousness; whose ends shall
be according to their works, etc. Ye suffer fools gladly, etc. ye suffer if a
man bring you into bondage: if a man devour, if a man take, if a man exalt
himself, etc. smite you on the face, 2 Cor. 11. 12, 13, 14, 15, 19, 20.

There be some who trouble you, and would pervert the Gospel of Christ: Though
we, or an Angel from heaven, preach any other Gospel unto you, than that we
have preached unto you, let him be accursed: As we have before, so say I now
again, If any man preach any other Gospel unto you, than that ye have received,
let him be accursed, Gal. 1. 7, 8, 9.

False brethren, who came in privily to spy out our liberty, etc. that they
might bring us into bondage; to whom we gave place by subjection, no not for an
hour, that the truth of the Gospel may continue with you: but of these who seem
to be, etc. Gal. 2. 3, 4, 5, 6.

They zealously affect you, but not well: yea, they would exclude you, that you
might affect them, Gal. 4. 17.

As many as desire to make a fair show in the flesh, they constrain you to be
circumcised, only left they should suffer persecution for the cross of Christ:
for neither they themselves that are circumcised keep the law; but desire to
have you circumcised, that they may glory in your flesh, Gal. 6. 12, 13.
Philip. 3. 2.

Be no more children, tossed, etc. with every wind of doctrine, by the sleight of men, and cunning craftiness, whereby they lie in wait to deceive, Ephesians. 4.
14.

This I say, lest any should beguile you with enticing words, etc. Beware, lest
any one spoil you through philosophy, and vain deceits, after the traditions of
men, after the rudiments of this world, and not after Christ, etc. Let no man
judge you in meat, ( or, for eating,) etc. intruding into those things which he
has not seen, etc. and not holding the head, etc. Why are ye subject to
ordinances? etc. Touch not, etc. Col. 2, 4, 8, 16, to 24.

Let no man deceive you by any means, etc. That man of sin, etc. who opposes
and exalts himself above all that is called God, or that is worshipped: so
that he, as God, sits in the temple of God, showing himself that he is God,
etc. Then shall that wicked one be revealed, whom the Lord shall consume with
the spirit of his mouth, and destroy with the brightness of his coming; whose
coming is after the working of Satan, with all power, and signs, and lying
wonders, and with all deceivableness of unrighteousness in them who perish:
Because they received not the love of the truth, etc. for this cause God shall
send them strong delusions, that they should believe a lie; that they all might
be damned, etc. 2 These. 2. 2, 3, 4, 8, to 13. Rev. 13. 13, 14.

Charge some, that they teach no other doctrine; neither give heed to Jewish
fables, etc. Some have swerved, having turned aside to vain janglings, desiring
to be teachers of the law, understanding neither what they say, nor whereof
they affirm, 1 Timothy 1. 3, 4, 6, 7, 8.

Now the Spirit speaks expressly, that in the latter days some shall depart
from the faith, giving heed to seducing spirits, and doctrines of devils;
speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their consciences ^eared with a hot iron:
forbidding to marry, and commanding to abstain from meats, etc. 1 Timothy 4. 1, 2,
3.

If any man teach otherwise, etc. he is proud, knowing nothing; but doting (
or, sick) about questions and strifes of words, whereof comes envy; etc.
perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds, and destitute of the truth;
supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw thy self. Some, etc. have
erred, 1 Timothy 6. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 20, 21.

Strive not about words to no profit, to the subverting of the hearers, etc.
Shun profane and vain babbling, for they will increase to more ungodliness; and
their word will eat, as does a canker, ( or, gangrene:) Of whom is Hymeneus,
etc. Who, concerning the truth, have erred; saying, That the resurrection is
past already; and overthrow the faith of some: nevertheless, the foundation of
God stands sure, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 14, 16, 17, 18, 19.

Perilous times shall come; for men shall be lovers of their own selves,
covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful,
unholy, without natural affection, truce breakers, false accusers, incontinent,
fierce, despisers of those who are good, traitors, heady, high-minded, lovers
of pleasures more than lovers of God; having a form of godliness, but denying
the power thereof: from such turn away; for of this sort are they who creep
into houses, and lead captive silly women; laden with sins, led away with
diverse lusts, ever learning, and never coming to the knowledge of the truth.
Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth
men of corrupt minds, reprobate ( or, of no judgment) concerning the faith,
etc. But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse; deceiving and being
deceived: but continue thou in the things, etc. 2 Timothy 3. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,
8, 13, 14.

The time will come, when they will not endure found doctrine; but after their
own lusts, shall they heap up to themselves teachers; having itching ears: and
they shall turn away their ears from truth, and shall be turned unto fables:
But watch thou, etc. 2 Timothy 4. 3, 4, 5.

A bishop must be blameless, etc. holding fast the faithful word, as he has
been taught, ( or, in teaching;) that he may be able by found doctrine, both to
exhort and convince the gainsayers: for there are many unruly and vain talkers
and deceivers, especially they of the circumcision; whose mouths must be
stopped, who subvert whole houses; teaching things which they ought not, for
filthy lucre sake, and. Rebuke them sharply, etc. not giving heed to Jewish
fables, and commandments of men, who turn from the truth, etc. They profess
that they know God, but in works they deny him; being, etc. Titus 1. 7, 9, 10,
11, 13, 14, 16.

Be not carried about with diverse and strange dectrines: for it is a good
thing, that the heart, etc. Heb. 13. 9.

But there were false prophets also among the people, even as there shall be
falie teachers among you, who privily shall bring in damnable heresies, even
denying the Lord, who bought them, and bring upon themselves swift destruction:
and many shall follow their pernicious ways; by reason of whom, the way of
truth shall be evil spoken of: and through covetousness shall they, with
seigned words, make merchandise of you; whose judgment now of a long time
lingreth not, etc. Chiefly them who walk after the flesh, etc. and despise
government, ( or, dominions,) presumptuous, selfwilled: they are not afraid to
speak evil of digninities, etc. These are as natural brute beasts, etc. speak
evil of the things they understand not, etc. sporting themselves with their own
deceivings, while they feast with you; having eyes full of adultery, who cannot
cease from sin; beguiling unstable souls: an heart which is exercised with
covetous practices, etc. who have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray,
etc. These are wells without water, clouds which are carried with a tempest, to
whom the midst of darkness is reserved for ever: for when they speak great
swelling words of vanity, they allure through the lusts of the flesh, etc.
those who were clean escaped from them; who live in error, while they promise
them, etc. 2 Pet. 2. 1, 2, 3, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 18, 19.

There shall come in the last days scossers, walking after their own lusts; and
saying, Where is the promise of his coming? for since the fathers fell asleep,
all things continue as they were from the beginning, etc. Some things are hard
to be understood; which they who are unlearned, and unstable, wrest, as they do
also the other scriptures, to their own destruction. Ye therefore, beloved,
seeing ye know before; beware, lest ye also, being led away with the error of
the wicked, fall from your own stedfastness, 2 Pet. 3. 3, 4, 15, 16, 17.

Little children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard Antichrist shall
come, even now are there many Antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last
time: They went out from us, but they were not of us, etc. Who is a liar, but
he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? He is Antichrist, who denies the
Father, and the Son, etc. These things have I written unto you, concerning them
who deceive you, 1 John 2. 18, 19, 22, 26.

Believe not every spirit; but try the spirits, whether they are of God;
because many false prophets are gone out into the world: Hereby know ye the
spirit of God; every spirit who confesses Jesus Christ to have been come in
the flesh is of God: and every spirit who confesses not that Jesus Christ is
come in the flesh, is not of God: and this is that spirit of Antichrist,
whereof you have heard that it should come; and even now already it is in the
world, etc. Ye are of God, and have overcome them; because greater is he who is
in you, than he in the world. They are of the world, therefore speak they of
the world, and the world heare^^ them, etc. He who is of God, hears us: he
who is not of God, hears not us: Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the
spirit of er^our, etc. 1 John 4. 1, to 7.

Many deceivers are entered into the world, who confess not that Jesus Christ is
come in the flesh: this is a deceiver, and an Antichrist: look to your selves,
that we lose not those things which we wrought, etc. Whosoever transgresses,
and abides not in the doctrine of Christ, has not God, etc. If there come any
to you, and bring not this doctrine, receive him not into your house, neither
bid him God-speed; for he who bids him Godspeed, is partaker of his evil deeds,
2 John, verse. 7, to 12.

Earnestly contend for the faith which was once delivered unto the saints: for
there are certain men crept in unawares, who were before of old ordained to
this condemnation; ungodly men, turning the grace of God into lasciviousness,
and denying the only Lord God, and our Lord Jesus Christ, etc. These filthy
dreamers defile the flesh, despise dominions, and speak evil of dignities: yet
Michael, etc. contending with the devil, etc. durst not bring against him a
railing accusation, etc. These speak evil of those things which they know not,
etc. Clouds they are, without water, etc. These are murmurers, complainers,
walking after their own lusts, and their mouth speaks great swelling words;
having men's persons in admiration, because of advantage, etc. These be they
who separate themselves, sensual, having not the spirit, Jude, verse. 3. 4, 8,
9, 10, 12, 13, 16, 18, 19.

I know the blasphemy of them who say they are Jews, and are not; but are the
synagogue of Satan, etc. hold the doctrine of Balaam, etc. So the doctrine of
the Nicolaitans, etc. Thou suffer that woman Jezebel, who, etc. to teach and
seduce my servants, etc. Rev. 2. 9, 14, 15, 20. chap. 3. 9.

All who dwell on earth, whose names are not written in the book of life, etc.

Of the Thoughts, Mind, and Affections.
AND God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every

his thoughts are, there is no God,) Psalm. 10. 4.

Thou thoughtest that I was altogether such a one as thy ^elt, etc. Psalm. 50.
21.

CHAP. XXXIII.
Of Repentance in General; wherein God cannot Repent; and wherein, or how, he
is said to Repent. Repentance in Man, and his turning to God from Sin, and in
such who have back-slidden from following God; and otherwise.
First, Wherein God cannot Repent; and wherein, or how, he is said to Repent.

AND God saw that the wickedness of man was great, etc. and it repented the
Lord that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart, Genesis
6. 5, 6.

Moses prayed and said, etc. Turn from thy fierce wrath, and repent of this
evil against thy people, etc. and the Lord repented of the evil which he
thought to do, Exodus 32. 11, 12, 14.

Ye shall bear your iniquities, etc. and ye shall know my breach of promise (
or, altering of my purpose), Numb. 14. 34.

God is not a man that he should lie, neither the son of man that he should

make it good? Number. 23. 19. 1 Samuel 15. 29. Heb. 6. 18. Titus 1. 2.

The Lord shall, etc. repent himself for his servants, when he sees that power
is gone, and there, etc. Deuteronomy. 32. 36.

It repented the Lord, because of their groanings, by reason of them who
oppressed them, Judges 2. 18.

It repents me that I have set up Saul to be king, for he is turned back,

man that he shoul repent, 1 Samuel 15. 11, 28, 29, 35.

They have humbled themselves, I will not destroy them, but will grant them
some deliverance, 2 Chronicles. 12. 7. 1 Kings 21. 27, 29.

Return, O Lord, how long! and let it repent thee concerning thy servants,
Psalm. 90. 13.

He remembered, etc. and repented according to the multitude of his mercies,

The Lord will judge his people, and repent himself concerning his servants,
Psalm. 135. 14.

For this shall the earth mourn, etc. because I have spoken, I have purposed,
and will not repent, neither will I turn back from it, etc. Jer. 4. 28.

I will, etc. destroy thee. I am weary with repentings, Jer. 15. 6.

Amend your ways etc. and the Lord will repent him of the evil which he has
pronounced against you, etc. And the Lord repented him of the evil which, etc.
Jer. 26. 3, 13, 19. chapter 18. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11.

I will plant you, etc. for I repent me of the evil I have done unto you, Jer.

I the Lord have spoken, etc. I will not go back, neither will I spare, etc.

How shall I give thee up, Ephraim? etc. my heart is turned within me, my

O Grave, etc. repentance shall be hid from mine eyes, Hosea 13. 14.

I thought to punish you, etc. and I repented not: so again have I thought,

CHAP. XXXV.
Of the Resurrection of the Dead.
SO man lies down, and rises not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not
awake, Job 14. 12.

I know my redeemer lives, etc. and though after my skin worms destroy this
body, yet in my flesh shall I see God, whom I shall see for my felt: and mine
eyes shall behold, and not another, etc. Job. 19. 25, 26, 27. Psalm. 49. 15.

I shall be satisfied when I awake, with thy likeness, Psalm. 17. 15.

He will swallow up death in victory, etc. Isa. 25. 7, 8.

Thy dead men shall live, together with my dead body shall they arise: awake

earth shall cast out the dead, Isa. 26. 19.

And many who sleep in the dust of the earth, shall awake: some to everlasting
life, etc. Thou shall rest and stand in the lot at the end of the days, Dan.
12. 2, 13.

I will ransom them from the power of the grave: I will redeem them from death;
O death, I will be thy plagues: O grave, I will be thy destruction, Hosea 13.
14.

But as touching the resurrection from the dead, etc. I am the God of Abraham,
etc. God is not the God of the dead, but the God of the living, Matthew. 22. 31,
32. Luke 20. 35, 37, 38.

Many of the bodies of the saints did arise at the death of Christ, Matthew. 27.
52.

Thou shall be recompensed at the resurrection of the just, Luke 14. 14.

and shall come forth: they who have done good, unto the resurrection of life,
etc. John 5. 28, 29.

CHAP. XXXVIII.
Of Knowledge and Understanding in and about Divine Things, and of the Want
thereof: Ignorance about such things, and the Evil thereof.
WHen Abimelech had taken Sara, Abram's Wife, though in the Integrity of his
Heart, not knowing her to be Abram's Wife, because he had said she was his
Sister; yet God said unto him, Behold, thou art a dead man for the woman thou
have taken, for she is a man's wife, Genesis 20. 2, to 10.

Pharaoh said, Who is the Lord, that I should obey him? Exodus 5. 2.

And the Egyptians shall know that I am the Lord, when I stretch forth my hand
upon Egypt, and bring forth the children of Israel from among them, Exodus 7. 5.
Ezekiel. 6. 7, 10, 13. Exodus 14. 4, 18.

-- According to thy word, that thou may know that there is none like unto
the Lord, Exodus 8. 10.

I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I might show
these my signs, etc. that ye may know how that I am the Lord, Exodus 10. 1, 2.
Deuteronomy. 4. 35. Exodus 6. 7.

Jethro said, (when Moses had told him what God had done,) Now I know that the
Lord is greater than all gods: for in the thing wherein they dealt proudly, he,
etc. Exodus 18. 11. 2 Kings 5. 15.

Under the Law they were to offer Sacrifices for Sins of Ignorance, whether of
a Person, or of the Congregation, Levit. 4. 2, 3, 4, 13, 14, 15. chapter 5. 1, 2,
3, 4, 5, 6, 17, 18, 19. Numb. 15. 24, 25, 26.

Ye have seen all that the Lord did, etc. yet the Lord has not given you an
heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day, Deuteronomy. 20.
2, 4.

They sacrificed, etc. not to God, to gods whom they knew not: to new gods,
Deuteronomy. 32. 17.

There arose another generation, etc. who knew not the Lord, nor the works he
had done, etc. Judges 2. 10.

Sampson said to his father, Get her for me, etc. but his father and his mother
knew not that it was of the Lord, that he sought an occasion against the
Philistines, Judges 14. 3, 4.

The sons of Eli, wicked men, knew not the Lord, 1 Samuel 2. 12.

Now Samuel did not yet know the Lord: neither was the word of the Lord yet
revealed unto him, 1 Samuel 3. 7.

That all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel, etc. that the Lord
saves not by sword, etc. 1 Samuel 17. 46, 47.

Elijah prayed* that God would (by an extraordinary means) let it be known,
that thou art a God in Israel, etc. that this people may know, that thou art
the Lord God, 1 Kings 18. 36, 37, 38.

Because the Syrians have said, The Lord is God of the hills, but he is not God
of the Valleys: therefore will I deliver all this great multitude into thy
hands: and ye shall know that I am the Lord, 1 Kings 20. 28.

Solomon asked wisdom and knowledge, and God gave it: and riches also, 2 Chronicles.
1. 9, 10, 11, 12.

Nevertheless, they shall be his servants: that they may know my service, and
the service of the kingdoms of the Countries, 2 Chronicles. 12. 8.

God left Hezekiah to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart, 2 Chronicles. 32. 31.

Can thou by searching find out God? Carst thou find out the Almighty to
perfection? etc. Job 11. 7, 8, 12. chapter 37. 5. Eccles. 11. 5.

I have understanding as well as you, I am not inferior to you, Job 12. 3. chapter
13. 2.

Lo these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? Job.
26. 14.

There is a spirit in man, and the inspiration of the Almighty gives them
understanding; great men are not always wise, neither do the aged understand
judgment, Job 32. 8, 9. chapter 38. 36.

I uttered that I understood not, things too wonderful for me which I knew not:
I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear, but now mine eye sees thee:
wherefore I abhor my self, etc. Job 42. 5, 6.

They who know thy name, will put their trust in thee, etc. The Lord is known
by the judgments he executes, Psalm. 9. 10, 16.

Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge, who eat up my people? etc.
Psalm. 14. 4. Psalm. 53. 4.

The heavens declare the glory of God, and the firmament show his handy work:
day unto day utters speech: and night unto night teaches knowledge, etc. The
testimonies of the Lord are sure, making wise the simple, etc. The commandments
of the Lord is pure, inlightning the eyes, Psalm. 19. 1, 2, 3, 4, 7, 8.

Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted, etc. Psalm. 46. 10.

Consume them, etc. and let them know that God rules in Jacob, unto the ends
of the earth^ Selah. Psalm. 59. 13. Ps. 99. 10.

When I thought to know this, it was too painful for me, until I went into the
Sanctuary of God: then understood I their end, etc. so foolish and ignorant was
I: I was as a beast before thee, Psalm. ^3. 16. 17, 22.

Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen who have not known thee, Psalm. 79. 6.

They know not, neither will they understand: they walk on in darkness, Psalm.
82. 5.

Let them be confounded, etc. that they may know that thou whose name alone is
Jehovah, art the most high over all the earth, Psalm. 83. 18.

Understand, O ye brutish among the people, and fools: when will ye be wise? He
who planted the ear, shall he not hear? etc. Psalm. 94. 7, 8, 9, 10, 11.

It is a people who do err in their hearts: and they have not known my ways,
Psalm. 95. 10.

Whosoever is wise and will observe these things: even they shall understand the
loving kindness of the Lord, Psalm. 107. 43.

For I know that the Lord is great: and our Lord above all gods, Psalm. 135. 5.

Cause me to know the way wherein I should walk, Psalm. 143. 8. Ps. 146. 8.

He showed his word unto Jacob, etc. He has not dealt so with any nation: and
as for his judgments, they have not known them, Ps. 147. 19, 20.

A wise man will hear and increase learning, a man of understanding shall
attain unto wise counsels, etc. How long ye simple ones will ye love
simplicity? etc. and fools hate knowledge, etc. they shall call upon me, but I
will not answer? etc. for that they hated knowledge, and did not choose the fear
of the Lord, Prove. 1. 5, 7, 22, 28, 29.

Apply thine heart to understanding: yea, if thou cryest after knowledge, etc.
if thou seek her as silver, etc. then shall thou understand the fear of the
Lord, etc. for the Lord gives wisdom, etc. understanding shall keep thee,
Prove. 2. 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 10, 11. chapter 4. 7.

Happy is the man who finds wisdom, and the man who gets understanding:
for the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, Prove. 3.
13, 14. chapter 8. 5, 6, 11. chapter 16. 16. Job 28. 12, 15, 16, 17, etc.

I beheld, etc. a young man void of understanding: passing through the street,
etc. Prove. 7. 7, 8, etc.

The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom: the knowledge of the Holy,
understanding, Prove. 9. 10.

Wise men lay up knowledge, Prove. 10. 14.

The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way, Prove. 14. 8.

Evil men understand not judgment; but they who seek the Lord, understand all
things, Prove. 28. 5.

Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a
man, Prove. 30. 2.

Tell me, O thou whom my soul loves, where the feedest, etc. if thou know not,
O thou fairest, etc. go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, Cant. 1.
7, 8.

The ox knows his owner, and the ass his master's crib: Israel does not know,
my people does not consider, Isa. 1. 3.

Therefore my people are gone into captivity, because they have no knowledge,
Isa. 5. 13.

Hear ye indeed, but understand not: and see ye indeed, but perceive not, etc.
make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes: lest they see, etc. and understand,
Isa. 6. 9, 10. Mat. 13. 13, 14.

The earth shall be full of the knowledge of the Lord, as the waters cover the
sea, Isa. 11. 9. Habak. 2. 14.

The Egyptians shall know the Lord in that day, and shall do sacrifice, etc.
Isa. 19. 21.

It is a people of no understanding: therefore he who made them, will not have
mercy on them, Isa. 27. 11.

The Lord has poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep: and has closed
your eyes, etc. and the vision of all is become unto you as the words of a book
sealed, etc. therefore, etc. The wisdom of their wise men shall perish: and the
understanding of their prudent men shall be hid, etc. In that day shall the
eyes of the blind see out of obscurity, etc. They who erred in spirit, shall
come to understanding, etc, Isa. 29. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 18, 24.

Save us, etc. that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the
Lord, etc. Isa. 37. 20.

Have ye not known? etc. it is he who ^tteth upon the circle of the earth, Isa.
40. 21, 22.

That they may know and consider, and understand together: that the hand of the
Lord, etc. Isa. 41. 20.

I will bring the blind by a way they knew not, etc. in paths they have not
known, Isa. 42. 16.

They have not known, nor understood: for he has shut their eyes, and they
cannot see; and their hearts, and they cannot understand, etc. neither is there
knowledge or understanding to say, I have (...) part of it, etc. Isa. 44. 18,
19.

Nations, etc. which knew not thee, shall run unto thee, because of the Lord,
etc. Isa. 55. 5.

They who handle the law, knew me not, Jer. 2. 8.

I will give you Pastors, etc. who shall feed you with knowledge and
understanding, Jer. 3. 15.

My people is foolish, they have not known me: they are (...) children, they
have no understanding: they are wise to do evil, but to do good they have no
knowledge, Jer. 4. 22. chapter 8. 7. chapter 9. 3, 6. chapter 5. 21. H^sea 5. 4.

Let him who glories, glory in this, that he understands and knows me, that

9. 24.

I will give them an heart to know me, that I am the Lord, Jer. 24. 7. Hosea 2.
20.

And they shall teach no more every man his neighbor, and every man his

All the remnant, etc. shall know whose words shall stand, mine or theirs, Jer.
44. 28. Ezekiel. 6. 10.

I will set my glory among the heathen: so the house of Israel shall know that

caused them to be led into captivity, Ezekiel. 39. 21, 22, 23, 27, 28. chapter 38. 23.
Jer. 16. 21.

To the intent that the living may know that the most High rules, etc. They

But the people who do know their God, shall be strong, and do, etc. and they

Many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased, etc. And none of

For she did not know that I gave her corn, and wine, and oil, etc. Hosea 2. 8.

The Lord has a controversy, etc. because there is no truth nor mercy, nor

Then shall we know, if we follow on to know the Lord, etc. For I desire, etc.

I taught Ephraim to go, etc. but they knew not that I healed them, etc. Hosea

Who is wise? and he shall understand these things: prudent? and he shall know

The poor of the flock who waited on me, knew that it was the word of the Lord,

The Priests lips should preserve knowledge* Mal. 2. 7.

The light of the body is the eye, etc. If therefore the light that is in thee

No man knows the father but the son, and he to whom the son reveals him,

If ye had known what this means, I will have mercy, etc. ye would not have

Because it is given to you to know the mystery of the kingdom of heaven: but

If the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch, etc. Are ye

Ye do err, not knowing the Scriptures, nor the power of God, Mat. 22. 29.

The Gadarenes (through ignorance of Christ) besought him to depart from them,

Peter said, etc. Let us build three tabernacles, one for thee, etc. not

I thank thee, O father, etc. that thou have hid these things from the wise and

Woe unto you Lawyers: for ye have taken away the key of knowledge; ye e^tred

That servant who knew his Lord's will, and prepared not, neither did

48.

Jesus took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, etc. And they understood

Then opened he their understandings, that they might understand the

He was in the world, etc. and the world knew him not, John 1. 10, 26.

If thou knew the gift of God, and who it is that says to thee, Give me to

The Jews therefore strove among themselves, saying, How can this man give us

If any man will do his will, he shall know of the doctrine, whether it be of

I am the light of the world: he who follows me, shall not walk in darkness,

We know that God spoke unto Moses: as for this fellow, we know not from whence

He who walks in darkness, knows not whither he goes, John 12. 35.

All these things will they do unto you, etc. because they know not him who

As yet they knew not the Scripture, that he must rise again from (...) dead,

It is not for you to know the times and the seasons where, etc. Acts 1. 7.

Ye denied the Holy one, etc. and killed the Prince of life; and now brethren,

When they saw the boldness of Peter and John, and perceived that they were

They who dwell at Jerusalem, and their rulers: because they knew him not, nor

I found an altar with this inscription, To the unknown God: whom therefore ye

like unto gold, etc. and the times of this ignorance God winked at: but now
commands, etc. Acts 17. 23, 29, 30.

I verily thought with my self, that I ought to do many things contrary to the
name of Jesus, etc. Acts 26. 9.

That which may be known of God, is manifest, etc. for the invisible things of
him from the creation of the world are clearly seen, being understood by the
things which are made, even his eternal Power and Godhead; so that they are
without excuse: because when they knew God, they did not glorify him as God,
etc. Even as they did not like to retain God in their knowledge: God gave them
up, etc. Romans 1. 19, 20, 21, 28. Psalm. 19. 1, 2, etc.

-- Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness? etc. not knowing that the
goodness of God leads thee to repentance, etc. Thou art called a Jew, etc.
and k^^west his will, etc. Romans 2. 4, 18, 19.

The way of peace they have not known, etc. By the law is the knowledge of sin,
Romans 3. 17, 20. chapter 7. 7.

We glory also in tribulation: knowing that tribulation works patience, etc.
Romans 5. 3, 4.

They have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge: for they being
ignorant of God's righteousness, and going about to establish their own, etc.
have not submitted, etc. Romans 10. 2, 3.

I would not brethren, that ye should be ignorant in this mystery (lest ye
should be wise in your own conceits), that blindness in part is happened to
Israel, etc. O the depths of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of
God! how unsearchable are his judgments, and his ways past finding out? for who
has known the mind of the Lord? or who has been his counselor? Romans 11. 25,
33, 34.

That ye may prove what is that good and acceptable will of God, Romans 12. 2.

I my self also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of
goodness, and filled with all knowledge: able also to admomsh one another, Romans
15. 14.

The mystery which was kept secret since the world began, but now is made
manifest* and by the Scriptures of the Prophets according to the commandment of
the everlasting God, made known to all nations, Romans 16. 25, 26.

In every thing ye are enriched, etc. and in all knowledge, etc. The world by
wisdom knew not God, etc. 1 Cor. 1. 5, 21.

I determined not to know any thing among you, save Jesus Christ and him
crucified, etc. We speak the wisdom of God in a mystery, etc. which none of the
Princes of this world knew: for had they known it, they would not have
crucified the Lord of glory, etc. God has revealed them unto us by his spirit,
etc. The things of God knows no man, but the spirit of God. Now we have
received the spirit which is of God, that we might know the things which are
freely given to us of God, etc. the natural man receives not the things of the
spirit of God, etc. neither can he know them, because they are spiritually
discerned, etc. Who has known the mind of the Lord? etc. but we have the mind
of Christ, 1 Cor. 2. 2, 7, 8. 10, 11, 12, 14, 16. Psalm. 92. 5, 6.

If any, etc. seems to be wise in this world: let him become a fool, that he
may be wise, 1 Cor. 3. 18.

Do ye not know that the Saints shall judge the world? etc. Know ye not? etc. 1
Cor. 6. 2, 3, 15.

We know that we all have knowledge: knowledge pusseth up, but charity
edisieth: and if any man thinks he knows any thing, he knows nothing yet
as he ought to know, etc. We know that an Idol is nothing, etc. howbe^t there
is not in every man that knowledge, 1 Cor. 8. 1, 2, 4, 7.

I would not that ye should be ignorant, how that all our fathers were under
the cloud, 1 Cor. 10. 1, 2.

To another the word of knowledge by the same spirit, 1 Cor. 12. 8.

Though I, etc. understand all mysteries, and all knowledge, etc. and have no
charity, I am nothing, etc. Whether there be knowledge, it shall vanish away:
for we know in part, etc. now we see through a glass darkly ( or, in a riddle),

I am known, 1 Cor. 13. 2, 8, 9, 10, 12. Job 8, 9.

If any man be ignorant, let him be ignorant, 1 Cor. 14. 38.

Some have not the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame, 1 Cor. 15. 34.

Lest Satan should get an advantage of us: for we are not ignorant of his

But their minds were blinded: for until this day remains the same vail

If our Gospel be hid, it is hid to them who are lost: in whom the god of this
world has blinded the minds of them who believe not, lest the light of the

shine out of darkness, has shined in our hearts the light of the knowledge of

We know that if our earthly house, etc. Knowing therefore the terror of the

Therefore as ye abound in every thing, etc. in knowledge, 2 Cor. 8. 7.

He gave some Apostles, etc. till we all come into the unity of the faith, and

Not fashioning your selves according to the former lusts, in your ignorance,

With well-doing ye may put to silence the ignorance of foolish men, 1 Pet. 2.

Grace, etc. be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus

This they are willingly ignorant of, etc. Paul, etc. in all his Epistles, etc.

Hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments: he that says
