Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptations, etc. Matthew. 26. 41.

The last shall be first, and the first last; for many be called, but few
chosen, Matthew. 20. 16. chapter 22. 14.

Labor not for the meat which perishes, but for that meat which endures to
everlasting life, etc. John 6. 27.

There is a war in my members warring against the law of my mind, etc. Romans 7.
13. Gal. 5. 17.

Not sloathful in business, servent in spirit, serving the Lord, Romans 12. 11.

Be ye steadfast, etc. always abounding in the work of the Lord: forasmuch as
you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord, 1 Cor. 15. 58.

Wherefore we labor, that whether present or absent we may be accepted of him,
2 Cor. 5. 9, 10.

The weapons of our warfare are not carnal, but mighty through God, to the
pulling down of strong holds, casting down imaginations and every high thing
which exalts it self against the knowledge of God, and brings into captivity
every thought, to the obedience of Christ, 2 Cor. 10. 4, 5.

The flesh lusts against the spirit, etc. so that ye cannot do the things ye
would, Gal. 5. 17. Romans 7. 21, 23.

That ye may know etc. what is the exceeding greatness of his power, to usward
who believe, according to the w^^king of his mighty power which he wrought in
Christ when he raised him from the dead, and set him at his own right hand,
etc. Ephesians. 1. 18, 19, 20.

See that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise, redeeming the time,
etc. Ephesians. 5. 15, 16.

Put on the whole armor of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles
of the devil. For we wrestle not against flesh and blood, but against
principalities and against powers, against the rulers of the darkness of this
world, against spiritual wickedness in high places, ( or, against wicked
Spirits) etc. That ye may be able to withstand in the evil day; and having done
( or, overcome) all, to stand, Ephesians 6. 11, 12, 13.

Work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, Phil. 2. 12.

I reach forth, etc. I press toward the mark, Phil. 3. 13, 14.

We pray always for you, that our God would, etc. fulfill all the good pleasure
of his goodness, and the work of faith with power, 2 These. 1. 11.

Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold of eternal li^e, 1 Timothy 6. 12. 2 Timothy
4. 7, 8.

Then therefore endure hardship as a good soldier of Jesus Christ: no man who
warreth entangleth himself with affairs of life, etc. 2 Timothy 2. 3, 4.

Let us labor therefore to enter into that rest, lest any man fall after the
same example of unbelief, Heb. 4. 11.

That ye be not sloathful, but followers of them who through faith and
patience, etc. Heb. 6. 12.

Let us run with patience the race which is set before us, etc. consider him
who endures such contiadiction of sinners against himself, lest ye be weary
and faint in your mind. Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, striving against
sin, etc. Heb. 12. 1, 3, 4.

Resist the Devil, and he will flee from you, Janus 4. 7.

An inheritance, etc. reserved for you ( or, us) who are kept by the power of
God through faith to salvation, 1 Pet. 1. 4, 5.

If the righteous scarcely be saved, where shall the ungodly? etc. 1 Pet. 4. 18.

Be sober, be vigilant; because your adversary the Devil, as a roaring lion,
walks about, seeking whom he may devour, whom resist steadfast in the faith,
etc. 2 Pet. 5. 8, 9.

Having all diligence, add to your faith virtue, etc. Giving all diligence to
make your calling and election sure, 2 Pet. 1. 5, 10.

Wherefore (beloved) seeing ye look for such things, be diligent, that ye may
be found of him in peace, without spot or blemish, 2 Pet. 3. 14.

Blessed are the dead, etc. they rest from their labors, and their works
follow them, Rev. 14. 13.

See Watching, Chap. 16.

See God's doing in and for the Saints, Chap. 20.

CHAP. XLVII.
Of Time, or Opportunity.
AND the Lord said, My Spirit shall not always strive with man, for he is also
flesh; but his days shall be an hundred and twenty years, etc. Genesis 6. 3.

For this shall every one who is godly pray unto thee in a time when thou may
be found ( or, in a time of finding,) Psalm 32. 6.

When God speaks, and men will not hearken, then, though they cry to him, he
will not hear, Prove. 1. 22, etc. Zech. 7. 13.

Boast not thy self of to morrow, for thou know not what a day may bring
forth, Prove. 27. 1.

To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the Sun; a
time to be born, and a time to die, etc. He has made every thing beautiful in
its time, Eccles. 3. 1, 2, etc.

A wise man's heart discerns both time and judgment; because to every purpose
there is time, etc. Ecces. 8. 5, 6.

Whatsoever thine hand finds to do, do it with thy might; for, no work, nor
device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom in the grave whither thou go, Eccles. 9.
10. John 9. 4.

Remember now thy Creator in the days of thy youth, before the evil day, etc.
Eccles. 12. 1.

Seek ye the Lord while he may be sound, call ye upon him while he is near,
Isa. 55. 6.

Break up your fallow ground, for it is time to seek the Lord till he come, etc.
Hosea 10. 12.

Agree with thine adversary quickly, while thou art in the way with him, lest
at any time the adversary deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee
to the officer, and thou be cast into prison. Verily I say unto thee, Thou
shall by no means come out till thou have paid the utmost farthing, Matthew. 5.
25, 26.

The foolish Virgins neglected getting Oil, till the door was shut against
them: And those who had talents did not use them, Matthew. 25. 5, 6, to the 29.

He comes and finds them sleeping, and says unto Peter, Simon, sleep
thou? could not thou watch one hour? Watch and pray, lest ye enter into
temptation, Mark 14. 37, 38.

The day will come when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of
man, and ye shall not see it, Luke 17. 22.

He beheld the city and wept over it, saying, If thou had known, even thou at
least in this thy day, the things that belong to thy peace; but now they are
hid from thine eyes; for the days come upon thee, that thine enemies shall cast
a trench about thee, etc. Luke 19. 41, 42, 43. Matthew. 23. 37, 38.

A little while is the light with you: walk while ye have the light, left
darkness come upon you, John 12. 35.

God, etc. has of one blood, made all nations of men, etc. and has determined
the times before appointed, and the bounds of their habitation: that they
should seek the Lord, if happily they might seek after him, etc. In the time of
ignorance God winked, etc. but now he commands all men to repent, Acts 17.
24, 25, 26, 27.

And that knowing the time, that now it is high time to awake out of sleep: for
now, etc. the night is far spent, the day is at hand, let us therefore cast off
the works of darkness, etc. Romans 13. 11, 12.

This I say, brethren, the time is short, it remains, that both they that
have wives, be as though they had none, etc. 1 Cor. 7. 27.

Behold, now is the accepted time: Behold, now is the day of salvation, 2 Cor.
6. 2. Isa. 59. 8.

In due season we shall reap, if we faint not. As we have therefore opportunity
let us do good unto all men, especially unto them, etc. Gal. 6. 9, 10.

Awake thou who sleep, etc. redeeming the time, because the days are evil.
Wherefore be not unwise, but understand what the will of the Lord is, Ephesians. 5.
14, 16, 17. Coloss. 4. 5.

Wherefore, as the Holy Ghost says, to day if ye will hear his voice, harden
not your hearts, as in the day of provocation, etc. wherefore I was grieved,
etc. so I swear in my wrath, they shall not enter into my rest, Heb. 3. 7, 8,
9, 10, 11. Psalm 55. 7, 8. Heb. 4. 7.

Go to now ye who say, to day or to morrow we will go into such a city, and
continue there a year, and buy and sell, and get gain; whereas ye know not what
will be on the morrow: for what is our life? It is even a vapor, etc. For that
ye ought to say, If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this and that, James
4. 13, 14, 15.

If ye call on the Father, etc. pass the time of your sojourning here in fear,
1 Pet. 1. 17.

That he no longer should live the rest of his time in the flesh to the lust of
men, but to the will of God: For the time past of our lives may suffice us to
have wrought the will of the Gentiles, 1 Pet. 4. 2, 3.

I gave her space to repent of her fornication, and she repented not. Behold I
will cast her into a bed, etc. Rev. 2. 20, 21, 22.

And the Angel, etc. swear, etc. that there should be time no longer, Rev. 10.
5, 6.

The Devil is now come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knows he
has but a short time, Rev. 12. 12.

See Diligence in our Callings, Chap. 53.

See Death, Chap. 34.

See more in God's Threatenings and Judgments against Sinners, Chap. 16.

CHAP. XLVIII.
Signs of the last Times; or, End of the World.
MAny shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ, and deceive many, etc. And ye
shall hear of wars, etc. Because iniquity shall abound, the hope of many shall
wax cold. The Gospel of the Kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a
witness, etc. As the days of Noah was, so shall the coming of the Son of man
be, etc. They were eating, etc. Matthew. 24. 5, 6, 7, 12, 14, 37, 38.

That day shall not come, except there come a falling away first, and that man
of sin be revealed, 2 These 2. 1, 2, etc.

In the last days perilous times shall come, for men shall be lovers of their
own selves, etc. 2 Timothy 3. 1, 2, 3, 4.

Knowing this first, that in the last days there shall come scoffers walking
after their own lust, and saying, Where is the promise of his coming? etc. 2
Pet. 3. 3, 4, etc.

See Deceivers, Chap. 30.

CHAP. XLIX.
Encouragements to Hope in, and Cry to God, when our Case seems Desper ate and
Low.
MOses said unto the People, ye have sinned a great sin: and now I will go unto
the Lord; peradventure I shall make an atonement for your sin, Exodus 32. 30.

The Lord shall: epent himself for his servants, when he sees that power is
gone, etc. Deuteronomy. 32. 36.

Ye shall give glory unto the God of Israel: peradventure he will lighten his
hand from off you, and from off your gods, and from off your land, 1 Samuel 6. 5.

And Jonathan said, etc. Come and let us go over unto the garrison of these
uncircumcised, it may be that the Lord will work for us: for there is no
restraint to the Lord, to save by many or few, 1 Samuel 14. 6.

While the child was yet alive I fasted and wept: for I said, Who can tell
whether God will be gracious to me, that the child may live, 2 Samuel 12. 22.

Let him alone, and let him curse, etc. it may be the Lord will look on mine
affliction, and that the Lord will requite good for his curing this day, 2 Samuel
16. 12.

Why sit we hear until we die? If we enter into the city, then the famine is in
the city, and we shall die there, etc. Now therefore come let us sall into the
host of the Assyrians, if they save us, we shall live; if they kill us, we
shall but die, etc. 2 Kings 7. 3, 4, etc.

This day is a day of trouble, etc. it may be the Lord thy God will hear all
the words of Rabshakeh, etc. and will reprove the words which the Lord thy God
has heard. Wherefore lift up prayers for the remnant which are left, 2 Kings
19. 3, 4.

We have trespassed against our God, and have taken strange wives, etc. yet now
there is hope in Israel concerning this thing. Now therefore let us make a
covenant with our God to put away all the wives, etc. Ezra 10. 2, 3.

O my God, I cry in the day time, and thou hear not, etc. be not far from
me, etc. Psalm 22. 2, 3, to the 12.

It is good for a man that bears his yoke in his youth, etc. He puts his
mouth in the dust, if so be there be hope, Lam. 3. 27, 29.

Israel said, Our bones are dried, and our hope is lost; we are cut off for our
parts, etc. Thus says the Lord, Behold, O my people, I will open your graves,
and cause you to come up out of your graves, and bring you into the land of
Israel, Ezekiel. 37. 11, 12, 13.

O King, etc. break off thy sins by righteousness, etc. if it may be a
lengthening of thy tranquillity ( or, healing of thine error) Dan. 4. 27.

Rent your hearts, etc. who knows if he will return and repent, and leave a
blessing behind him, etc. Joel 2. 13, 14.

Hate the evil and love the good, and establish judgment in the gates; it may
be that the Lord God of hosts will be gracious unto the remnant of Joseph, Amos
5. 15.

The ship was like to be broken, etc. Jonah was gone down into the sides of the
ship, and he lay and was fast asleep; and the Ship-master came to him, and said
to him, etc. Arise, call upon thy God, if so be that God will think upon us,
tha^ we perish not, Jonah 1. 4, 5, 6.

Jonah (when in the Fish's belly) said, I am cass out of thy fight, yet will I
look again unto thy holy temple, etc. when my soul sainted within me, I
remembered the Lord, and my prayer came in unto thee into thine holy temple,
Jonah 2. 1, 2, 3, 4, 7.

Let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea,
let them turn every man from his evil way, etc. Who can tell, if God will turn
and repent, and turn away from his fierce anger, that we perish not? Jonah 3.
8, 9, 10.

Seek ye the Lord all ye meek, etc. It may be ye shall be hid in the day of the
Lord's anger, Zeph. 2. 3.

The Woman who had had the bloody Issue twelve years, and had spent much upon
Physicians to no purpose, came and touched Christ and was healed, Luke 8. 43,
44, 45, 46, 47, 48. John 5. 5, 6, 7, 8, 9.

The Woman of Canaan, though Christ answered her roughly, cried still and
prevailed, Mark 7. 26, 27, etc.

Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought
of thy heart may be forgiven thee, for I perceive thou art in the gall of
bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity, Acts 8. 22, 23.

In meekness instructing them who oppose themselves, if God peradventure will
give them repentance to the acknowledgement of the truth; and that they may
recover them out of the snare of the Devil, who are taken captive by him at his
will, 2 Timothy 2. 25, 26.

See Repentance, Chap. 33.

See Crying to God in time of Afflictions, Chap. 22.

See Salvations in such low Conditions, Ibid.

CHAP. L.
God takes notice of a little Good and Humblings in any, and requites it, and
commends it.
HE only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found
some good thing toward the Lord God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam, 1
Kings 14. 12, 13.

Ahab, etc. rent his clothes, and put sackcloth upon his flesh, etc. and went
softly, etc. See thou how Ahab humbles himself before me? because he
humbles himself before me, I will not bring the evil in his days, 1 Kings 21.
27, 28, 29.

Jehu commended and rewarded for his zeal, in executing the Judgments of God
upon Ahab's house, 2 Kings 10. 30.

Because thine heart was tender (says God to Josiah) and thou have humbled thy
self before the Lord, etc. and have rent thy clothes and have wept before me: I
also have heard, says the Lord. Behold therefore I will gather thee to thy
fathers, etc. in peace, and thine eyes shall not see all the evil which I will
bring upon this place, 2 Kings 22. 18, 19, 20.

When the Lord saw that Rehoboam and the princes humbled themselves, he said, I
will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance, etc. God would
not destroy him altogether, 2 Chronicles. 12. 6, 7, 12.

Thus says the Lord, I remember the kindness of thy youth, the love of thine
Espousals, when thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land which was
not sown, Jer. 2. 2.

Thus God did note and commend the good of the Churches in Asia, Rev. 2. 2, 3,
9, 13, 19. chapter 3. 4, 8, 10, 11.

CHAP. LI.
Of Vows and Promises to God.
JAcob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this
way, and will give me bread to eat, etc. then shall the Lord be my God, etc.
Genesis 28. 20, 21, 22. chapter 31. 13.

The Law for redemption of the things vowed, Levit. 17.

The Law about ^ows, where it binds and is to be kept, and where not, Numb. 30.

When thou shall vow to the Lord thy God, thou shall not slack to pay it: for
the Lord thy God will surely require it, and it would be sin in thee. But if
thou shall forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee. That which is gone out
of thy lips, a free wilt offering according as thou have vowed, etc. Deuteronomy. 23.
21, 22, 23. Eccles. 5. 4, 5.

Israel vowed a vow to the Lord, and said, If thou will indeed deliver this
people into my hand, then, etc. Numb. 21. 2, 3.

Jepthah's Vow, to dedicate to God whatever came out of his house to meet him
after his Victory his Daughter met him; he performed the Vow, Judges 11. 30,
31, 32.

Hannah vowed to give her Child unto the Lord; and she performed it, 1 Samuel 1.
11, 27, 28.

Offer to God thanksgiving: and pay thy vows unto the Most High, Psalm. 50. 14.

Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee, Psalm. 56. 12.

Thou, O God, have heard my vows: thou have given me the heritage, etc. So will
I sing praise unto thy name for ever, that I may daily perform my vows, Psalm.
61. 5, 8.

I will go into thy house with burnt-offerings: I will pay thee my vows, which
my lips have uttered, etc. when I was in trouble, Psalm. 66. 13, 14.

Vow and pay unto the Lord your God, Psalm. 76. 11.

I will pay my Vows unto the Lord, now in the presence of all his people, Psalm.
116. 14.

It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is holy: and after vows, to
make enquiry, Prove. 20. 25.

When thou vowest unto God, defer not to pay, etc. Better thou should not
vow, than, etc. not perform, Eccles. 5. 4, 5.

God threatens Judah, for saying, they would perform their Vows which they had
made, to burn Incense to the Queen of Heaven, etc. Jer. 44. 25, 26, 27, etc.

I will pay that which I have vowed, Jonah 2, 9.

Paul having shorn his head at Cenchrea; for he had a Vow, Acts 18. 18.

We have four men who have a vow on them; them take, and purify thy self with
them, etc. And all may know, etc. that thou thy self also walk orderly, and
keep the law. Touching the Gentiles, we have written, and concluded, that
they observe no such thing, etc. Acts 21. 20, 21, 22, 23, 24, etc.

The Law about the Vows of a Daughter, in her Father's House: And of a married
Person, Numb. 30.

CHAP LII.
Of Blasphemy.
AND the Israelitish woman's son blasphemed the name of the Lord, and cursed;
and they brought him to Moses, etc. and they they put him in ward, that the
mind of the Lord might be showed unto them. And the Lord spoke unto Moses,
saying, Bring forth him who has cursed without the camp, and let all who heard
him lay their hands upon him, and let all the congregation stone him, etc.
Whosoever curses his God, shall bear his sin: and he who blasphemeth the name
of the Lord, shall be put to death, Levit. 24. 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 23.

Jezebel, King Ahab's Wife, commanded the Nobles to set up False Witnesses
against Naboth, to testify that he did blaspheme God and the King; and so
stone him to death: Which accordingly they did, 1 Kings 21. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12,
13. Acts 6. 11, 13.

Senacherib, King of Assyria, by his Servants, said, Who among all the gods,
etc. could deliver his people out of mine hand; that your God should be able to
deliver you out of mine hand? etc. No god of any nation or kingdom was able to
deliver, etc. how much less shall your God deliver you out of mine hands? And
his servants spoke yet more against the Lord God, etc. He wrote also a Letter,
to rail on the Lord God of Israel, and to speak against him, etc. And they
spoke against the God of Jerusalem, as against the gods of the people of the
earth, the work of the hands of men, 2 Chronicles. 32. 9, to 20.

The shame of my face has covered me, for the voice of him who reproacheth,
and blasphemeth, Psalm. 44. 16.

O God, how long shall the adversaries reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy
name for ever? etc. Remember this, the enemy has reproached, O Lord: and the
foolish people has blasphemed thy name, Psalm. 74. 10, 18, 22.

Render unto our neighbors sevenfold, etc. their reproach, wherewith they
have reproached thee, O Lord, Psalm. 79. 12.

What have I here, says the Lord, that my people is taken away for naught?
etc. and my name continually every day is blasphemed, Isa. 52. 5.

In this your fathers have blasphemed me, in that they have committed a
trespass against me when I had brought them into the land, etc. Then they saw
every high Hill, and all the thick trees; and then they offered sacrifices
there, etc. Ezekiel. 20. 27, 28.

Thou shall know that I am the Lord. I have heard all thy blasphemies, which
thou have spoken against the mountain of Israel, saying, They are laid
desolate, etc. Thus with your mouth you have boasted against me, and have
multiplied your words against me, etc. Ezekiel. 35. 12, 13.

When Christ had said to a man, Thy sins are forgiven thee, etc. certain
Scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth, etc. The Pharisees said,
He casts out devils by the prince of devils, Matthew. 9. 2, 3, 34. Luke 5. 21.

The Pharisees said, This fellow does not cast out devils, but by Beelzebub,
the prince of the devils, etc. Jesus said, etc. If I cast out devils by the
spirit of God, then the kingdom of God is come amongst you, etc. Wherefore I
say unto you, All manner of sin and blasphemy shall be forgiven unto men: but
the blaspemy against the Holy Ghost shall not be forgiven unto men. And
whosoever speaks a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but
whosoever shall speak a word against the Holy Ghost, it shall not be forgiven
him, neither in this world, neither in the world to come, Matthew. 12. 24, 28,
31, 32. Luke 12. 10.

Hereafter shall ye see the Son of man sitting on the right hand of Power, and
coming in the clouds of heaven. Then the high Priest rent his clothes, saying,
he has spoken blasphemy: what need have we of farther witnesses? behold now ye
have heard his blasphemy, Matthew. 26. 64, 65.

He who shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost, has never forgiveness, etc.
because they said, He has an unclean spirit, Mark 3. 29, 30.

From within, out of the heart of men, proceeds evil thoughts, blasphemes,
Mark 7. 21, 22.

They, etc. asked him, saying, Prophecy, who is i^ who smote thee? And many
other things blasphemously spoke they against him, Luke 22. 64, 65.

For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy: because that thou, being
a man, make thy self God, etc. Say ye of him whom the Father has sanctified,
and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God,
John 10. 33, 36.

They suborned men, who said, We have heard him speak blasphemous words against
Moses, and against God, Acts 6. 11, 13.

When Herod had spoken, etc. the people gave a shout, saying, It is the voice
of a God; not of a man. And immediately the Angel of God smote him, because he
gave not God the glory, etc. Acts 12. 21, 22, 23.

Paul testified to the Jews, that Jesus was the Christ. And when they opposed
themselves, and blasphemed, he, etc. said to them, Your blood be upon your
heads, etc. Acts 18. 5, 6. chapter 19. 9. chapter 13. 45.

I punished them often in every Synagogue, and compelled them to blaspheme, being
exceeding mad against them, etc. Acts 26. 11.

The name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles, through you, etc. Romans 2.
23, 24.

But now you also put off all these, anger, etc. blasphemy, etc. Colos. 3. 8.

Putting me into the Ministry, who before was a blasphemer, etc. Alexander,
whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme, 1 Timothy
1. 13, 20.

Servants, etc. count their own master worthy of all honor, that the name of
God, and his doctrine be not blasphemed, 1 Timothy 6. 1.

Men shall be lovers of their own selves, etc. blasphemers, etc. 2 Timothy 3. 2.

Discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that
the word of God be not blasphemed, Titus 2. 4, 5.

Do not rich men oppress you? etc. Do not they blaspheme that worthy name, by
the which ye are called, James 2. 6, 7.

They think, etc. strange, etc. blaspheming ( or speaking evil of) you, etc. 1
Pet. 4. 5.

I know the blasphemy of them, who say they are Jews, and are not; but the
synagogue of Satan, Rev. 2. 9.

I saw a beast, etc. and upon his head the names of blasphemy, etc. And there
was given to him a mouth speaking great things, and blasphemies, etc. And he
opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name, and his
tabernacle, and them who dwell in heaven, Rev. 13. 1, 5, 6.

And men were scorched with great heat, and blasphemed the name of God, who
has power over these pl gues: and they repented not, to give him glory, etc.
They gnawed their tongues for pain, and blasphemed the God of heaven because of
their pain, and their sores; and repented not of their deeds, etc. Men
blasphemed God, because of the plague of hail, etc. Rev. 16. 9, 10, 11, 21.

CHAP. LIII.
Israel's Murmurings against God and Moses, when God was in his Way of
Redeeming them.
WHen Moses and Aaron had been with Pharaoh, and Pharaoh had made their burden
heavier, they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way as they came forth from
Pharaoh; and they said unto them, The Lord look upon you, and judge; because
you have made our favor to be abhorred ( or, to stink) in the eyes of Pharaoh,
and in the eyes of his servants, to put a sword into their hands, to slay us,
Exodus 5. 1, 2, 6, 7, 20, 21.

When they were pursued by the Egyptians, they cried unto the Lord: and they
said unto Moses, Because there were no graves in Egypt, have thou taken us
away, to die in the wilderness? Wherefore have thou dealt thus with us, to
carry us forth out of Egypt? Is not this the word that we did tell thee in
Egypt, saying, Let us alone, that we may serve the Egyptians? For it had been
better for us to serve the Egyptians, than that we should die in the
wilderness, Exodus 14. 8, to 13.

They could not drink of the waters of Marah, for they were bitter, etc. And
the people murmured against Moses, saying, What shall we drink? Exodus 15. 23,
24.

And the whole congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses
and Aaron in the wilderness, and, etc. said unto them, Would to God we had died
by the hand of the Lord, in the land of Egypt, when we sat by the fleshpots,
when we did eat bread to the full: for ye have brought us forth into the
wilderness, to kill this whole congregation with hunger, etc. Ye shall see the
glory of the Lord, for that he hears your murmurings against the Lord: And
what are we, that ye murmur against us? etc. Your murmurings are not against
us, but against the Lord, Exodus 16. 2, 3, 7, 8, 12.

The people did chide with Moses, and said, Give us water, that we may drink.
And Moses said to them, Why chide you with me? wherefore do you tempt the Lord?
And the people thirsted there for water: and the people murmured against Moses,
and said, Wherefore is this, that thou have brought us up out of Egypt, to kill
us, and our children, and our cattle with thirst? etc. They tempted the Lord,
saying, Is the Lord among us, or not? Exodus 17. 2, 3, 7.

When the people complained, it displeased the Lord, and his anger was kindled,
and the fire of the Lord burnt, etc. And the mixed multitude who was among them
fell a lusting: And the children of Israel also wept again, ( or, murmured, and
wept,) and said. Who shall give us flesh to eat? We remember the fish which we
did eat in Egypt freely: the cucumbers, and the melons, etc. but now our soul
is dried away: there is nothing at all, besides this Manna, before our eyes,
etc. God gave them flesh: but while the flesh was yet between their teeth, ere
it was chewed, the wrath of the Lord was kindled against the people; and the
Lord smote the people with a very great plague, etc. Numb. 11. 1, 4, 5, 6, 10,
20, 31, 32, 33.

Upon the report of the Spies, of the difficulty of entering the Land, all the
Congregation of Israel listed up their voice, and cried; and the people wept
that night. And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses, and against
Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God we had died in the
land of Egypt; or, Would God we had died in this wilderness. And wherefore has
the Lord brought us unto this land, to fall by the sword, that our wives and
our children should be a prey? Were it not better for us to return into Egypt?
etc. Let us make us a captain, and return into Egypt. Your carcases shall fall
in the wilderness, etc. These men, who saw my glory, and my signs, have tempted
me, etc. Numb. 14. 1, 2, 3, 4, 9, 10, 22, 23, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32.

When Korah and his Company were swallowed up, all the Congregation of the
Children of Israel murmured against Moses and Aaron, saying, Ye have killed the
people of the Lord, Numb. 16. 41.

There was not water for the congregation: and they gathered themselves against
Moses, and against Aaron: and the people chod with Moses, and spoke, saying,
Would God we had died when our brethren died before the Lord. And why have ye
brought up the congregation of the Lord into this wilderness? that we and our
cattle should die there! And wherefore have ye made us to come up out of Egypt,
to bring us into this evil place? It is no place of seed, or of figs or vines,
etc. Numb. 20. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5,

The soul of the people was much discouraged, because of the way. And the
people spoke against God, and against Moses: Wherefore have ye brought us up
out of Egypt, to die in the wilderness? for there is no bread, neither is there
any water: and our soul loatheth this light bread. And the Lord sent siery
serpents among the people, and they bit the people, and much people died. Numb.
21. 4, 5, 6.

Ye have been rebellious against the Lord since the day I knew you, Deuteronomy. 9.
23, 24.

They tempted God in their hearts, by asking meat for their lusts: yea, they
spoke against God: They said, Can God furnish a table in the wilderness? etc.
Behold, he smote the rock, etc. Can he give bread also? Can he provide flesh
for his people? Therefore the Lord heard, and was wroth. So a fire was kindled
against Jacob, etc. because they believed not in God, nor trusted in his
salvation, etc. They sinned still, and believed not his wondrous works, etc.
How often did they provoke him in the wilderness, and grieve him in the desert?
Yea, they turned back, and tempted God, and limited the Holy One of Israel,
etc. Psalm. 78. 18, 19, 20, 21, 22, 32, 40, 41.

I would not that ye should be ignorant how that our fathers were under the
cloud, etc. but with many of them God was not well pleased, for they were
overthrown in the wilderness. Now these things were our examples, to the intent
that we should not lust after evil things, as they also lasted, etc. Neither
let us tempt Christ, as some of them also tempted, and were destroyed of
serpents. Neither murmur ye, as some or them also murmured, and were destroyed
by the destroyer. Now all these things happened unto them for ensamples, ( or
types,) and are written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the world are
come: therefore let him who thinks he stands, take heed lest he fall, 1
Cor. 10. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, to 13.

See the Things of the World, Chap. 39.

CHAP. LIVE.
Saints Duty to be diligent and industrious in their Callings.
GO to the Ant thou sluggard, consider her ways and be wise: which having no
guide, overseer or ruler, provideth her meat in the summer, and gathers her
food in the harvest. How long will thou sleep, O sluggard? When will thou arise
out of thy sleep? Yet a little sleep, a little s^umber, a little folding of the
hands to sleep: so shall thy poverty come, as one who travelleth, and thy want
as an armed man, Prove. 6. 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11. chapter 24. 33, 34,

He becomes poor who deals with a slack hand: but the hand of the diligent
makes rich; he who gathers in summer is a wise son: he who sleeps in
harvest, is a son who causes shame, etc. As vinegar to the teeth, and smoke to
the eyes, so is the sluggard to them who send him, Prove. 10. 4, 5, 26.

He who tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread, but he that follows
vain persons, is void of understanding, etc. The hand of the diligent shall
bear rule, but the slothful shall be under tribute, etc. the slothful roasteth
not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is
precious, Prove. 12. 11, 24, 27.

The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing: but the soul of the
diligent shall be made fat, Prove. 13. 4.

In all labor there is profit: but the talk of the lips tend only to poverty,
Prove. 14. 23.

The way of the slothful man is an hedge of thorns, Prove. 15. 19.

He also who is slothful in his work, is brother to him who is a great waster,
Prove. 18. 9.

Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep: and an idle soul shall suffer hunger,
etc. A slothful man hides his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring
it to his mouth again, Prove. 19. 15, 24. chapter 26. 15.

The sluggard will not plow, by reason of the cold: therefore shall he beg in
harvest, and have nothing, etc. Love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty: open
thine eyes, and thou shall be satisned with bread, Prove. 20. 4, 13.

He who loves pleasure, ( or, sport,) shall be a poor man, etc. The desire of
the slothful kills him, for his hand refuses to labor, Prove. 21. 17, 25.

The slothful man says, A Lion without; I shall be slain in the streets, etc.
See thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he
shall not stand before mean men, Prove. 22. 13, 29. chapter 26. 13.

Drowsiness shall cloth with rags, Prove. 23. 21.

I went by the field of the slothful, etc. and lo, it was all grown over with
thorns, nettles had covered the face thereof, etc. Yet a little sleep, etc. so
thy poverty shall come, etc. Prove. 24. 30, 31, 32, 33, 34.

By much slothfulness, the building decays: and through idleness of the hands,
the house droppeth down, Eccles. 10. 18.

As the door turns on its hinges, so the slothful man upon his bed, etc. The
sluggard is wiser in his own conceit, than seven men who can render a reason,
Prove. 26. 14. 16.

He who tilleth his land, shall have plenty of bread: but he who follows
after vain persons, shall have poverty enough, Prove. 28. 19.

The Industry of a good Wife set forth at large, Prove. 31. 10, 11, 12, etc.

Rise up, ye women who are at ease: hear my voice, ye careless daughters, etc.
Many days and years shall ye be troubled, ye careless women; for the vintage
shall fail, etc. Tremble, ye women who are at ease: be troubled, ye careless
ones, etc. Isa. 32. 9, 10, 11.

This was the iniquity of thy sister Sodom: abundance of idleness was in her,
etc. neither, etc. Ezekiel. 16. 49. Matthew. 20. 3, 6.

You your selves know that these hands have ministered to my necessities, and to
them who were with me. I have showed you also, how that so laboring, ye ought
to support the weak, and to remember the words of our Lord Jesus; how he said,
It is more blessed to give, than to receive, Acts 20. 33, 34, 35. chapter 18. 1, 2,
3. 2 These. 3. 7, 8, 9, 10.

Let him who stole steal no more: but rather let him labor, working with his
hands the thing which is good; that he may have to give to him who needs,
Ephesians. 4. 28.

That you study to be quiet, and to do your own business, and to work with your
own hands, as we commanded you, 1 These. 4. 11.

We commanded you, that if any would not work, he should not eat. For we hear,
there are some among you who walk disorderly, working not at all, etc. We
command, etc. that with quietness they work, and eat their own bread, etc. 2
These. 3. 10, 11, 12.

Withal, they learn to be idle; wandering about, from house to house, 1 Timothy 5.
13.

That they who have believed in God, might be careful to maintain good works, (
or, honest trades,) Titus 3. 8, 14.

CHAP. LV.
God's Way of declaring his Mind of Old, by Voices, Dreams and Visions.
THE Lord spoke to Adam, to Cain, Noah, etc. Genesis 2. 16, 17. chapter 3. 8, 9, 10,
11, etc. chapter 4. 6, 7, 9, 10, to 16. chapter 6. 13, 14, etc. chapter 7. 1, 2, 3, etc.
chapter 9. chapter 12. 1, 2, 3.

After these things, the word of the Lord came in a vision unto Abram, saying,
I am thy shield, etc. Genesis 15. 1, 2, 3, etc.

God came to Abimelech in a dream by night, and said unto him, Behold, thou art
but a dead man; for the woman which thou have taken, etc. God said to him in a
dream, Yea, I know that thou did this in the integrity of thy heart, etc.
Genesis 20. 2, to 8.

Jacob dreamed, and behold, a ladder set upon the earth, and the top thereof
reached to heaven, etc. The Lord stood above it, and said, I am the Lord God of
Abraham thy father, etc. The land whereon thou lie to thee will I give it,
etc. Genesis 28. 11, to 16.

And the Angel of God spoke unto me in a dream, saying, Jacob, etc. I have seen
all that Laban does unto thee: I am the God of Bethel, where thou anointedst
the pillar, where thou vowedst a vow to me, etc. And God came to Laban the
Syrian in a dream by night, and said unto him, Take heed that thou speak not to
Jacob, etc. Genesis 31. 11, 12, 13, 24.

Joseph dreamed a dream, and he told it to his brethren, etc. And he dreamed
yet another dream, etc. Genesis 36. 5, to 11. chapter 42. 6. chapter 43. 26, 28. chapter 44.
14. chapter 50. 18.

The Dreams of the Butler and Baker of Pharaoh, in the Prison; and of Pharaoh
himself; interpreted by Joseph, Genesis 40. chapter 41.

God spoke unto Israel in the visions of the night, and said, Jacob, Jacob,
etc, I am the God of thy Father; fear not to go down into Egypt, etc. Genesis 46.
1, to 5.

God spoke to Moses out of the burning bush, Exodus 3.

Moses went up unto God: and the Lord called unto him out of the mountain,
saying, Thus shall thou say, etc. Moses spoke: and God answered him by a voice,
etc. And the Lord said to Moses, Go down, charge the people, etc. Exodus 19. 3,
4, 9, 10, 19, 20, 21, 22, 24.

If there be a prophet among you, I, etc. will make my self known to them in a
vision, etc. Numb. 12. 6.

He has said, who heard the words of God; who saw the vision of the Almighty;
falling into a trance, but having his eyes open, etc. Number. 24. 4, 16.

The Lord spoke to Samuel by Voice, or Word, 1 Samuel 3. 4, 10, 11, 21.

-- To Nathan, by Vision, 2 Samuel 7. 17.

The Lord appeared to Solomon in a dream by night: and God said, Ask what I
shall give thee, etc. 1 Kings 3. 5, 6, 7. chapter 9. 2.

The Lord answered not Saul by prophets, nor by dreams, etc. 1 Samuel 28. 6, 15.

God speaks once, yea twice; yet man perceives it not. In a dream, in a
vision of the night, when deep sleep falls upon men, in slumberings upon the
bed; then he opens the ears of men, and seals their instruction, Job 33.
14, 15, 16.

Thou spakest in a vision to thy Holy One, and said, I have laid help upon
one, etc. Psalm. 89. 19.

Nebuchadnezzar's Dreams, which Daniel expounded, Dan. 2. chapter 4.

Belshazzar's Vision against the Wall, Dan. 5. 5, 25.

Daniel's Vision of the Beasts, etc. Dan. 7.

-- Of the Man clothed in Linen, Dan. 10. 5, 6, 7, etc.

-- Of other things, Dan. 7. chapter 8. chapter 10.

I have also spoken by the prophets: and I have multiplied visions, and used
similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets, Hos. 12. 10.

I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh: and, etc. your old men shall dream
dreams, your young men shall see visions, Joel 2. 28. Acts 2. 16, 17.

For the vision is yet for an appointed time: but in the end it shall speak,
and not lie: and though it tarry, wait for it, because it will surely come,
etc. Habak. 2. 3.

Behold, the Angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou
son of David, fear not, etc. Matthew. 1. 20.

And being warned of God in a dream, that they should not return unto Herod,
etc. And when they were departed, behold, the Angel of the Lord appeared to
Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise, and take the young child, etc. Matthew. 2. 12,
13, 19, 22.

Pilate, etc. said, I will have nothing to do with that just Man: for I have
suffered many things this day in a dream, because of him, etc. Matthew. 27. 19.

Saul saw a Vision, and heard a Voice, saying, Saul, Saul; Why persecutest thou
me, etc. A certain disciple at Damascus, named Ananias: And to him said the
Lord, in a vision, etc. Arise, and go, etc. Acts 9. 1, 2, 3, 4, to 11. chapter 26.
13, 14, 15, etc.

Cornelius saw in a Vision, evidently, an Angel of God coming unto him, and
saying, Cornelius, thy prayers and thine alms are come up, etc. Peter also had
a Vision; and God spoke to him, etc. Acts 10. 3, 4, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15,
28, 30, etc. chapter 11. 5.

A Vision appeared to Paul in the night: There stood a man of Macedonia, and
prayed him, saying come over unto Macedonia, and help us, etc. He endeavored
to go; assuredly gathering, that the Lord had called us, for to preach the
Gospel unto them, Acts 16. 9, 10.

Then spoke the Lord to Paul in the night, by a vision, be not afraid, but
speak, etc. for I am with thee, Acts 18. 9.

It is not expedient for me, doubtless, to glory I will come to visions and
revelations of the Lord I knew a man, etc. 2 Cor. 12. 1, 2, 3.

God, who at sundry times, and in diverse manners, spoke in times past unto the
fathers, by the prophets, has in these last days spoken unto us, by his son,
etc. Heb. 1. 1, 2.

CHAP. LVI.
The Call and Commission of the Apostles equal, without Superiority.
JEsus, etc. saw two brethren, Simeon called Peter and Andrew his brother,
casting a net into the sea, (for they were fishers), and he says unto them
follow me, and I will make you fishers of men, etc. he saw other two brethren
James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, etc. and he called them, and
they immediately, etc. followed him, Matthew. 4. 18, 19, 20, 21, 22. Mark 1. 16,
17, 18, 19, 20.

One is your master, and all ye are brethren, etc. whosoever exalts himself,
etc. Matthew. 23. 8. 11, 12.

Jesus, etc. saw a man named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom, and he
says unto him, follow me: and he arose and followed him, Matthew. 9. 9. Mark 2.
14. Luke 5. 27, 28.

Whatsoever ye bind on earth, shall be bound in heaven, Matthew. 18. 18.

He ordained twelve: that they should be with him, and that he might send then
forth to preach, and to have power to heal sickness, and to cast out devils:
and Simeon he surnamed Peter, and James of Zebedee, and John the brother of
James, etc. and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas,
and James of Alpheus, and Thaddeus, and Simeon the Canaanite, and Judas, Mark
3. 14, 15, 16, 17, 18, 19.

By the way they had disputed among themselves, who should be the greatest; and
he sat down and called the twelve, and said unto them, If any man desire to be
first, he, the same shall be last of all, and servant of all, Mark 9. 34, 35.

James and John, etc. said grant us that we may sit one on thy right hand, etc.
and when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeased with James and
John: but Jesus called there unto him, and said unto them, Ye know that they
who are account ed to rule over the Gentiles, exercise Lorship over them, etc.
but so it shall not be amongst you, but whosoever will be great among you,
shall be your minister: and whosoever among you will be perfect, shall be
servant of all: for even the son of man came not to be ministered unto, etc.
Mark 10. 35, 36, 37, 38, 41, 42, 43, 44. Luke 22. 24, 25, 26, 27.

He called unto him his Disciples, and of them he chose twelve, whom also he
named Apostles: Simon, (whom he also named Peter) Andrew his brother: James and
John, Philip and Bartholomew, Matthew and Thomas, James the son of Alpheus, and
Simon, called zealotes, and Judas of James, and Judas Iscacariot, Luke 6. 13,
14, 15, 16.

Then he called his twelve disciples together, and gave them power and
authority over all devils, and to cure diseases: and he sent them to preach the
kingdom of God, and to heal the sick: and he said unto them, take nothing, etc.
Luke 9. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.

When Jesus had washed his Disciples feet, he said, I give you an Example that
ye ought to wash one another feet: now there was leaning on Jesus's bosom, one
of his disciples, whom Jesus loved. Simon Peter therefore beckoned unto him,
that he should ask whom it should be, of whom he spoke, etc. John 13. 13, 14,
15, 22, 23, 24, 25, chapter 19. 26, 27, chapter 20. 2. chapter 21. 7, 20, 21, 22.

Jesus came, etc. said peace be unto you, etc. as my father has sent me, even
so send I you, and etc. he breathed on them and says unto them, receive ye
holy ghost: whosesoever sins ye remit, they are remitted unto them; and whose
soever sins ye retain, they are retained, John 20. 19, 20, 21, 22, 23.

To whom ye forgive, etc. I also, if I forgive, etc. for your sakes I forgive
it, in the person ( or, sight) of Christ, 2 Cor. 2. 10.

The twelve called the multitude of the Disciples and said, etc. look ye out
among you seven men, etc. whom when they had set before the Apostles: and they
had prayed, they laid their hands on them, Acts 6. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.

Now when the Apostles who were at Jerusalem had heard, that Samaria had
received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John, who when they
were come down, etc. Acts 8. 14, 15.

The believing Jews dispute with Peter for going to the Gentiles, and he gives
them an account of Gods work upon them, Acts 11. 2, 3, etc.

I speak to you Gentiles, inasmuch as I am the Apostle of the Gentiles, I
magnify mine office, Romans 11. 13, 14.

For I suppose I was not behind, or in nothing inferior to the very chiefest
Apostles, etc. are they ministers of Christ, etc. I am more: in labors more
abundant, etc. besides those things which are without, which comes upon me
dai^y, the care of all the Churches, 2 Cor. 11. 5, 23, 28. 1 Cor. 15. 10.

I knew a man in Christ, etc. such a one caught up to the third heaven, etc.
into Paradise, and heard unspeakable words, etc. I ought to have been commended
of you, for in nothing, am I behind, or any inferior to the very chiefest
Apostles, etc. 2 Cor. 12. 2, 3, 4, 11.

When it pleased God, etc. to reveal his son in me, that I might preach him
among the heathen: immediately I conferred not with flesh and blood: neither
went I up to Jerusalem unto them who were Apostles before me, but I went into
Arabia, etc. Then after three years, I went up to Jerusalem to see Peter, and
abode with him fifteen days, but other of the Apostles saw I none but James the
Lord's brother, Gal. 1. 15, 16, 17, 18, 19.

When they saw that the Gospel of the uncircumcision was committed unto me, as
the Gospel of the circumcision was unto Peter: for he who wrought effectually
in Peter to the Apostleship of the circumcision, the same was mighty in me
toward the Gentiles. And when James, Cephas and John (who seemed to be
pillars), perceived the grace which was given unto me, they gave to me and
Barnaias, the right hand of fellowship, that we should to go the heathen, and
they unto the circumcision, etc. but when Peter was come to Antioch, I
withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed: for before that,
certain came from James; he did eat with the Gentiles. But when they were come,
he withdrew, etc. fearing them of circumcision, etc. but when I saw that they
walked not uprightly, etc. I said unto Peter before them all, if thou being a
Jew, live after the manner of the Gentiles, etc. why compellest thou the
Gentiles to live as do the Jews, etc. Gal. 2. 7, 8, 9, 11, 12, 13, 14.

I am constituted a preacher, an Apostle, and doctor of the Gentiles, 2 Timothy 1.
11.

CHAP. LVII.
Of the Restoration and Return of Israel, from the Countries into which they
are scattered.
AND it shall come to pass, when all these things are come upon thee, etc. and
thou shall call to mind among all the nations whither the Lord thy God has
driven thee, etc. that then the Lord thy God will turn thy captivity and have
compassion upon thee, and will return and gather thee from all the nations,
whither the Lord thy God has scattered thee: if any of thine be driven out
unto the outmost part of heaven, from thence will the Lord thy God gather thee,
etc. and bring thee into the land which thy fathers possessed, and thou shall
possess it, etc. and the Lord thy God will circumcise thine heart, etc. to love
the Lord thy God with all thine heart, etc. Deuteronomy. 30. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.

The Lord shall judge his people, and repent himself for his servants, when he
sees that power is gone, and there is none shut up, or least, etc. rejoice O
ye nations, his people, for he will avenge the blood of his servants, etc. and
will be merciful to his land, to his people, Deuteronomy 32. 36, 43.

O that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the Lord brings
back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, Israel shall be glad,
Psalm. 14. 7.

And it shall come to pass in the last days, that the mountain of the house of
the Lord shall be established, ( or, prepared), in the top of the mountains,
and shall be exalted above the hills, and all nations shall flow in unto it.
And many people shall say, come ye let us go up, etc. for out of Zion shall go
forth the law, and the word of the Lord from Jerusalem, Isa. 2. 2, 3.

And it shall come to pass in that day, the remnant of Israel, etc. shall stay
upon the Lord, the holy one of Israel in truth: the remnant shall return, the
remnant of Jacob unto the mighty God: for though thy people Israel be as the
sand of the sea; a remnant of them shall return, etc. Isai. 10 20, 21, 22, 23.

And it shall come to pass in that day, the Lord shall fet his hand again the
second time, to recover the remnant of his people, which shall be lest from
Assyria, etc. and from the Island of the sea: and he shall set up an ensign for
the nations, and shall assemble the outcasts of Israel, and gather together
the dispersed of Judah, from the four corners of the earth, Isa. 11. 11, 12.

The Lord will have mercy on Jacob, and will yet refuse Israel, and set them in
their own land, etc. Isa. 14. 1, 2. 3, 32.

He shall cause them who came out of Jacob, to take root: Israel shall blossom
and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit, etc. ye shall be gathered
one by one, O ye children of Israel, etc. and they shall come who were ready to
perish in the land of Assyria, and the outcasts in the land of Egypt, and
shall worship the Lord in the holy mount at Jerusalem, Isa. 27. 6, 12, 13.

Look upon Zion the city of our solemnities: thine eyes shall see Jerusalem a
quiet habitation, a tabernacle which shall not be taken down, nor one of the
stakes there of shall ever be removed: neither shall any of the cords thereof
be broken: but there the glorious Lord will be unto us a place of broad rivers,
Isa. 33. 20, 21, etc.

Look unto Abram your father, and unto Sarah who bare you, etc. for the Lord
shall comfort Zion: he will comfort all their wast places, and he will make her
wilderness, like Eden, and her desert like the garden of the Lord; joy and
gladness shall be found therein, thanksgiving and the voice of melody, Isa.
51. 2, 3. chapter 52. 1, 2, 3, 4. chapter 60. chapter 61. 4, 5, 6, etc. chapter 62. chapter 65. 18.
19, 20, 21, 22, 23 chapter 66. 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 15. Micah. 4. Zephan. 3. 14,
15, etc.

At that time they shall call Jerusalem the throne of the Lord, and all the
nations shall be gathered unto it, to the name of the Lord, to Jerusalem, etc.
in those days shall the house of Judah walk with the house of Israel, and they
shall come together out of the land of the north, to the land which I have
given for an inheritance unto your fathers, but I said, etc. Jerem. 3. 14, 15,
16, 17, 18.

The days come says the Lord, that it shall no more be said, the Lord lives,
who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt; but the Lord
lives, who brought up the children of Israel, from the land of the north, and
from all the lands whither he had driven them: and I will bring them again into
their land, which I gave to their fathers, Jerem. 16. 14, 15. chapter 23. 3, 4, 5,
6, 7, 8.

I will be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people,
etc. again, I will build thee, and thou shall be built O virgin of Israel, etc.
then shall ye plant vines upon the mountain of Samaria, the planters shall
plant, and shall ear, etc. for this says the Lord, sing with gladness for
(...) and shout among the chief of the nations, etc. behold I will bring them
from the north country, and gather them from the coasts of the earth, etc. a
great company shall return thither, etc. for I am a father to Israel, and
Ephraim is my firstborn: hear the word of the Lord, O ye nations, and declare
it in the Isles of the nations, and say, He who scatters Israel, will-gather
him and keep him as a shepherd does his flock, for the herd has redeemed
Jacob, and ransomed him from the hand of him who was stronger then he:
therefore shall they come and sing in the height of Zion, etc. if heaven above
can be measured, etc. I will also cast of all the seed of Israel, for all that
they have done says the Lord, behold the days come, says the Lord, that the
city shall be built to the Lord, etc. Jerem. 31. 1, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11,
12, 27, 28, 38, etc. chapter 30.

Behold, I will gather them out of the countries whither I have driven them in
mine anger, etc. and I will bring them again into this place, and I will cause
them to dwelt safely, and they shall be my people, etc. Jer. 32. 37, 38.

Thus says the Lord, If my covenant be not with day and night, etc. then will
I cast off the feed or Jacob, and David my servant; that I will not take any of
his seed, to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac and Jacob: For I will
cause their captivity to return, and have mercy on them, Jer. 33. 25, 26, chapter
46. 27, 28

In those days, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of
Judah together, going and weeping, etc. Jer. 59. 4, 20.

Thus says the Lord God, although I have cast them far off among the heathen;
and although I have scattered them among the Countries; yet will I be to them
as a little sanctuary in the Countries, where they shall come; therefore, etc.
I will even gather you from the people, and assemble you out of the Countries,
where ye have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel, and they
shall come thither, and they shall take away all the detestable things, etc.
Ezekiel. 11. 16, 17, 18,

Ye shall know that I am the Lord, when I shall bring you into the land of
Israel, into the Countries, for the which, I lifted up mine hand to give it to
your fathers, and there shall ye remember your ways, etc. Ezekiel. 20. 42. 43. chapter
28. 24, 25, 26.

Thus says the Lord God, Behold I will both search my sheep, etc. and deliver
them out of all places where they have been scattered, etc. and will bring them
to their own land, etc. and I will set up the shepherd over them, etc. Ezekiel.
34. 11. 12, 13, 23, 24, etc.

Mountains of Israel, ye shall shoot forth your branches, and yield your fruit
to my people of Israel, for they are at hand to come; behold I am for you, and
I will turn unto you, and ye shall be tilled and sowed, etc. and the city shall
be inhabited, and the wastes builded, etc. I will settle you after your old
estates, and will do better unto you, then at your beginnings, and ye shall
know that I am the Lord, etc. I will take you from among the heathen, and
gather you from all countries, and will bring you into your own land, etc. and
ye shall dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers, and ye shall be my
people, etc. then shall ye remember your own ways, etc. not for your sakes do I
this, says the Lord God, be it known to you, etc. then the heathen who are
left round about you all, know that I the Lord build the ruined places, and
plant that which was desolate: I the Lord have spoken it, and I will do it,
etc. I will yet for this be enquired of, by the house of Israel, Ezekiel. 36, 8,
9, 10, 11, 19, 23, 24, 28, 31, 32, 33, Hosea 2. 14, 15. Amos 9. 11, 14, 15.

By the dry bones, is typified the Israelites returned. These bones are the
whole house of Israel; behold they say, our bones are dried, and our hope is
lost, and we are cut off for our part, therefore prophesy, etc. O my people, I
will open your graves, cause you to come out of your graves, and bring you into
the land of Israel, etc. I will take the children of Israel from among the
heathen, whither they be gone, and will gather them on every side, and bring
them into their own land; and I will make them one nation in the land, upon the
mountains of Israel, and one king shall be king to them all, and they shall no
more be divided into two nations, etc. and they shall dwell in the land which I
have given unto Jacob, etc. 37. Hosea 1. 10, 11. Joel 3. 6, 7.

Now will I bring again the captivity of Jacob, and have mercy on the whole
house of Israel; but I have gathered them in their own land, etc. and will hide
my face no more, Ezekiel. 39. 25, etc.

Jerusalem shall be inhabited, etc. Flee from the land of the north, says the
Lord, for I have spread you abroad as the four winds of the heaven, etc.
Deliver thy self, O Zion, who dwell with the daughters of Babylon, etc. for
he who touches you touches the apple of his eye, Zech. 2. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 12.
Joel 3. Zeph. 3. 14, 15, etc.

Thus says the Lord, I am returned unto Zion, and will dwell in the midst of
Jerusalem, etc. There shall yet old men and old women dwell in the streets of
Jerusalem, etc. and the streets of the city shall be full of boys and girls,
playing in the streets thereof, etc. Behold I will save my people from the east
countries, and from the west country; and I will bring them, and they shall
dwell in the midst of Jerusalem, and they shall be my people, and I will be
their God, etc. As I thought to punish you when your Fathers provoked me to
wrath, etc. and I repented not: so again have I thought in these days to do
well unto Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah: Fear ye not, etc. Yea, many
people and strong nations shall come to seek the Lord of Hosts in Jerusalem,
and to pray, etc. Zech. 8. 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 13, 14, 15. chapter 12. 7, 8, 9. chapter 14.
10, 11, 20, 21, 22, 23.

In that day I will make Jerusalem a burthensom stone for all people, etc. They
shall be cut off, though the people of the earth gather, etc. Zech. 12. 3, 4,
etc.

I would not, brethren, that ye should be ignorant of this mystery (lest ye
should be wise in your own conceits) that blindness in part is happened to
Israel, until the fullness of the Gentiles be come. And so all Israel shall be
saved, as it is written, There shall come out of Sion the deliverer, and shall
turn away ungodliness from Jacob: for this is my covenant unto them when I
shall take away their sin, etc. they are beloved for the Father's sake, etc.
Romans 11. 25, 26, 27, 28.

See the Dignity and Blessings belonging to the Church of God as such, Chap. 27.

CHAP. LVIII.
Of the Seventh Day, or Sabbath, in Old Testament days, and the Laws about it;
and of the Change to the First Day.
ON the seventh day God ended his work, etc. and rested on the seventh day from
all his work which he had made: and God blessed the seventh day and sanctified
it, because that in it he had rested, etc. Genesis 2. 2, 3.

To morrow is the rest of the holy sabbath unto the Lord, bake that which you
will bake to day, etc. for to morrow is a sabbath unto the Lord, etc. Six days
ye shall gather it, but on the seventh day, the sabbath, in it there shall be
none, etc. Abide ye every man in his place; let no man go out of his place on
the sabbath day. So the people rested on the sabbath day, Exodus 16. 23, to the
30.

Remember the sabbath day to keep it holy. Six days shall thou labor and do
all thy work, but the seventh day, the sabbath of the Lord thy God, thou shall
not do any work, thou, nor thy son, etc. for in six days the Lord made heaven,
etc. and rested the seventh day: wherefore the Lord blessed the seventh day and
hallowed it, Exodus 20. 8, 9, 10, 41. Deuteronomy. 5. 12, 13, 14.

On the seventh day thou shall rest; that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and
the son of thine handmaid and the stranger may be refreshed, Exodus 23. 12. chapter
34. 21.

Ye shall keep the sabbath therefore; for it is holy unto you: every one who
defiles it, shall surely be put to death: for whosoever does work therein,
that soul shall be cut off from among his people, and he shall surely be put to
death. Wherefore the children of Israel shall keep the sabbath, etc. it is a
sign between me and the children for ever: for in six days the Lord made
heaven, etc. Exodus 31. 12. to 18. chapter 35. 2.

Six days shall work be done, etc. ye shall kindle no fire throughout your
habitations upon the sabbath day, Exodus 35. 3.

Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day is the sabbath of rest, an
holy convocation, etc. Levit. 23. 3.

They found a Man who gathered sticks upon the Sabbath day, etc. and the Lord
said to Moses, The man shall surely be put to death, all the Congregation shall
stone him with stones without the Camp, Numb. 15. 32, 33, 34, 35, 36.

And on the sabbath day two lambs, etc. this is the burnt-offering of every
sabbath, beside the continual burnt-offerings, etc. Numb. 28. 9, 10.

Keep the sabbath day to sanctify it, etc. and remember that thou wast a
servant in the land of Egypt, etc. Deuteronomy. 5. 12, 13, 14, 15.

If the people of the land bring ware, or any victuals on the sabbath day to
sell, we would not buy it on the sabbath, etc. Nehem. 10. 31.

Nehem^an contended with the Nobles of Judah, for profaning the Sabbath, and he
caused the gates be shut on the Sabbath to keep out Merchandises, and threatened
such who brought them to sell on the Sabbath, Nehem. 13. 15, to the 23.

If thou turn away thy foot from the sabbath, from doing thy pleasure on my
holy day, and call the sabbath a delight, the holy of the Lord honorable, and
shall honor him, not doing thine own ways, nor finding thine own pleasures,
nor speaking thine own words; then, etc. I will cause thee to ride upon the
high places, etc. Isa. 58. 13, 14.

Bear no burden on the sabbath day, nor bring in by the gates of Jerusalem,
neither carry forth a burden out of the houses on the sabbath day, neither do
ye any work, but hallow ye the sabbath day, etc. Jerem, 17. 21, 22, 24, 27.

I gave them my sabbath to be a sign between me and them, etc. Ezekiel. 20. 12,
20, 21.

Hear this, O ye who swallow up the needy, etc. saying, When will the new moon
be gone, that we may sell corn? and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat?
etc. Amos 8. 4, 5.

Jesus went through the Corn on the sabbath day, and his Disciples were an
hungered, and began to pluck the ears of Corn to eat. But when the Pharisees saw
it they said to him, Behold thy Disciples do that which is not lawful to do
upon the sabbath day. But he said unto them, Have ye not read what David did,
when he was an hungered, etc. and how on the sabbath day the priests in the
temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless, etc. If ye had known what this
means, I will have mercy and not sacrifice; ye would not have condemned the
guiltless. For the Son of man is Lord even of the sabbath day, etc. What man,
etc. who shall have one sheep, and it shall fall into a pit on the sabbath day,
will he not lay hold on it and lift it out? etc. Wherefore it is lawful to do
well on the sabbath day, Matthew. 12. 1, 2, to the 13. Luke 6. 1, 2, 3, etc. chapter
13. 14, 15, 16.

The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath: Therefore the Son
of man is Lord also of the sabbath, Mark 2. 27, 28.

Very early in the morning, the first day of the week they came unto the
sepulcher, at the rising of the Sun, etc. Mark 16. 2, 3, etc. Luke 24. 1, 2, 3,
etc.

Jesus, etc. as his custom was, he went into the Synagogue on the Sabbath day,
and stood up for to read; and there was delivered to him the Book of the
Prophets, etc. Luke 4. 16, 31.

Ye on the Sabbath day circumcise a man. If a man on the sabbath day receive
circumcision, that the law of Moses should not be broken ( or, without breaking
the Law:) Are ye angry with me because I have made a man every whit whole on
the sabbath day? John 7. 22, 23.

And the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, etc. the
Disciples were assembled, etc. came Jesus in the midst, and says to them,
Peace, etc. And after eight days again ( or, in eight days) his Disciples were
within, etc. came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst of, etc.
John 20. 19, 26.

Paul, etc. reasoned in the Synagogue every sabbath, and persuaded the Jews and
Greeks, etc. Acts 18. 4.

Paul, etc. abode at Troas seven days: and upon the first day of the week, when
the Disciples came together to break bread, Paul preached unto them ready to
depart on the morrow, and continued his speech until midnight, etc. When he,
etc. had broken bread and eaten, and talked a long while, even till break of
day, so he departed, Acts 20. 6, 7, 8, 11.

Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as
God has prospered him, that there be no gathering when I come, 1 Cor. 16. 2.

For he spoke in a certain place of the seventh day on this wise; And God did
rest the seventh day from all his works, etc. If Jesus ( or, Joshua) had given
them rest, then would he not afterward have spoken of another day; there
remains therefore a rest (or a Sabbath) to the people of God, etc. Hebr. 4.
4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9.

I John, etc. was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, etc. Rev. 1. 9, 10.

CHAP. LIX.
Of Usury.
IF thou lend money to any of my people that is poor by thee, thou shall not be
to him as an usurer, neither shall thou lay upon him usury, Exodus 22. 25.

And if thy brother be waxen poor, and fallen in decay with thee, then thou
shall relieve him, etc. Take thou no usury of him, or increase, but fear thy
God, that thy brother may live with thee. Thou shall not give him thy money
upon usury, nor le^d him thy victuals for increase, Levit. 25. 35, 36, 37.

Thou saul not lend upon usury to thy brother, usury of money, usury of any
thing that is lent upon usury, Unto a stranger thou may lend upon usury, but
unto thy brother thou shall not lend upon usury, etc. Deuteronomy. 23. 19, 20.

When the Jews were low, and borrowed Money each of other to buy Corn and for
necessary Uses, and they took Mortgages of their Lands, and sold their Sons and
Daughters each to other for it; then Nehemiah rebuked them for this Usury, and
further tells them, That he and his Brethren might exact of them Money and
Corn, and prays them to leave off this Usury, Nehem. 5.

Who shall abide in thy tabernacle? etc. he who puts not out his Money to
usury, not takes not a reward against the innocent, etc. Psalm. 15. 1, 5.

He who by usury, and unjust gain, increases his substance, he shall gather
for him who will pity the poor, Prove. 28. 8.

I have neither sent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury, yet every one
of them do curse me, Jer. 15. 10.

If a man be just, etc. and has not oppressed any, etc. has given his bread to
the hungry, etc. has not given forth upon usury, or taken increase, Ezekiel. 18.
7, 8, 12, 13.

Thou have taken usury and increase, and thou have greedily gained of thy
neighbor by extortion, etc. Ezekiel. 22. 12.

CHAP. LX.
Of Envy, Wrath, Hatred, Malice, Bitterness, Emulation, Discontent and Strife.
A Bram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and
thee, and between my Herdsmen and thine, etc. for we be brethren, etc. If thou
go to the left hand, then I will go to the right; it thou to the right, then I
will go to the left, etc. Genesis 13. 7.

When Rebekah saw that she bare Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister,
and said unto Jacob, etc. Genesis 30. 1, 2.

When Joseph's Brethren, saw that their Father loved him more than all his
Brethren, they hated him, and could not speak peaceably to him, etc. They hated
him yet the more for his dream, etc. His Brethren envied him, but his Father
observed the sayings. They conspire to slay him, Genesis 37. 4, 8, 11, 18.

Thou shall not hate thy Brother in thy heart, etc. Thou shall not avenge nor
bear any grudge against the children of thy people, etc. Levit. 19. 17. 18.

When Eldad and Medad had prophesied in the Camp, Joshua desired Moses to
forbid them: Moses said unto him, Enviest thou for my sake? would all the
Lord's people were Prophets, etc. Numb. 29. 27, 28, 29.

When the Women in their Song had ascribed to Saul his one thousand, and to
David his ten thousand, Saul was very wroth, and said, etc. What can he have
more, but the Kingdom? And Saul eyed David from that day and forward, etc.
became his enemy continually, etc. would have killed him, 1 Samuel 18. 6, 7, 8,
9, 10, 11. chapter 19. 1.

Ahab so sorely discontented and displeased with Naboth, that he would eat no
bread, etc. and that because he could not have the vineyard, 1 Kings 21. 1, 2,
3, 4.

Haman went out joyful and with a glad heart; but when Haman saw Mordecai in
the King's gate, that he stood not up, nor moved for him, he was full of
Indignation against Mordecai, etc. And having told his Friends of his Glory,
etc. yet ( said he) all these avail me nothing so long as I see Mordecai the
Jew sitting in the King's gate, Esther 5. 9, 10, 11, 12, 13.

Fret not thy self because of evil doers, neither be thou envious against the
workers of iniquity for they shall soon be cut down, etc. fret not because of
him who prospers in his way, etc. who brings wicked devices to pass, etc.
Fret not thy self to do evil, etc. Psalm 37. 1, 2, 7, 8, 9.

As for me my feet are almost gone, etc. for I was envious at the foolish, when
I saw the prosperity of the wicked, Psalm 73. 2, 3, 4.

They envied Moses also in the Camp, etc. Aron the Saint of the Lord, Psalm
106. 16.

Strive not with a man without cause, etc. Envy thou not the oppressor ( or,
Man of Violence) and choose none of his ways, etc. Prove. 3. 30, 31, 32.

Hatred stirs up strife, Prove. 10. 12.

Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, than a stalled ox and hatred
therewith, Prove. 15. 17.

Let not thine heart envy sinners, but be in the fear of the Lord all the day
long, Prove. 23. 17.

Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them. Fret not
thy self because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked, Prove. 24.
19, 20.

Wrath is cruel, and anger cutragious; but who is able to stand before envy, (
or, jealousy,) Prove. 27. 4.

The forcing of wrath brings forth strife, Prove. 30. 33.

I consider, etc. every right work, that for this a man is envied of his
neighbor, Eccles. 4. 4.

Lord thy hand is lifted up, they will not see: they shall see and be ashamed
for their envy at ( or, toward) thy people; yea, the fire of thine enemies
shall destroy them, Isa. 26. 11.

Therefore, etc. says the Lord God, I will even do according to thine anger,
and according to thine envy, which thou have used out of hatred to them, ( or,
against them) Ezekiel. 35. 11.

Pilate said to the Jews, Will ye that I deliver Barabbas or Jesus, who is
Christ: for he knew that for envy they had delivered him, Matthew. 27 17, 13.

The Patriarchs moved with Envy, sold Joseph into Egypt, Acts 7. 9.

And when the Jews saw the multitude they were filled with envy, and spoke
against those things which were spoken by Paul, contradicting and blaspheming,
Acts 13. 49.

Being filled with all, etc. maliciousness, full of envy, murder, etc. Romans 1.
29.

If by any means I might provoke to emulation them who are my flesh, and might
save some of them, Romans 11. 14.

Let us walk honestly as in the day, not in rioting, etc. not in strife and
envying, etc. Romans 13. 13.

It has been declared, etc. that there are contentions among you, etc. 1 Cor.
1. 11.

Ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying, and strife, and
divisions ( or, factions) are ye not carnal? 1 Cor. 3. 3.

Charity envieth not, 1 Cor. 13. 14.

In malice be ye children, but in understanding be ye men, 1 Cor. 14. 20.

The sorrow of the world works death, 2 Cor. 7. 10.

I fear lest when I come among you I shall find, etc. lest there be debates,
envyings, wraths, strifes, etc. swelling, tumults, 2 Cor. 12 20.

Now the works of the fieth are, etc. hatred, variance, emulations, wrath,
strifes, seditions, envies, murders, etc. Let us not be desirous of vain glory,
provoking one another, envying one another, Gal. 5. 19, 20, 21, 26.

Let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamor, etc. be put away from
you, with all malice, Ephesians. 4. 31.

Some preach Christ even out of envy and strife, etc. Of contention, not
sincerely, supposing to add afflictions to my bonds, Phil. 1. 15, 16.

Let nothing be done through strife or vain glory, but in lowliness of mind let
each esteem other better than himself, Phil. 2. 3.

Let your moderation be known unto all men, the Lord is at hand, etc. I have
learned in what state soever I am, therewith to be content, etc. Phil. 4. 5, 11.

But now you also put off all these anger, wrath, malice, etc. Husbands love
your wives, be not bitter against them, Colos. 3. 8, 19.

Doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof comes envy, strife,
railing, evil surmising, etc. Godliness with contentment is great gain, 1 Timothy
6. 4, 5, 6. Titus 3. 9.

For we our selves also were sometimes foolish, etc. living in malice and envy,
hateful, and hating one another, Tit. 3. 3.

Be content with such things as ye have: for he has said, I will never leave
thee, nor, etc. Hebr. 13. 5.

Let every man be, etc. flow to wrath: for the wrath of man works not the
righteousness of God, James 1. 19, 20.

The tongue is a little member, etc. a fire; a world of iniqusty, etc. sets
on fire the course of nature, etc. an unruly evil full of deadly poison, etc.
Who is a wise man? etc. let him show out of a good conversation his works with
meekness of wisdom: But if ye have bitter envyings and strife in your hearts,
glory not, etc. This wisdom descends not from above, but is earthly, sensual,
( or, Natural) devilish: for where envy and strife is, there is confusion (
or, Tumults, or, Unquietness) and every evil work, James 3. 5, 6, 8, 13, 14,
15, 16.

Grudge not ( or, grieve not) one against another, brethren, left ye be
condemned, etc. James 5. 9.

Wherefore laying aside all malice, etc. and envyings, and evil speaking, etc.
1 Pet. 2. 1.

Whosoever hates his brother is a murderer, and ye know that no murderer has
eternal life abiding in him, 1 John 3. 15.

If any man say I love God, and hates his brother, he is a liar: for he who
loves not his brother, whom he has seen, how can he love God, whom he has
not seen? 1 John 4. 20.

CHAP. LXI.
Of Murder, and taking away the Life of Man.
BEcause God accepted of Abel's Offering, and had no respect unto Cain and his
Offering, Cain rose up against his Brother Abel and flew him, etc. And the Lord
said, etc. What have thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood cries unto me
from the ground. And now thou cursed from the earth, which has opened her
mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand, etc. And Lamech said, etc.
I have slain a man in my ^ounding, and a young man to my hurt. If Cain shall be
avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and seven fold, Genesis 4. 5, 6, 8,
10, 11, 12, 23, 24.

Your blood of your lives I will require at the hand of every beast, and at the
hand of man, at the hand of every man's brother, will I require the life of
man. Whosoever sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the
image of God made he man, etc. Genesis 9. 5, 6.

Because Jacob had gotten his Father's blessing Esau hated him. And Esau said
in his heart, the days of mourning for my father are at hand, then will I slay
my brother Jacob, etc. Genesis 27. 41.

Joseph's Brethren hated him, and conspired together to slay him, Genesis 37. 4,
11, 18.

Simeon and Levi, Brethren, Instruments of Cruelty, etc. O my Soul come not
thou into their secrets, etc. For in their anger they slew a man, and in their
their self-will, etc. cursed their anger, for it was fierce, and their wrath
for it was cruel, etc. Genesis 49. 5, 6, 7. chapter 34. 25, 26, etc.

Thou shall not kill, Exodus 20. 13.

He who smites a man so that he die, he shall surely be put to death, etc. If
a man come presumptuously upon his neighbor to slay him with guile, thou shall
take him, etc. that he may die, Exodus 21, 12, 13, 14. Levit. 24. 17.

If a thief be found breaking, up and be smitten, that he die, there shall be
no blood shed for him, etc. Exodus 22. 2, 3.

If he smite him with an instrument of iron, so that he die, etc. or with
throwing a stone, etc. or with an instrument of wood wherewith he may die, and
he die, he is a murderer, the murderer shall surely be put to death, etc. If he
thrust him of hatred, or hurl at him by laying of wait, that he die; or in
enmity smite him with his hand, that he die, he who smote him shall surely be
put to death, etc. He is a murderer, etc. But if he thrust him suddenly without
enmity, or have cast upon him without lying in in wait, or with any stone
wherewith he may die, seeing him not, and cast upon him that he die, and was
not his enemy, sought his harm: Then the Congregation shall judge and deliver
the slayer out of the hands of the avenger of blood, etc. The murderer shall be
put to death by the mouth of witnesses; but one witness shall not testify
against any person to die. Moreover ye shall take no satisfaction for the life
of a murderer, but he shall be surely put to death, etc. So shall ye not
pollute the land wherein ye are, for blood defiles the land, and the land
cannot be cleansed of the blood that (...) shed therein, ( or, there can be no
expiation for th^^and) but by the blood of him who shed it, Numb. 35. 16, 17,
etc. Deuteronomy. 19. 4, 5, 6, 10, 11, 12, 13.

When David had met with Saul (who was pursuing his life) upon an advantage in
the Cave, and might have slain him, and moved thereto, yet refused, and said,
The Lord avenge me, but mine hand shall not be upon thee, 1 Samuel 24. 12, 13.
chapter 26. 9, 10, 11.

David's Murder of Uriah, and Judgments from God on David's House for it, 2 Samuel 11. chapter 12.

The Murdering of Naboth threatened, and punished upon Ahab's House, 1 Kings 21.
chapter 22. 38.

Surely at the commandment of the Lord came this upon Judah, to remove out of
his sight for the sins of Manasseth, etc. and for the innocent blood that he
shed: For he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood which the Lord would not
pardon, 2 Kings 24. 2, 3, 4.

The murderer rises with the light, kills the poor and needy, and in the
night is as a thief, Job 24. 14. Psalm 10. 4, 8.

Deliver me from blood-guiltiness, O God, thou God of my salvation, etc. Psalm
51. 14. 2 Samuel 11.

They sleep not except they have done some mischief: and their sleep is taken
away, except they cause some to fall, Prove. 4. 16, 17.

Will ye steal, murder, etc. and come and stand before me in this house which
is called by my name, Jer. 7. 9, 10.

The Mariners when they were to cast out Jonah into the Sea, prayed to God,
That they might not perish for his life, and that God would not lay innocent
blood to their charge, Jonah 1. 14.

The Barbarians thought that Vengeance would not suffer a Murderer to live,
Acts 28. 3, 4.

Love one another, not as Cain, who was of that wicked one, and slew his
brother; and wherefore slew he him? because his own works were evil, and his
brother's righteous, etc. Whosoever hates his brother, is a murderer; and ye
know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him, 1 John 3. 11, 12, 15.

Out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, etc. Matthew. 15. 19.

You are of your father the Devil, etc. he was a murderer from the beginning,
John 8. 44.

Such who were dreadfully plagued, yet repented not of their murders, etc. Rev.
9. 21.

All murderers, etc. shall have their portion in the lake which burns with
fire and brimstone, etc. Rev. 21. 8.
