Without are dogs, etc. murderers, etc. Rev. 22. 15.

CHAP. LXII.
Of Adulteries.
ABraham and Jacob, by the consent of their Wives, went in unto their Maidens,
and had Children by them, Genesis 16, 1, 2, etc. chapter 30. 1, 2, etc.

Abimelech sent and took Sarah, Abram's Wife, but God came to Abimelech in a
dream, etc. and said unto him, Behold thou art a dead man, for the woman which
thou have taken, for she is a man's wife: But Abimelech had not come near her,
etc. He said, In the innocence of my hands have I done this: And God said, etc.
I know, etc. therefore did I not suffer thee to touch her. Now therefore
restore the man his wife, etc. if not, thou shall surely die, Genesis 20, 2, 3, 4,
5, 6, 7.

Abimelech saw Isaac sporting with Rebecca his wife, etc. Abimelech called
Isaac, and said, Of a surety she is thy wife; how said thou she is my sister?
etc. What is this thou have done unto us? One of the people might lightly have
lien with thy wife, and thou should have brought guiltiness upon us.
Abimelech charged all people, saying, He who touches this man or his wife,
shall surely be put to death, Genesis 26. 8, 9, 10, 11.

Reuben went and lay with Bilhah his Father's Concubine, Genesis 35. 22. chapter 49.
3, 4.

When Potiphar's Wife tempted Joseph to have lain with her, he answered her, My
master, etc. has kept back nothing from me but thee, because thou art his
wife: how then can I do this great wickedness, and sin against God? And it came
to pass as she spoke to Joseph day by day that he hearkened not to her to lie
by her, to be with her, etc. she caught him by his garment, saying, Lie with
me; and he left his garment in her hand, and was fled forth, etc. Genesis 39. 7,
8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13.

Thou shall not commit adultery, Exodus 20. 14.

The man who commits adultery with man's wife, that commits adultery with
his neighbor's wife, the adulterer and adulteress shall surely be put to
death, Levit. 20. 10.

David's adultery with the wife of Uriah, and God's greater displeasure against
him for it, 2 Samuel 11. chapter 12.

The eye also of the adulterer waits for the twilight, saying, No eye shall
see me, and distinguishes his face, etc. Job 24. 15.

If my heart have been deceived by a woman, or I have laid wait at my
neighbor's door, let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon
her: for this is a heinous crime, etc. It Is a fire which consumes to
destruction, and would root out all my increase, etc. Job 31. 9, 10, 11, 12.

By means of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piece of bread, and the
adulteress will hunt for the precious life. Can a man take fire into his bosom,
and his clothes not be burned? etc. so he who goes into his neighbor's wife:
Whosoever touches her, shall not be innocent, etc. Whosoever commits
adultery with a woman, lacks understanding; he, etc. destroys his own soul;
a wound and dishonor shall he get, and his reproach shall not be wiped away:
for jealousy the rage of man, therefore he will not spare in the day of
vengeance, etc. Prove. 6, 27, 28, 29, 32, 33, 34, 35.

See the f^^tering and enticing Words and Language of an adulterous woman,
whereby she deceives the foolish man, Prove. 7. 7, 8, 9, etc. to the 21.

Such is the way of an adulterous woman, she eats and wipeth her mouth, and
faith, I have done no wickedness, Prove. 30. 20.

Will ye, etc. commit adultery, etc. and stand in this house before me? etc.
Jer. 4. 9.

Because they have committed villainy in Israel, and have committed adultery
with their neighbors wives, etc. I know and am witness, says the Lord, etc.
Jer. 29. 23.

How shall I pardon thee? etc. When I fed them to the full, they then committed
adultery, and assembled themselves by troops in the harlo^^ houses. They were
as fed horses in the morning; every one neighing after his neighbor's wife.
Shall I not visit for these things, says the Lord; and shall not my soul be
avenged of such a nation as this? etc. Jer. 5. 7, 8, 9.

The Lord has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land, because, etc.
by swearing, etc. committing of adultery they break out, etc. therefore shall
the land mourn, etc. Hosea 4. 1, 2, 3.

Whosoever shall put away his wife, except it be for fornication, and shall
marry another; commits adultery; and whosoever marries her which is put away,
commits adultery, Matthew. 19. 9. Mark 10. 9, 10, 11, 12, 19.

Let not the wife depart from the husband; but, and if she depart, let her
remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband, and let not the husband put
away his wife, etc. 1 Cor. 7. 10, 11.

Be not deceived, neither fornicators, etc. nor adulterers, etc. shall inherit
the kingdom of God, 1 Cor. 6. 9, 10.

The works of the flesh are manifest, which are adultery, fornication,
uncleanness, etc. I tell you, that they who do such things shall not inherit
the kingdom of God, Gal. 5. 19, 20, 21. Ephesians. 5. 5, 6. Col. 3. 5, 6.

Out of the heart proceeds evil thoughts, etc. adultery, etc. Matthew. 15. 19.

Whosoever looks on a woman to ^^st after her, has committed adultery with
her already in his heart, Matthew. 5. 28.

Jesus said unto the woman taken in adultery, etc. Go thy way, and sin no more,
etc. John 8. 11.

Let us walk honestly as in the day, not in chambering and wantonness, etc.
Romans 13. 13.

Whoremongers and adulterers God will judge, Hebr. 13. 14.

Their eyes are full of adultery, they cannot cease to sin, 2 Pet. 2. 14.

CHAP. LXIII.
Of Drunkenness.
AND Noah, etc. drunk of the wine and was drunken, and he was uncovered within
his tent, Genesis 9. 21.

Lot's Daughters made him drink Wine, so that they lay with him, and he know
not when they lay down, nor when they arose from him, Genesis 19. 32, 33, etc.

This our son is, etc. a glutton and a drunkard, and all the men of the city
shall stone him, Deuteronomy. 21. 18, 19, 20, 21.

That he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk,
etc. to add drunkenness to thirst. The Lord will not spare him.

Nabal's heart was merry within him, for he was very drunken, etc. 1 Samuel 25.
36.

When David had called Uriah, etc. he made him drunk, etc. 2 Samuel 11. 12, 13.

When Elah was drinking himself drunk in his house, etc. Zimri smote and killed
him, 1 Kings 16. 8, 9, 10.

Benhadad was drinking himself drunk in the Pavilion, when Israel came and slew
the Assyrians with a great slaughter, etc. 1 Kings 20. 16, 17, 18, 19, 20.

And they gave drink in vessels of gold, etc. and royal wine in abundance, and
the drinking according to law none did compel: for the king had appointed to
all the officers of his house, that they should do according unto every (...)
pleasure, Hester 1. 7, 8.

They who sat in the gate spoke against me: I am the long of the drunkards (
or, drinkers of drink) Psalm 69. 12.

Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging; whosoever is deceived hereby is not
wise, Prove. 20. 1.

Be not amongst wine bibbers, nor amongst riotous eaters of flesh, etc. for the
drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty, Prove. 23. 2, 20, 21.

It is not for kings to drink wine, etc. lest they drink and forget the law,
and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted, Prove. 31. 4, 5.

Woe unto them who rise up early in the morn, that they may follow strong drink:
who continue until night till wine inflame them, etc. Woe to the mighty to drink
mine, and men of strength to mingle strong drink, Isa. 5. 11, 22.

The earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, etc. Isa. 24. 20.

They also have erred through wine, and through strong drink are out of the
way: the Priest and the Prophet have erred through strong drink, they are
swallowed up of wine: they are out of the way through strong drink, they err in
vision: they stumble in judgment; for all their tables are full of vomit and
filthiness, etc. Isa. 28. 7. 8.

His watchmen are blind, etc. Come ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we
will fill our selves with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as this day, and
much more abundant, Isa. 56. 10. 11, 12.

Awake ye drunkards, weep and house all ye drunkards of wine; because of the
new wine, because it is cut off from your mouth, Joel 1. 5.

Woe to them who are at ease in Zion, etc. who drink wine in bowls, etc. Amos 6.
1, 6.

While they are drunken as drunkards, they shall be devoured, Nahum. 1. 10.

Woe unto him who gives his neighbor drink, who puts thy bottle to him, and
make drunken also, that thou may look on their nakedness, Habak. 2. 15.

But if that evil servant, etc. shall begin to smite his fellow servants, and
eat and drink with the drunken. The Lord of that servant shall come, etc.
Matthew. 24. 48, 49, 50. Luke 12. 45.

Others mocking said, Those men are full of new wine. But Peter, etc. said,
etc. These are not drunken, as ye suppose, seeing it is but the third hour of
the day, etc. Acts 2. 13, 14, 15.

Let us walk honestly as in the day, not in rioting and drunkenness, etc. Romans
13. 13.

I have written to you not to keep company, etc. if any man who is called
brother be, etc. a drunkard, etc. with such a one no not to eat, 1 Cor. 5. 11.

Be not deceived; neither fornicators, etc. nor drunkards, etc. shall inherit
the kingdom of God, 1 Cor. 6. 9, 10. Ephesians. 5. 21.

One is hungry, another is drunken, etc. 1 Cor. 11. 21.

Be not drunk with wine wherein is excess, but be filled with the Spirit, etc.
Ephesians 5. 8.

They who are drunk, are drunken in the night; but let us who are of the day be
sober, etc. 1 These 5. 7, 8.

CHAP. LXIV.
Great Outward Privileges, nor our own Righteousness alone, will be our
Security against Judgments here, or Damnation for ever. No Cause of Boasting in
these only.
WHat nation so great, who has God so nigh unto them as the Lord our God, in
all that we call upon him for? And what Nation so great, that has Statutes,
etc. so righteous as all this law? Only take heed, and keep thy soul
diligently, lest thou forget the things thine eyes have seen, etc. left ye
corrupt, and make you a graven image, etc. le^t ye forget the covenant, etc.
For the Lord thy God is a consuming fire, etc. When, etc. ye shall do evil in
the light of the Lord, to provoke him to anger, etc. ye shall soon utterly
perish from off the land, etc. be utterly destroyed, etc. Ask of the days past,
etc. Did ever people I ear the voice of God, speaking out of the midst of the
fire, as thou have heard, and live? Or has God essayed to go and take him a
nation from the midst of a nation, by tentations, by signs? etc. Because he
loved thy fathers, he chose their feed after them, and brought them out in his
sight, with his mighty power, etc. Thou shall therefore keep his statutes,
Deuteronomy. 4. 7, 8, 9, 10, 16, 23, 24, 25, 26, 27, 33, 34, 36, 37, 40.

Speak not thou in thine heart, after the Lord has cast them out from before
thee, saying, for my righteousness, the Lord has brought me into possess this
good land: but for the wickedness of these nations, etc. not for thy
righteousness, nor for the uprightness of thine heart, do thou go to possess
their land: but for the wickedness, etc. the Lord thy God does drive them out,
etc. And that he may perform the word which the Lord swore unto thy rathers
Abraham, etc. the Lord thy God gives thee not this good land to possess it for
thy righteousness: for a stiff-necked people, etc. Deuteronomy. 9. 4, 5, 6, 7, etc.

To the wicked, God says, What have thou to do to declare my statutes, or that
thou should ^ake my Covenant into thy mouth, seeing thou harest instruction,
and castest my words behind thee, etc. Psalm. 50. 16, 17, 18.

To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices unto me, says the Lord, I
am full of the bur^t-offerings, etc. who has required this at your hands, to
tread my Courts, etc.? bring no more vain oblations, incense is an abomination
to me; the new moon and sabboths; the calling of assemblies, I cannot away with
it, etc. they are a trouble to me, I am weary to bear them, when you make many
prayers, I will not hear, etc. your hands are full of blood, wash you, make you
clean, etc. Isa. 1. 11, 12, 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18. Jer. 6. 19, 20.

We are all an unclean thing, and all our righteousness as filthy rags, Isa.
64. 6.

He who kills an ox, is as if he slew a man: he who sacrifices a lamb, as if
he cut off a dog's neck, etc. They have chosen their own ways, etc. Isa. 66. 3.

Trust ye not in lying words, saying. The temple of the Lord, the temple of the
Lord, etc. If ye thoroughly amend your ways, etc. then will I cause you to dwell
in this place, etc. Behold, ye trust in lying words, which cannot profit. Will
ye steal, murder, etc. and come and stand before me in this house? etc.
Therefore I will do to this house, which is called by my name, wherein ye
trust, etc. as I have done to Shiloh: and. Jer. 7. 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12,
14, 15.

When I say to the righteous, he shall surely live; if he trust in his own
righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his righteousness shall not be
remembered, etc. he shall die, Ezekiel. 33. 13, 18. chapter 23, 38, 39.

I hate and despise your feast-days, and will not smell in your solemn
assemblies. Though ye offer me burnt-offerings, and your meat offerings, I will
not accept of them, etc. Let judgment run down as waters, etc. Amos 5. 21, to
26.

Hear this, etc. ye heads of the house of Jacob, and princes of the house of
Israel; who abhor judgment, and pervert all equity, etc. The heads thereof
judge for reward; and the priests thereof teach for hire, etc. Yet will they
lean upon the Lord, and say, Is not the Lord amongst us? none evil can come
upon us. Therefore shall Zion for your sakes be plowed, etc. Micah. 3. 9, to 13.

Bring forth fruit meet for repentance: and think not to say within your
selves, We have Abraham for our father. etc. Matthew. 3. 8, 9, 10. Luke 3. 8.

Many will say to me in that day, Lord, Lord; Have we not prophesied in thy
name? and in thy name cast out devils? and in thy name done many wondrous
works? And then will I profess to them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye
who work iniquity, Matthew. 7. 21, 22, 23.

Whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and sister, and
mother, Mark 3. 33, 35.

I know not whence you are. Then shall ye begin to say, We have eat and drank
in thy presence; and thou have taught in our streets. But he shall say, I tell
you, I know you not, whence you are: depart from me, all ye workers of
iniquity, etc. Luke 13. 25, 26, 27.

Jesus said to the Pharisees, Ye are they who justify your selves before men;
but God knows your hearts: for that which is highly esteemed amongst man, is an
abomination in the sight of God, Luke 16, 14, 15.

When ye have done all those things which ye are commanded, say, We are
unprofitable servants, we have done that which was our duty to do, Luke 17. 10.

The Pharisee stood, etc. and said, O God, I thank thee I am not as other men
are; extortioners, etc. I fast twice in the week: I give tithes of all I
possess. And the Publican standing afar off, would not lift up so much as his
eyes to heaven; but sinote upon his breast, saying, God be merciful to me, a
sinner. I tell you, this man went down to his house justified, rather than the
other, etc. Luke 18. 10, to 15.

Then said Jesus, etc. If ye continue in my word, etc. the truth shall make you
free. They answered him, We be Abram's seed, and were never in bondage to any
man: How say thou, Ye shall be made free? Jesus said, etc. Whosoever
commits sin, is the servant of sin. I know ye are Abraham's seed: but ye
seek to kill me, etc. They said, Abraham is our father. Jesus said, If ye were
Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham, etc. They said, We are
not born of fornication; we have one father, even God. Jesus said unto them, If
God were your father, ye would love me, etc. Ye are of your father, there the
devil; and the lusts of your father ye will do, John 6. 31, 32, 33, 37, 39, 41,
42, 45.

Behold, thou art called a Jew, restest in the law and make thy boast of God,
and know, etc. and art confident that thou thy self art a guide to the
blind, an instructor, etc. Do thou steal? etc. Thou make the boast of thy
law: Through breaking the law, dishonourest thou God? Romans 2. 17, 18, 19, 20,
21, 22, 23, 28, 29.

Therefore by the deeds of the law shall no flesh be justified in his sight,
Romans 3. 20. Gal. 2. 16.

They have a Zeal of God, but not according to knowledge: for they being
ignorant of God's righteousness, and going about to establish their own
righteousness, have not submitted themselves to the righteousness of God, etc.
Romans 10. 2, 3.

If a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceives
himself, etc. Gal. 6.

If any other man thinks he has, whereof he may trust in the flesh; I more,
circumcised on the eighth day, etc. I count all things but loss, etc. that I
may win Christ, and be found in him; not having mine own righteousness which is
of the law; out that which is through the faith of Christ, etc. Philip. 3. 3,
to 10.

Whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, is guilty of
all, etc. James 2. 10, 11.

The Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost, Luke 19. 10.

CHAP. LXV.
Of Words, Sayings and Doings, neither true nor good, spoken and done on
Politic Grounds, to effect Things designed, or prevent Dangers.
ABraham said of his Wife, (when he was in fear,) She is my sister, Genesis 20. 2,
11, 12.

Isaac (in the like fear) said of his Wife, She is my sister, Genesis 26. 7, 9.

Rebeccah put her Son Jacob to go to Isaac for the Blessing, and clothed him
with his Brother's Garments, and put Skins upon his Neck and Hands, to make him
feel rough to Isaac, that Isaac might think him to be Esau, and bless him: And
Jacob said to his Father, (being asked who he was,) I am Esau, thy firstborn,
etc. Isaac said, Art thou my very son Esau? And he said, I, etc. Genesis 27. 9,
10, to 29.

Rachel having hid her Father's Images under the Camels Furniture, and sat on
them, when Laban searched for them, she said unto her Father, Let not it
displease my lord that I cannot rise up before thee; for the custom of women is
upon me, etc. Genesis 31. 34, 35.

And the Sons of Jacob answered Shechem, and Homer, his Father, deceitfully,
etc. They said unto them, We cannot give our sister to one who is
uncircumcised, etc. If every male of you will be circumcised, then will we give
our daughters, etc. Which when they had done, Jacob's Sons tell on them, and
slew them, Genesis 34. 12, 13, 14, etc.

When Joseph's Brethren saw that their Father was dead, they said, Joseph will,
peradventure, hate us, and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did
unto him. And they sent messengers to Joseph, saying, Thy father did command
before he died, saying, So shall ye say to Joseph: Forgive, I pray thee now,
the trespasses of thy brethren, and their sin: for they did unto thee evil,
etc. And Joseph wept when he heard it, etc. Genesis 50. 15, 16, 17.

When Pharaoh had charged the Midwives with breaking his Commands, and saving
the Men-children alive, they said unto him, Because the Hebrew women are not as
the Egyptian women: for they are lively, and are delivered ere the midwives
come in unto them. Therefore God dealt well with the midwives, etc. Exodus 1.
16, to 21.

When Rahab had hid the Spies, and the King had sent for them, she said, There
came men unto me, but I wist not whence, etc. when it was dark the men went
out: whither, etc. I wot not: pursue after them quickly, for ye shall overtake
them.

But she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them, etc.
Joshua 2. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6.

When the Inhabitants of Gibeen came to Joshua, they took old Sacks, etc. and
said to Joshua, We be come from a far country: now therefore make ye a league
with us, etc. from a very far country thy servants are come, because of the
name of the Lord thy God; for we have heard the same of him, and all that he
did in Egypt, etc. Wherefore our elders, and all the inhabitants of our
country, spoke unto us, saying, Take victuals, etc. This our bread we took hot
on the day we came forth, etc. but now, behold, it is dry, and it is moldy,
etc. by reason of the very long journey, etc. And Joshua made peace with them,
etc. and smote them not, because the princes of the congregation had sworn unto
them, etc. Josh. 9. 3, 4, 5, etc.

When the Moabites oppressed Israel, the Lord raised them up a Deliverer; Ebud,
etc. Who going to Eglon, the King of Moab, with a Present from Israel; after he
had presented it, he said, I have a secret errand unto thee, O king: Who said,
Keep silence. And all etc. went out. And Ehud came unto him, and he was sitting
in a summerparlour, etc. and said unto him, I have a message from God, unto
thee: and he arose out of his seat. And Ehud took the dagger, etc. and thrust
it into his belly, etc. Judges 3. 14, to 22.

Sampson said several times, That if they did bind him, etc. he should be weak,
and be as another man: But it was not so, Judges 16. 6, 7, etc.

When God said to Samuel, that he would send him to ano^nt David, Samuel said,
How can I go? If Saul hear, he will kill me. And the Lord said, Take a heifer
with thee, and say, I am come to sacrifice to the Lord: And call Jesse to the
sacrifice, etc. Which Samuel did; and said, I am come to sacrifice to the Lord,
1 Samuel 16. 1, to 7.

When Saul had sent for David, Michal his Wife put an Image in the Bed, etc.
covered it with a Cloth after she had sent him away; and she said, He is sick,
etc. When Saul had said unto her, Why have thou deceived me? etc. She said, He
said unto me, Let me go? Why should I kill thee? 1 Samuel* 19. 11, to 19.

When Saul had a Design to have killed David, and had enquired of him, Jonathan
answered, (as David had directed him to do,) and said, David earnestly asked of
me to go to Bethlehem: and he said, Let me go, I pray thee: for our family has
a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he has commanded me: and now, if I
have found favor in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my
brethren: Therefore he comes not to the king's table, 1 Samuel 20. 6, 27, 28, 29.

David, when he fled from Saul, and came to Abimelech the Priest, he asked him,
Why art thou alone? David said, etc. The king has commanded me a business, and
has said unto me, Let no man know any thing of the business, etc, And I have
appointed servants to such and such a place, etc. Is not under thine hand,
spear or sword; for I have neither brought my sword, etc. because the king's
business required haste, etc, 1 Samuel 21. 1, 2 3, 8, 15.

When David and his men had invaded the country near him, and slain all, and
Achish said to him, Whither have ye made a Road to day? And David said, Against
the south of Judah, etc. And Achish believed David; saying, He has made his
people Israel to abhor him, etc. 1 Samuel 27. 8, to 13.

When Absalom designed to rebel, he said unto the King. I pray thee, let me go
and pey my now, which I have vowed unto the Lord in Hebron: for thy servant
vowed, etc. while I abode at Geshur in Syria; saying, If the Lord shall bring
me again indeed to Jerusalem, then I will serve the Lord, 2 Samuel 15. 6, 7, 8,
9, 10, etc.

Jehu gathered all the People together, and said unto them, Ahab served Baal a
little; Jehu shall serve him much: Now therefore call to me all the prophets of
Baal, all his servants, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a
great sacrifice to Baal, etc. But Jehu did it in Sub^^ity, to the intent that
he might destroy the worshippers of Baal, etc. which afterward he did, 2 Kings
10. 18, to 26.

CHAP. LXVI.
Of Words or Sayings expressive of Choice only, not Binding.
ABraham said to the Angel, Behold now, my Lord, turn in, I pray you, into your
servant's house, and tarry all night, etc. And they said, Nay, but we will
abide in the street. And he pressed upon them greatly; and they turned in unto
him, and entered his house; and he made them a feast, etc. Genesis 18. 1, to 5.

When the Sons of the Prophets had said to Elisha, etc. There be with thy
servants fifty strong men ^et them go, we pray thee, and seek thy master, etc.
And he said, Ye shall not send. And when they urged him till he was ashamed, he
said, Send. And they sent, etc. 2 Kings 2. 14, 15, 16.

When Jesus was about to wash Peter's Feet, Peter said, Thou shall never wash
my feet. Jesus answered him, saying, Unless I wash thy feet, thou shall have no
communion with me. Then Peter, said, Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands
and head, John 13. 8, 9.

CHAP. LXVII.
Of Sensible, Sick, Lost Sinners; Hungry, Thirsty and Longing Souls; such whom
Christ came to seek, heal, satisfy, and love.
HE satisfies the longing soul: and fills the hungry soul with goodness,
Psalm. 107. 9.

The full soul loatheth the honeycomb: but to the hungry soul, every bitter
thing is sweet, Prove 20. 24.

When the poor and needy seek water, and there is none, and their tongue fail
for thirst, I the Lord will hear them, etc. I will open rivers in high places,
etc. Isa. 41. 17, 18.

Ho, every one who thirsts: come ye to the waters, etc. hearken ye diligently
unto me, and eat ye that which is good, Isa. 55. 1, 2.

Blessed are they who hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they shall be
filled, Matthew. 5. 6.

They who are whole, need not a physician: but they who are sick. I came not to
call the righteous: but sinners to repentance, Matthew. 9. 12, 13.

Come unto me, all ye who labor, and are heavy laden; and I will give you
rest. Take my yoke upon you, etc. and ye shall find rest unto your souls, etc.
Matthew. 11. 28, 29. Psalm. 34. 9, 10.

He has filled the hungry with good things: and the rich he has sent empty
away, Luke 1. 53.

The Son of man is come to seek and to save that which was lost, Luke 19, 1, to
11.

He who comes unto me, shall never hunger: and he who believes on me, shall
never thirst, John 6. 35.

When they heard this, they were pricked in the heart, and said, etc. Men and
brethren, What shall we do? etc. Repent, and be baptized every one of you, in
the name of Christ, for the remission of sins: and ye shall receive the gift of
the Holy Ghost, etc. Acts 2. 37, 38.

The Jailer trembled, etc. and said, Sirs, What must I do to be saved? And they
said, Believe on the Lord Jesus, and thou shall be saved, and thine house, Acts
16. 29, 30, 31.

If any man lack wisdom, let him ask of God; who gives to all men liberally,
and upbraideth not: and it shall be given him, James 1. 5.

I will give unto him who is athirst, of the fountain of the water of life
freely, Rev. 21. 6.

And let him who is athirst come: and whose ever will, let him take of the
water of life freely, Rev. 22. 17.

CHAP. LXVIII.
Of Man's Ignorance of the Men and Things of this World, after his Departure
hence.
THou destroyest the hope of man: thou prevailest for ever against him, and he
passes: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away: his sons come to
honor, and he knows it not: and they are brought low, and he perceives not
of them, Job 14. 19, 20, 21.

The dead know not any thing, etc. they have no more a portion in any thing
done under the sun, Eccles. 9. 5, 6.

Doubtless, thou art our Father; though Abraham be ignorant of us; and Israel
knows us not, Isa. 63. 16.

CHAP. LXIX.
Of Mary (the Mother of our Lord, according to the Flesh) having Children by
her Husband Joseph.
I Am become a stranger to my brethren, an alien to my mother's children, etc.
Psalm. 69. 7.

Then Joseph, etc. took unto him his wife, and knew her not till she had
brought forth her firstborn Son, Matthew. 1. 24, 25.

While he yet talked to the people, his mother and his brethren stood without,
desiring to speak with him. Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy
brethren stand without, desiring to speak with thee, Matthew. 12. 47, 48. Mark 3.
31, to 35.

Is not this the Carpenter's Son? Is not his mother called Mary? And his
brethren, James, and Joses, and Simon, and Judas? And his sisters, Are not they
with us? Whence then has this man these things? Matthew. 13. 55, 56.

She brought forth her firstborn Son, etc. When Jesus was twelve years old,
Joseph and his mother went to Jerusalem; and returning back missed him, etc.
They sought him amongst their kinsfolk and acquaintance, etc. Luke 2. 7, 42,
43, 44. Matthew. 1. 25.

After this, he went down to Capernaum; he, and his mother, and his brethren,
and his disciples; and he continued there, etc. John 2. 12.

His brethren therefore said unto him, Depart hence, and go into Judea, etc.
For neither did his brethren believe in him, etc. But when his brethren were
gone up, then went he also up unto the feast, etc. John 7. 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10.

These all continued with one accord, etc. with the women, and Mary the mother
of Jesus, and with his brethren, Acts 1. 14.

I went up, etc. to see Peter, etc. But other Apostles saw I none, save James,
the Lord's brother, Gal. 1. 18, 19.
